text: The room was very clean and attractive. Small, but that's normal for NYC. What really set the place apart was the extremely friendly and helpful staff. Wow! They were so happy to assist with anything needed and were very warm and friendly. Everyone was great and Derek and Rumel especially went above and beyond.

title: Excelente opción cerca de todo
text: Me sorprendió muy bien este hotel en Avenida Lexington, en una ubicación cercana a muchos de los lugares emblemáticos de NY City. Todas las personas que trabajan en el hotel son muy cordiales y atentas a las necesidades de los pasajeros. Me tocó una habitación muy silenciosa y amplia en planta baja, donde pudimos descansar muy bien. El desayuno es sencillo pero muy satisfactorio. Si pudiera proponer alguna mejora, sería en poner más frutas en el desayuno, para los que gustan de esta opción. Por lo demás, es limpio, agradable, bien ubicado, y con una atención excelente. Muy bien la relación calidad precio.

title: Great place to stay in mid-town Manhattan
text:
Enjoyed this boutique hotel oasis in the Murray Hill area of Manhattan. The room was not large but the bed was comfortable and linens very crisp and clean. 
The staff above all were super nice and friendly. 

We would definitely stay again!

title: Great staff, great location
text:
Hotel is located in Midtown with restaurants, sights, and Metro stop nearby.  Modern look, good sized room, free WiFi and continental breakfast.  Staff are welcoming, helpful with daily planning, and excited to ensure you have the best experience inside the hotel and out.
No coffeemakers in room but a call to the front desk and you'll have a fresh hot cup delivered to your room within minutes.

title: Hotel pulito e accogliente
text: Abbiamo soggiornato a novembre trovando anche due giornate calde, l'albergo e' pulito, potete ordinare the,caffe' e cioccolata gratuitamente in camera. Alla reception c'e' rumel gentilissimo, ci ha stampato i biglietti per i knicks gratuitamente. Ci tornermo sicuramente. Grazie a tutto la staff!!

title: Awesome boutique hotel in Murray Hill
text: Can't recommend this hotel enough.  Great location on Lexington between between 25th and 26th Street.  Immediately upon arrival, we were informed that our room had been upgraded, which was a great way to start our vacation. The hotel is super chill and not in the slightest bit pretentious.  Our room was very nice and had everything that we could possibly want and/or need.  Special shout out to Rumel, Maurice and Derek in the front desk.  These guys were not only cool and super friendly but also extremely helpful, accommodating and knowledgeable.  I hope management realizes what a valuable asset it has in these three employees.  Will definitely be back and will also recommend this property to all my family and friends.  Keep up the good work.

title: Super Friendly Boutique Hotel
text: Good location on Lexington and 27th. Clean and friendly. Just a hotel but a lot of restaurants and bars in walking distance. Parking around the corner in garage. A lot of perks: wifi, chocolate, water, continental breakfast, authentic team members to help you find anything. I found this place on a random search but at $250 all in - a value in NYC. Room size is fine and bathroom was very clean.

title: Un hotel para vivir la ciudad.
text:
Estuve 5 noches en este hotel junto con mi pareja de luna de miel.

Es el hotel perfecto si tu idea es patear toda la ciudad, ya que su ubicación es ideal (en los inicios del Midtown), hecho que permite que puedas recorrer la parte del lower (ir en metro y volver a pie o al revés) o ir a pie tranquilamente hasta la zona del upper. 
Esta a 10 min. de la Onu, del Chrysler, Estación Central, etc. 

La habitación es perfecta, ya que solo vas a dormir en ella. Puedes subir comida (debajo mismo hay un subway o a 3 min hay un shake shack. Al rededor hay buenos restaurantes pero pican un poco más. El desayuno más que correcto (en la mayoría de hoteles no lo ofrecen).

Repetiría sin lugar a dudas.

title: Super friendly and helpful staff.  Good location
text: The rooms are small, but not unexpectedly so, and very clean.  In NYC you don't spend a lot of time in your room anyway.  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  The room heating is from a reverse-cycle air conditioning unit, which is fairly noisy, and is located quite close to the bed (because the rooms are small).  This might disturb some sleepers.  This is quite minor, but the sheets on the bed seemed to be not big enough to go around the foot of the mattress, which means that they were almost always in a ball by morning.  On the plus side, the housekeeping staff were very accommodating in allowing us to sleep off our jet lag in the mornings.   As a result, we didn't make it downstairs for the free breakfast on any of the four mornings.   We would stay there again for sure.

title: Sub-par. Not ok.
text: Ancient filthy air conditioner sounds like an airplane. No table in the room! Staff were friendly but kept postponing helping me get another room. 'Please speak to the night manager.' 'Please to the morning manager.' Elevators are a joke. Mobs waiting to go up and down. I finally abandoned hope and took the stairs several flights every day.

title: What a Gem
text: Great boutique hotel. Clean, modern and quiet. Derek and the rest of the staff were excellent. Incredibly friendly front desk that went out of their way to meet our needs. I haven't had customer service like this in years. A++

title: Reunion
text: We booked the hotel because is around the corner from our son's apartment.  The location could not have been more convenient.  The hotel does not have bells and whistles but, it does have a very friendly, professional staff.  Our room on the 6th floor was spacious and very clean.  The bed was very- very comfortable which is a great plus after a long walking day.  The hotel  gets you going in the morning, with a simple and limited breakfast:  coffee, tea, few pastries and a banana, apple or orange; small but, much appreciated.  They offer free Wi Fi - which not many hotels in this big city offer. The hotel is close to subway and bus stops.   Our stay at The Lex was a week long and pleasant.  Yes, we would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Staff
text:
Thank you to the Front Lobby/check in Staff.
Derek your recommendations for dinner and assistance with departure, was 5 star service.
Room was small and no roll away was available. They assisted to solve my problem with addition of enough pillows and blankets to make a very coffe extra bed for one.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
The staff, accommodations, and location were perfect for a trip to New York.  It all started when they stored our luggage when we arrived from the airport.  They  called us on the phone when our room was ready (way ahead of schedule.)

The hotel was new.   Everything was bright and clean.  The elevator was fast, the bathroom clean, large, and modern.

The front desk staff were helpful and gave great suggestions about what to do, where to eat, and how to get there.

The location is right in the middle of everything, but in a neighborhood, not in a crowded area.  It was easy to get to the subway and to every part of the city.  The area around the hotel was an established neighborhood with many places to eat without having to eat at a chain restaurant.

title: Gem far off the standard chains & business hotels ...
text:
We found "The Lex" checking out lufthansaholidays.com, searching for something beyond the US standard stuff (I am on business trips to the US quite often and fed up by the usual chains - sorry, no names here ;-), booking it after x-checks (hotel internet site, tripadvisor, others).
We were not disapponited and can confirm the super-positive ratings here: Extremly friendly and helpful front desk (Nari & Michelle who welcomed us, together with Rumel, Derek and Maurice), very clean and well maintained, good size of rooms (no ball room but completely sufficient), good start-out breakfast, and good location (Lexington Av).
Additional remark: our room (601) was facing Lexington Av., we switched off AirCon, kept the window open and ... slept well (yes, this is no country-side-wellness-inn, but whoever lives in the center of a German city should be able to cope with it).
We can definitely recommend it !

title: Conforto e localização
text: O Lex NYC é muito bem localizado, com praticamente todas as linhas de metrô passando por sua proximidade. O pessoal da recepção é muito atencioso, procurando resolver - até antecipadamente - eventuais problemas. Oferece café da manhã (continental) incluído na diária, o que é raro em Manhattan, e que me atendeu perfeitamente; a dica é acordar um pouco mais cedo e aparecer no lobby por volta de 8h. Fica em frente a um quartel da Guarda Nacional, o que me transmitiu uma sensação maior de segurança. Considerando os preços de Manhattan, achei que esse hotel tem um excelente custo-benefício.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: The LEX is an excellent hotel. We stayed for 6 nights all was great. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good service, nice breakfast, coffee and tea 24/7 available and last but not least great bed. Not to forget: very good location in the middle of NYC!!! Good value for money.

title: Excellent
text:
Just back from a fantastic stay at Lex Hotel NYC. 

Great location - away from the business of 5th Ave etc. But within a short walk of midtown and Union Sq and lots of other places worth visiting. 

The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and really make this Hotel a nice experience. 

Hotel in general is nicely done up and very clean and tidy. Room very comfortable and clean. 

Having wifi available even on the 7th floor was very handy. 

Breakfast is coffee, juices and pastries in the lobby and works very well. Perfect when you are busy with going out and about in NY!

Would absolutely recommend this Hotel!

title: Great hotel
text: I would like to express my gratitude to the front desk staff of Lex hotel – Maurice, Derek, Rumel and the other ladies (sorry, don't know their names). All gave us a homey feel and were absolutely great. Their attitude and willingness to help were outstanding and I definitely recommend this hotel. It's the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

title: Good hotel comparing to what you are paying
text:
I stayed in Lex Hotel in Oct 2016 with my wife. He just wanted the hotel to sleep as we spend all the day walking around the city. 
It's a good hotel comparing to what you are paying.
The location is good as well. 
The air condition wasn't good.
Mr. Maurice is very nice gentlmen and was very helpful :) !

title: Great Location, Great Staff
text: Perfect hotel for a short city break in NYC, ideally located within touching distance of all the major sites on Manhattan. Room was ideal (double bed, good shower / bathroom) and for the one issue that arose, the staff were on hand to help immediately. Big thanks to Maurice, Rumel, Michelle, & Nari on the front desk for being extremely friendly and helpful. If / when I come back to NYC I'll most likely stay here again. Thanks again guys!!!

title: Volveria a repetir
text: Estuvimos hospedados 6 días durante nuestro viaje de novios. La ubicación del hotel es perfecta justo en medio de Manhattan, muy próximo a la linea 6 de metro y se puede ir andando a diferentes lugares turisticos, a 30 min de Times Square. La habitación amplia y muy limpia, con diferentes detalles de higiene y además cada dia teniamos 2 botellas de agua, nos fueron genial ya que nos cogio una ola de calor. Un buen detalle lo del desayuno es sencillo pero va genial para coger fuerzas para patearse la ciudad. El personal fue muy amable y simpático, mencionar en especial a uno de los recepcionistas, Andres, nos ofrecio una atención excepcional orientandonos cada día para hacer nuestra ruta y aprovechar bien el tiempo. Cuando he vuelto lo he recomendado a todos los amigos que quieren ir a New York.

title: hotel con standard europei in centro
text: Come detto nel titolo questo hotel si trova a 5 minuti a piedi dal FLAT, a 10 dalla quinta e a 15 dalla grand central station e successiva Times Square. Avrete notato che trovare un hotel passabile per noi europei qui a Manhattan entro i 200 euro a notte ad ottobre è impossibile. Sotto questa cifra o hanno i servizi in comune o sono in quartieri rumorosissimi tipo china town,o hanno topi o altro. Invece il LEX è nuovissimo, offre una piccola colazione nella hall che per noi italiani va benissimo visto che non ci ingogizziamo come gli altri,pulitissimo,personale gentile e disponibilissimo ,possibilità di avere The e caffè a tutte le ore in camera gratis. Camera cozy 605 . grazie da Ale e Barbara

title: A convenient hotel
text:
Conveniently located hotel within walking distance of Times Square and all the shopping/ attractions around the area.
Downside, no coffee making facilities but a quick ring to reception or a chat with staff and you can get a coffee/ tea.
Continental breakfast included in the package and sets you up for the day. The beds are comfy, bathrooms spacious but very little storage space, most of our stuff is still in our suitcases. 
Lots of eateries in and around the area, including a deli next door if required.
As we are not spending a lot of time in the hotel,we are out exploring & enjoying the city,the room meets all of our needs.. AND I don't know what they are spraying in the room, but after a day out and about,when we return the room smells lush!
We are still here, 1 more night to go, I would definitely use the hotel again for an inexpensive and convenient place to stay

title: Love this place!
text:
This this has become my go to hotel when in New York City. Really convenient to the office, and the value for the money can't be beat! The front desk staff is always friendly, welcoming and helpful. For a boutique hotel the rooms are a good size. really clean, comfortable beds and modern decor. 

Also love the location. Really close to the flat iron building, warehouse district and fifth Avenue shopping. Great Indian restaurants very close by as well!

Book with confidence, this place is great!

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value,Wonderful Staff
text: Absolutely loved this hotel.  Great location, were able to walk everywhere.  Close to the subway.  Clean rooms with comfortable beds.  No frills but a great value for the price.  Bottled water in rooms, small continental breakfast and coffee and tea delivered to your room anytime were all nice touches.  The best part was the staff.  All were very friendly, welcoming, helpful.  Maurice gave us a warm welcome and gave us great recommendations on things to do.  Our room wasn't ready but he actually called us to notify us when the room was available.  Rumel also gave us great recommendations of things to do.  Because of them we were able to see and do so much in the three days we were there.  They helped us plan out our days very efficiently and mapped it out for us.  Rumel gave us excellent recommendations for places to eat.  He was spot on.  Rumel even booked our shuttle to the airport and prinedt our boarding passes.  The hotel staff really made a difference and made our stay wonderful.  Would definitely come back without question and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastisk service og perfekt beliggenhed
text:
Vi blev mødt af en yderst serviceminded Ramal i receptionen på ankomstdagen. Han gennemgik de vigtigste ting på et kort over NY samt forskellige tilbud hotellet kunne hjælpe med. Værelset var nyrenoveret og med altan (!) Der er 24 timers kaffe/te service direkte leveret til værelset. 
Vi har oplevet meget forskellig service på vores 3 uger lange tur rundt i Florida og NY, men denne service overgår alt.

title: Comfortable room near Gramercy Park
text: Just a very short walk from Gramercy Park, the Lex provides larger than expected rooms, a very courteous and helpful staff, and a lovely continental breakfast, all at a rate less than one pays for boring chains. I will be back. (Thank you again, Nari, for advising me the staff brings free and prepared tea and coffee to the rooms.)

title: Good service
text: Verry pleased with our stay, the straff were verry service orientated!! The only thing I would point out to a future visiter is that the breakfast consists of pasterys (so if you are a hungry morning person like me, you will need a second breakfast :))

title: Much Better than Expected
text: We needed a last minute hotel close to Beth Israel. Found this hotel on the web. Great surprise.Beautiful hotel. Huge room with a deck. Beautiful bathroom. Extremely clean and helpful staff. Breakfast included. Would stay here again in a heart beat. A great find cannot say enough how we were pleasantly surprised. Not cheap but not expensive by NYC standards.

title: Cozy and modern
text: From the moment we walked in, we could tell the Lex was something special. Maurice warmly welcomed us to the hotel, took our bags, and worked on getting our room ready even though we arrived before check-in.  The room is nice, clean, and spacious by NYC standards. Very cozy. Modern and not extravagant. Maurice's attention to detail and hospitality certainly adds to the positive experience.

title: Great find
text:
We stayed at the Lex for five days and really enjoyed it.  The "Cozy Queen" room really had plenty of space, there was almost no noise from the city or anyone else, the hotel super clean, the staff friendly, and the location in Midtown great steps from two subway lines.  You get free water every day, free wifi, and complimentary decent breakfast.
Especially for the price (and this is on the more affordable side in Manhattan), this place can't be beat.

title: Clean, friendly, no frills, great location.  I'll be back!
text: I stayed with a friend for the weekend, she was there all week. This is a small, boutique hotel so if you need room service, rollaways and a big breakfast buffet this is not your place.  If you want a clean, comfortable room and friendly helpful stuff in a great location this IS your place!  The room was not "built around" the queen bed.  We had plenty of room for walking around each other and all our stuff.  The bed was very comfortable with nice linens.  The bathroom was large by NYC standards and had good shower pressure.  Our room was on the 4th floor on a rear corner.  We had little to no street noise.  Most nights were very quiet.  I do think if you had a noisy person in the room next to you that you could hear them, we did only a few times.  Our room had a small balcony.  No view but extra space.  Coffe and small continental breakfast in the lobby each morning.  There is a small bodega next door and larger one just a block away.  Plenty of good, reasonably priced restaurants nearby.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  I want to call out Rymel specifically for his customer service.  The staff were able to quickly hail cabs, even on a rainy Monday morning.  They walked me to the cab holding an umbrella and ensured neither I nor my luggage got wet.  I expect that at the Intercontinental but was pleasantly surprised at it here.  I will be back.  Super clean!  Super friendly!  Great location in midtown close to tourist areas but not touristy.

title: Highly recommend!
text: The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Everyone of the employees that we encountered were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating.   Free continental breakfast was available every morning.  They even provided complimentary bottled water everyday, such as nice touch, and very appreciated!  We would book here again.

title: hotel consigliato
text: Camere piccole ma carine, posizione buona, pulizia giornaliera, aria condizionata, wi-fi buono, colazione inclusa nel prezzo servita nella hall con caffè americano latte muffin e ciambelle. Ogni giorno lasciavano in camera 2 bottigliette d'acqua che ci omaggiavano. L'hotel è vicino all'Empire state building e a times square 20 min circa a piedi e c'è una fermata della metro poco distante. L'unica cosa che potrebbero migliorare è la colazione perchè è dalle 7:00 alle 9:00 e se non scendi entro le 8.00 non trovi più niente e devi aspettare che la riportano.

title: The Lex - Short name but BIG on service and comfort!
text: Upon arrival at the Lex, a staff member greeted us at the front door. The front desk personnel was extremely courteous and efficient. We had an excellent room on the 7th floor, facing Lexington Avenue. Although it was not as large as what I am used to, it made use of space and it was very clean and comfortable. Coffee makers are not provided but the hotel offers 24 hour coffee service delivered straight to your room! Complimentary water is provided daily as well as morning pastries and coffee in the lobby. Our location allowed for lots of sightseeing on foot and it was great to come back to the pleasant staff and quiet room. We stayed at the Lex for 4 nights and can not express enough how professional yet accommodating everyone was and we would recommend this hotel to all in a heartbeat.

title: Excellent Friendly Hotel
text: What a fantastic little hotel. Friendly staff always available to help. The added bonus of breakfast every morning. On hand 24 hour room service, so when you just fancied a coffee it wasnt any trouble. It was very clean and I would hestitate to stop again. Even looked after our luggage for a couple of days whilst we went to a different hotel to watch the US Open Tennis.

title: Modern Low Frills in a Great Location
text: We had a modern compact rooms (as pictured on the site) with a balcony facing the next building (no views from any room). Great friendly staff (thanks Omar) in a great location just east of Madison Square Park at the southern edge of the Flatiron/Nomad hotel area. No frills hotel with complimentary continental breakfast held in the small lobby. Limited storage and a loud AC are minor annoyances for the benefits of the location if the price is right.

title: Great stay in The Lex
text:
This was our 1st time on NYC so don't have anything local to compare it to, but found it to be a very nice hotel with excellent staff. 

The location of the hotel is in midtown and is within walking distance of lot of the main attractions. It took around 5-10 minutes to walk to Madison Square Park and then a short walk onto 5th into the Flatiron district. If walking is not your thing then you are only a couple of blocks from the subway or cabs are very frequent and easy to flag down outside the hotel. 

There are also great restaurants close to the hotel if you don't fancy venturing too far on an evening. 

The staff in the hotel were very helpful and informative. Our bags didn't arrive on our flight and the staff were excellent in directing us to a pharmacy and clothes shops to get some emergency stuff to see us through until they arrived. 

The various members of staff we met were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. 

This is a basic hotel which is reflected in the price but it doesn't pretend to be anything further. If you are expecting waiter service and gold elevators then this is probably not the place for you. but if you want, like we did, just a quiet, clean hotel with somewhere to lay your head after a busy day then this is perfect. 

The rooms were clean and tidy with a nice bathroom. We didn't have the breakfast in the hotel but it looked good with pastries and coffee available. 

There was a deli next door which has a load of other food available if you wanted something bigger

All in all it was a great trip and the Lex did everything we asked of it to make it that way. We will be booking again on our next trip to NYC.

May be sooner than I think if my bet with the guy on reception comes off and Kel Brook wins on Saturday, he promised me a free trip to NYC. Ha ha

Thanks for a great trip .

title: Non c'è niente di meglio! Ne siamo certi
text:
5 giorni e 5 notti in questo Hotel per la prima tappa del nostro viaggio di nozze.
Si trova in una zona tranquilla. Niente schiamazzi.
Alla All all'arrivo abbiamo incontrato un impeccabile receptionist di nome Odalis c'ha aiutati con un tassista pazzo e che si è reso disponibile per tutta la nostra permanenza c'ha anche trovato un fidato trasporto per l'aereoporto!!! Simpaticissimo Odalis! 
Le camere sono accoglienti, pulite, moderne, il letto e i cuscini comodissimi, il bagno è molto moderno e tutti i servizi funzionano alla perfezione. Anche le luci puoi usarle a tuo piacimento grazie ai doppi interruttori.
Colazione omaggio ( che a New York è una Santa cosa) ottima, ricca di pasticcini e cornetti, caffè e bevande.Al nostro ritorno in camera , dopo le visite alla città, la camera era pulita e sistemata e inoltre sui comodini sempre 2 bottigliette d'acqua.
Caffè, tè, camomilla durante la giornata free... bastava chiedere.
I ragazzi alla reception dono disponibili e gentili... si fanno in 4 per aiutarvi... pazienza all stato puro!
Ve li presento: 
Nari... simpatica, disponibile, gentile... e sopratutto paziente!! Grazie ancora di tutto! Sei stata preziosa!! C'hai sopportato!!!!
Derek disponibile e paziente. Con il tuo spagnolo c'hai salvato. Simpaticissimo anche lui!
Alex... tutte le mattine c'eri tu!!! Anche tu disponibile e gentile... prontissimo ad aiutarci! 
Angelica ti abbiamo vista poco ma il tuo sorriso non lo dimentichiamo!!!! Grazie anche a te! 
Questo Hotel non ha pecche!!! Lo consigliamo e vi ribadiamo che i receptionist sono i migliori che si possano desiderare!!! Un saluto anche al ragazzo cinese che la mattina portava i pasticcini.
Consigliamo il Lex per la vostra permanenza a New York

title: Pleasant  Boutique Hotel -  minor inconveniences
text:
Stayed 4 nights in Sept - over the Labor Day weekend.
The very good - very pleasant staff: clean, comfortable, modern room: Excellent climate control (wall thermostat);  good size bathroom w/ fine (Eden) toiletries &  quality linens:  good water pressure (hot & cold):  most efficient (& unobtrusive) housekeeping: totally free, strong, in-room  wi-fi (still sadly a NYC rarity). 
 Our room, at the rear of the hotel, was very quiet, despite being on the 2nd floor.
While the location (lower Lexington Ave)  is not the greatest scenically in NYC,  it is a short walk to Madison Square Park (Shake Shack, Eataly,), Park Ave, Broadway, 5th ave restaurants and shopping,  and to mass transit (M23 crosstown bus) and several subway  routes  along 23rd st.
Because I booked through a 3rd party site, I emailed the hotel prior to our stay re room type and was informed ', , ,the room that will be provided will be a standard room, ,with a view of the city.'  So much for that, we were given a 2nd floor room, with a sliding glass door, which opened only about 8 inches (due to a 'stop' in the tracking rail), and directly onto pipes coming from the ground and several  huge industrial metal  tanks (water?) - see attached photo.
The Standard Queen is a typical NYC Boutique room (i.e., on the small side - with about a foot and a half clearance from  each side of the bed to the wall).  
The narrow  armoire is curiously (& IMHO, inefficiently) designed, with the hanging rod going from the center back of the closet to the front, allowing for only 5 or 6 tightly stacked articles of clothing - a bit inconvenient and insufficient for a couple - not to mention the design results in at least  2/3 wasted/unusable space.
Also, coffee & Ice, while available for delivery by calling the front desk,  would be more convenient if made accessible to hotel guests at all times in the lobby.
Surprisingly, I would still recommend the Lex hotel overall,  based upon value  for those looking for  a most modern,  comfortable, and affordable  NYC option.

title: Perfetto rapporto qualità-prezzo
text:
È stato l'alloggio, per una settimana, del nostro viaggio di nozze. Ci siamo sentiti come a casa! I ragazzi che lavorano in questo albergo sono di una gentilezza e carineria disarmante, hanno sempre il sorriso sulle labbra e sono pronti ad aiutarti per qualsiasi necessità. A differenza della maggior parte degli alberghi di Manhattan, il Lex offre una piccola colazione a base di caffè, latte, succo d'arancia, tè e brioche di tutti i tipi . Particolare menzione ai muffin all'avena: davvero ottimi!
Si trova nella parte bassa della Lexington ed è veramente vicinissimo all'Empire State Building (15 minuti a piedi) e a due linee della metropolitana.
Lo consiglio vivamente! :)

title: comodo punto d'appogi oper manhattan
text:
camere piccolo ma ben organizzate, pulite e con tutto il necessario.
bagno nuovo, pulito e con accessori di cortesi di alto livello.
personale disponibile a tutte le ore.
wifi perfetto in tutti gli ambienti.
colazione rivedibile servita nella hall, da migliorare.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Super hôtel. Nous y sommes restés une semaine. Les chambres sont propres légèrement petites (mais comme toutes les chambres NY). Le personnel est très agréable, ils nous donnaient des conseils pour visiter, se déplacer (c'était notre premier séjour à NY) . Nous recherchions un hotel sur Times Square mais heureusement qu'on était sur Midtown, moins bruyant et on était à mi chemin de tout. Le petit-déjeuner (complementary) est ouvert et gratuit avec le minimum (viennoiseries et boissons chaudes/jus d'orange).
Bref excellent moment

title: Excellent Service!!
text: Amazing, friendly, knowledgable, and helpful staff. Great place!!!  The room was spacious and clean. Modern, well-stocked with a great balcony. The staff was always very helpful with issues like parking and baggage handling.

title: Clean and affordable hote
text: I have stayed at this hotel several times. The staff is always polite and helpful. The hotel is small but comfortable. It is also very clean. During this visit we got a room facing the street side, it is very noisy. So when you book ask for a room that does not face the street. The metro station is close to it ( green line 6) get off on 23rd street. W

title: Luna di miele
text: Bella struttura situata poco distante da due fermate della metropolitana camera pulitissime e i ragazzi della reception tutti molto gentili e disponibili a qualsiasi ora del giorno. Buona la colazione molto italiana. Bella la sorpresa che ci hanno fatto trovate in camera !

title: Good budget option
text: This place is no frills, but if you are looking for a somewhat affordable room in NYC, it's a good option. My room was on the basement level, which means there were no real windows. But it seems like maybe the basement rooms are larger, so that's the tradeoff. My room was pretty big and the bathroom was enormous. The rooms are very minimal when it comes to decor, but they are clean and have everything you need (hair dryer, iron, high quality toiletries and flat screen TV). The air conditioning works really well, so expect your room to be pretty chilly. The AC unit is also a bit on the loud side, but the noise is a steady fan noise, so it didn't bother me. The staff at this hotel is incredibly friendly and nice. They are very eager to help and did a great job arranging a very affordable ($50, inclusive of tip) town car to take me to La Guardia from the hotel. They also let me hang out in the air conditioned lobby for a long time so I could avoid the sweltering heat while I killed time between checking out and heading to the airport. If you are looking for a place that is clean, has friendly service and is in a good location (very short walk to Madison Square Park, Union Square, Eataly, lots of shopping, etc.), this is a good deal. It's not super cheap, but by NYC standards, it's pretty darn affordable. My room was $282 a night (including taxes) while the other hotels I typically stay at were around $500-$600 per night that same night.

title: Great boutique hotel in NYC
text:
We spent a quick week end in NYC and stayed at the Lex. It's a small cozy hotel with a GREAT staff. Close to everything we needed and love about New York, the hotel is conveniently close to a long term parking garage (no discounts for hotel guests available, but super safe and accessible) 
The rooms are super clean and well arranged, if you're looking for a large room in NYC get ready to drop the big bucks and the Lex might not be for you.
The size of the room was perfect for our needs. 
I do have to say the soundproofing could use a bit of improvement for the connecting rooms but apart from that it was great! 
Most definitely going to stay at the Lex Hotel again!

title: Ottimo Hotel
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per una settimana durante la nostra luna di miele. L'hotel tutto sommato è in una posizione strategica per raggiungere l'empire state building (10 minuti a piedi) e vicina alla linea della metro, anche se a quell'altezza la Lexington non è eccezionale. Comunque camere molto ben pulite Wi-Fi eccellente, bagno ampio e dimensione della stanza un po' più grande dello standard di Manhattan. Il costo è abbastanza buono e soprattutto colazione compresa nel prezzo (che a new York nessuno fa). Buonissimi i muffin e le brioches e il succo d'arancia. Acqua fresca sempre a disposizione nella hall e ogni giorno, con la pulizia delle stanze, ci portavano 2 bottigliette d'acqua: una manna a new York. Alla reception sempre molto cordiali, gentili e disponibili (anche a dare qualche consiglio su visite e mezzi di trasporto).
Complessivamente siamo molto contenti di questo hotel.

title: C'è di meglio
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 giorni tramite prenotazione dell'agenzia.La struttura non è proprio centrale e non ha un cartello ben visibile all'esterno..Tralasciando questo,appena arrivata mi hanno chiesto una cauzione di 150 $ (la chiedono a tutti) eventualmente rompessi qualcosa nella stanza;non avendo ancora dollari ma solo euro,non li hanno accettati e dopo ben 10 ore di volo mi hanno mandato a piedi a prelevarli...
La stanza è piccolissima,per 2 si sta stretti ma nonostante tutto è ben pulita.La colazione (sempre ripetitiva e non ricca) era quasi un piacere,seduti su uno sgabello scomodissimo e senza nemmeno delle pietanze salate o yogurt:solo cornetti,muffin,latte freddo,succo e frutta vecchissima! Insomma cercate altrove,New York ne è piena di hotel centrali e con colazioni decenti o tanto meno scegliete di farla voi autonomamente

title: My NYC Summertime Fun Trip
text: So we booked this hotel because it offered a suite and a balcony at a very good rate.  We even called in advance to make sure that we where getting a balcony and they said yes.  When I checked in the hotel on Monday July 11, I was told that the balcony was out of order due to renovations of the outside of the building.  What a disappointment!  The hotel manager right away offered free breakfast for the entire stay for all three of us and some extra Marriott points Great!  The room was great until time to sleep.  My son was going to sleep on the sofa bed but it was so uncomfortable you can feel all the springs.  He called front desk to ask for a bed topper which they did not have. But was able to get some extra blankets but it was still uncomfortable.  They felt bad and discounted the room for that night and offered to change rooms with two queen beds the following morning if we wanted. The next day they changed out the sofa bed with a new one but still the mattress was horrible. I got a call from the manager and explained the problem so he offered a rollaway bed verses changing rooms.. Our room was very nice..  the sofa bed was the problem.. Now its the second night, the roll away bed was just as bad.. We gave up!! On day three we went to K mart and purchased a full size egg cratered topper for the sofa bed and WE FIXED the sofa bed problem. We laughed and still laugh at ourselves carry this egg crate bed topper from K Mart on the subway to our hotel.. The only thing I can say is GET some egg crate toppers for these darn sofa beds so that your guest can sleep comfortable.  It was a $20.00 investment for me and your hotel got to keep the topper which probable got thrown away by the cleaning people.  Other than the disappointment of the balcony being out of order and having to keep my window shades closed all day because men where on it working and the horrible sofa bed mattress this hotel was very nice and all the staff was so kind.  Audrey the lady who was cleaning my room was wonderful!  The bar in the lobby was great! breakfast was amazing.  Yes I would back and I would love to have the same room when the Balcony in order so that I could enjoy it.  Maybe next summer! My bed king size bed was great I am giving the sleep quality a very good rating only based on the sofa bed. I am trying to be fair here.

title: What a gem!!
text: Me and my husband stayed here for s weekend getaway and I gotta say I was blown away. The location is ideal close to almost everything and the subway is only a few blocks away The staff is fantastic, always smiling and ready to assist. There's a cool chic vibe in the lobby but the hallways are a bit bare. We were fortunate enough to get upgraded to a balcony room which was a great perk. I wish the breakfast had a bit more to offer but none the less it is complimentary and the pastries were fresh, Great way to start the day. The housekeeping team does a great job as our room was spotless everyday, which is so pleasant to come home too after a long day of sightseeing. That's right I said home because that is how the staff at The  Lex  makes you feel. Keep doing what you are doing and we will definitely be back. Cheers!

title: Bellissima e comodissima struttura!
text: Siamo stati in viaggio di nozze a New York ed abbiamo pernottato in questa struttura. Ristrutturata da poco, molto pulita, personale cortese  (soprattutto Andres troppo simpatico e disponibile) con ottima colazione, la consigliamo a tutti coloro che  vogliono visitare questa bellissima città!

title: Viaggio di nozze
text: Abbiamo concluso il nostro viaggio di nozze a new york e abbiamo alloggiato al lex hotel, albergo pulitissimo e posizionato in una posizione molto strategica per visitare la città! Sicuramente tonando a new york terremo conto di questa struttura! Complimenti!!

title: Muy recomendable
text:
Nos hospedamos con mi marido por 5 noches, el hotel es muy moderno y limpio.
El personal muy atento, todos los días sirven desayuno sin cargo (jugo de naranja, café o té, medialunas y otras facturas) y te dan dos botellitas por día de agua también sin cargo. 
La ubicación es excelente para el que le gusta estar cerca de madison square park, unión square y flat iron.
Volveremos!

title: Great, welcoming staff, but request higher room
text:
The staff was extremely approachable and helpful.  They looked like they enjoyed their jobs-- always great to see.  

I was bummed that while I was the only one in my group to call in advance to request a higher up, corner room, I was the one who got a room with a weird view of and access to the heating/cooling equipment immediately out of # 207's window.  It felt awkward to have sliding glass door access to that kind of mechanical space.  And I wasn't sure if maintenance workers would be accessing the space immediately outside my window, so I just kept the blinds closed the entire time-- which defeats the point of this room having a sliding door or even eye level windows.  A window higher up on the wall that acted more like a skylight would seem to make more sense both for security and aesthetics.  

But the rest of the room was well designed, even spacious for a single traveler.  The bathroom was a great size particularly!  And the complimentary wifi, water, and coffee (upon request) were a great touch. I would highly recommend and would stay here again-- just on a higher floor for sure.

title: Consigliato!
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per 1 notte prima di partire per il tour di Niagara e poi per altre 4 al nostro ritorno, quindi abbiamo avuto 2 stanze diverse, nessuna delle due cosi microscopica come si legge in tante recensioni. Ovvio che siamo a New York, quindi non ci si possono aspettare camere enormi! La nostra era una camera con letto king e ci si stava bene, sempre con pulizia impeccabile e bagno spazioso!
Colazione inclusa anche se abbastanza scarsa visto che si fa nella hall (di solito una scelta tra 2 tipi di brioche, caffè, latte e succo). Staff molto disponibile e simpatico! La posizione è abbastanza comoda, anche se essendo sulla linea verde e non vicino q stazioni importanti bisognava sempre fare almeno un cambio per raggiungere le attrazioni.

title: Consigliato!!!!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel 3 notti durante la luna di miele. Moderno, curato, pulito e ordinato. Molto accogliete. La camera non grandissima ma carina e funzionale. Bagno grande e sempre pulito. L'hotel é centrale e per questo molto comodo. Il personale sempre sorridente e gentile. Consigliato!!!

title: NYC Break
text:
The hotel is very modern inside and very clean. It's around a 30 minute walk to Times Square the "Big Bus Tour" hop on hop off buses pick up in Times Square for all tour routes although the tours themselves take a long time due to the NY traffic. Although clean the hotel itself doesn't have any tea/coffee facilities within the room, you can request hot drinks via the reception desk, however I would expect them to be within the room as standard. Breakfast is served at 7:30 until 9 which we found extremely early, given this was our fourth stop on a USA trip this was the earliest breakfast one which we didn't sample. 
All in all a decent hotel ideal as a base.

title: Not a good stay - pot smoke and dodgy housekeeping
text:
I wanted to write a good review for this hotel because the desk staff were brilliant. But frankly, that was it. We stayed for a week and couldn't wait to leave. I provided feedback to the hotel a few days after we left and have had no response so I feel obliged to leave this review.

Housekeeping was rubbish. Day one, excellent. Day two, came in to our pyjamas and belongings slung onto the floor. Day three, toiletries removed and not replaced etc etc. It was very shoddy.

On the weekend, we wished to stay inside to watch the wimbledon final on TV before venturing out. The most horrific stench of pot smoke invaded the room. After about an hour as it got stronger and stronger, we had to go out. I complained at the desk and was told 'Yeah we know'. Great. So we had to find a bar to watch the final in.

Location - ok if you're happy to get around by walking or subway but not much in the immediate vicinity. Although, the restaurants recommended were good. 

I have stayed at a number of 'boutique' hotels at the same price point in the city over the last 5 years and this doesn't come anywhere close to the others, the Distrikt, for example is MUCH better. 

Really disappointed the hotel chose to ignore my complaints and thus I have to leave this review. But seriously, don't stay here.

title: Boutique as it says...small, clean, personal, in a great location...
text: Very hepful people at the desk, nice breakfast in a very short room, but cosy, nice decoration, super bath, very clean and tide...in a GREAT LOCATION...What else to ask somebody in the center of New York?

title: Exactly what you need in NYC
text: This hotel is exactly what you need when you are visiting NYC. It has a perfect location, very close to the subway, it is clean and all the employees are super friendly. But the best thing is, you do not pay for the name of the city, you pay a fair price. I would always come back and stay here again.

title: Very Nice Stay
text: I stayed here, last minute, while visiting my daughter.  The room was nice, very clean and the staff was exceptionally friendly.  They include a breakfast which consisted of store bought muffins, pastries, coffee and tea.  It wasn't the best but it was free so I'm not complaining.  The location of the hotel was nice, too as you are very close to Union Square.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Ottima sistemazione a New York
text: Sono stata in questo albergo per il mio viaggio di nozze, le camere ( non so se sono stata sfortunata ) sono molto piccole ma accoglienti e pulite. I punti di forza di questo hotel sono la buona posizione per visitare la grande mela, la colazione inclusa e la cortesia e la simpatia dello staff ( soprattutto dei due disponibilissimi ragazzi che abbiamo sempre visto fare il turno di notte )! Consigliatissimo!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: I had the pleasure of staying here for two nights when I was meeting friends in the city for a weekend in July. I chose the Lex based on reviews as well as price and location and could not be happier with my selection! It was close to Penn, Grand Central, as well as the subway and there were several excellent restaurants in the nearby neighborhoods. I had "cozy queen," which I honestly was expecting to be much smaller.  It was very spacious for one person, and spotless. The bed was comfortable, and blackout shades worked great.  While the a/c unit in my room was a little loud, it did not keep me up and street noise was minimal. In addition, the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, I had a wonderful stay, and would definitely choose the Lex again and recommend it to other travelers!

title: Very disappointing
text:
I booked this hotel for 6 nights, but after seeing my room, I contacted front desk as well as my booking agency to cancel my booking. The hotel made me stay for 1 night, as this was the hotel rules.
Room was tiny - about one foot on either side of the bed. I felt very claustrophobic.
So for the night that they made me stay , I doubled down and paid the extra money to be upgraded to a junior suite. Wanted to make it he most of a bad situation.
The front desk gentleman was very helpful and obliging. He took things in his stride - so I'm sure I'm not the exception.
No gym. Breakfast is a few pre packed eats served next to the front desk.
Should not be more than 2 stars. My compliments to very helpful staff.

title: Perfekt lokasjon og bra hotell
text: Bodde her fem dager i juli. Hotellet ligger perfekt i forhold til mange severdigheter på Manhattan. Du har Madison Square park rett i nærheten og empire state Building 10 min gange unna. Anbefaler bruk av bysykler og restauranten Penelope for frokost og lunsj. Ligger 3 kvartaler unna hotellet.

title: Not a positive experience
text:
I'm not sure how this hotel has good star-rating but IMO, this is 2-star rating hotel. 
Pros: location is good and staffs are friendly. 
Cons: 
It was clean enough but I found couple of minor issues; I found some kind of dark spot on comforter. I have black hair but I found long blonde hair from towel. 
Noise level: terrible! You have old-fashined AC unit sitting right next to your bed. When it's running, it's super loud that woke me up several times throughout the night. When it was off, I could hear all noises coming from the street (it felt like there was an open-hole). 
Also, the walls must be paper-thin. I could hear toilet being flushed from next door and I could literally hear conversation from next door. 
I booked for this hotel at the last minute and I paid over $450. It is definitely not worth the money.

title: Kind staff in a warm setting, perfect location & great room!
text: The Lex Hotel was a great experience. Every time I walked in the door I felt like I was coming home.And it didn't matter if it was 1 in the afternoon or 1 in the morning. The staff was very attentive, friendly and helpful. The room was perfect! One may think you need a bigger room but for the amount of time spent and what I was doing it was great! It was clean and the bed was comfortable! I will definitely stay there whenever i'm in NCY.

title: Spacious & friendly staff
text: We stayed at the Lex this weekend.  We needed a double bedroom and were amazed by the size of the bedroom we were given.  The staff was extremely friendly which is nice after a long day in New York.  The beds were very comfortable.  We stayed on floor 1.  Initially we were concerned about noise but the place was so quiet and dark we actually slept too late the first day. Would highly recommend this hotel.  The location is excellent if you plan to spend your time by Union Square but want a quieter neighborhood.  Free wi fi too!

title: Amy Bolger
text: I chose this hotel because I was stuck in NYC overnight due to weather related flight delays. Nothing affordable close to JFK. I was looking for value for price, breakfast included due to time constraints and this hotel delivered except in one area: breakfast. The word breakfast to me suggests more than coffee, donuts, oranges and orange juice. Please consider adding the word continental! I arrived at 8:45 and the hotel was out of all but the oranges. More donuts arrived but for someone gluten free with GERD and sensitivity to acidic foods - well, you get the gist! I travel often, am flexible and have not been unable to find something acceptable to eat in longer than I can remember. These days standard hotel breakfasts  include at least hard boiled eggs and bananas, and often oatmeal. Anyway, I did sleep well in a clean, adequately equipped, quiet room with comfy bed and big bathroom. Staff were kind and professional. I might stay again, but with the condition that I'd have to buy my own breakfast.

title: Wow !
text:
This boutique hotel is brand new and it shows. The staff offers unparalleled customer service, and the quaint, yet modern atmosphere makes for a great experience. Anjelica (I hope I spelled that correctly), the manager, is a breath of fresh air and really goes out of her way to be extra helpful .
This will definitely be my go-to hotel when I am visiting Manhattan (or even the outer boroughs). Ask for Room 707- the balcony access is refreshing and the view of the Chrysler building is awesome!

title: Strategico e cool
text: Hotel non molto grande ma accogliente e ordinato.Stanze non grandi ma ti trovi a Manhattan.Molto pulito ed ordinato. Colazione con brioches fresche.Ottima esperienza che consigliero' ai miei conoscenti.

title: I loved this place
text: I had the pleasure of staying the last two nights at this hotel and I will tell you that without any reservation the surprised me from the very beginning. Started with the nice attentions of the front desk person then to a very nice, clean and comfortable room. I will definitely repeat. Excellent location and price.

title: il minimo indispensabile
text:
sono stato 2 notti in questo hotel e devo dire che si può trovare davvero di meglio. stanze piccolissime e solo grazie al balcone si avverte meno di essere in spazi piccoli, la colazione scarsissima e per quello che si paga ......!!!
a compensare per fortuna un personale disponibilissimo, gentile e sempre pronto a fornire informazioni e consigli utilissimi.

title: ottimo hotel,posizione,staff
text: abbiamo soggiornato 5 giorni per la nostra luna di miele e ci siamo trovati benissimo. Hotel essenziale ma molto pulito, camere ben attrezzate e bagno abbastanza grande e curato. Colazione (nella hall) piuttosto ricca e di qualità. Staff veramente molto cordiale e disponibile. Unica pecca: temperature troppo basse per via dell'aria condizionata (come in tutti i locali di NYC d'altronde). Posizione comodissima, nei pressi dell'Empire state building, stazione metro molto vicina. Se avremo la fortuna di tornare a NYC sceglieremo di sicuro nuovamente The Lex!

title: Mixed bag, would probably not stay here again
text:
After reading the reviews and looking at the pictures, we were rather disappointed when we checked into Room 506, which lacked a lot of standard features. It was oddly shaped, with the queen bed crammed into most of the front part of the space inside the door, and then a weird, narrow extra space with a luggage rack, and that's about it. There was no desk or large flat surface on which to place anything, and only one simple little chair with metal legs that we kept banging into. The room also had no closet, just hooks on the wall! No coffeemaker, no mini fridge, etc., that are pretty much expected in today's hotels. In fact, it felt more like a "pod" budget hotel than an upscale boutique hotel as advertised, and was not worth the rate that we paid.

Another negative was breakfast. Coffee and pastries were included in our (too-high) rate, but by the time we came down to the lobby it was all put away by 9am. On a weekend in the Big Apple, "the city that never sleeps," this seems excessively early, especially when checkout isn't until noon.

On the plus side, the mattress and linens were of good quality. The windows were fitted with tight black-out screens to keep the room dark, and since we faced the back it was very quiet. The gleaming tiled bathroom was beautifully equipped, with a great shower and thick white towels. The A/C worked well (except that it woke me up a few times whenever it kicked on and off). Wifi is free and they provide excellent free coffee. And of course, it's a great location near Madison Square Park.

So would I book here again? Probably not. I have stayed at better hotels in NYC for similar prices (Distrikt, Refinery, Tuscany, Beacon, Andaz, Times Sq. Hyatt, NYLO) and have received much nicer, bigger, and less weird and awkward rooms with better amenities than this one.

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights. First time in NYC and selected the Lex for its good reviews.
Couldn't fault it. Great location, far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but we were able to walk everywhere.
Good free wifi. Complimentary water and a fridge if requested. We enjoyed the pastries, coffee and juice for breakfast.
The room itself was lovely. Big enough for 2 people with a case each. Clean and well appointed. We slept well despite the thin walls and road noise because the bed was so comfortable! The staff were friendly and obliging.
Would recommend Bhatti Indian restaurant down the street. Excellent food if eating nearby.

title: Perfetto
text:
Questo piccolo Hotel offre tutte le comodità che un soggiorno a New York richiede. Colazione buona, ti permette di risparmiare quei 20 dollari che servono di media per farla fuori. Camere pulite e spaziose con ottimi servizi di Toilette. Ogni camera dispone di un terrazzino utile per stendere panni. Il personale davvero gentile, consigliano ti aiutano ti spiegano, addirittura prenotando dall'albergo oltre che risparmiare eviti molte file.
3 fermate della metro vicinissime. 
Wifi Gratis..Top

title: Pleasant stay
text: Stayed for 4 nights. Rooms are small,  but they have everything you need. Clean, comfortable, quiet (except for nyc street noise). Air temperature was a bit temperamental to control, too warm when ac was off, but too cool when the ac was on. Free breakfast consists of coffee, tea, oj, pastries and some fruit. Free wine and cheese happy hour on Tuesday night! Staff was super friendly and the neighborhood felt safe with many interesting dining options near by.

title: Great, Friendly Hotel for Business or Pleasure
text:
If you're looking for a hotel in the south reaches of midtown, near Flatiron or Murray Hill, the Lex NYC is a terrific spot.  Away from the craziness of Times Square, the hotel is well located between 25th and 26th streets, just east of Park Avenue - easy walking distance to the Empire State Building and not far from many businesses.  Also not far from many bars and restaurants on 3rd Avenue.  Subway access is also easy.

The property is low key on Lexington Avenue so don't miss it!  The front desk staff were exceptionally friendly.

The room was small but acceptable by NYC standards.  Nice sized bathroom, clean, modern and simple.  Wifi performed well.  I would recommend a higher floor if available because Lexington can be noisy at some times of the day.

Boutique hotel feel but certainly not pretentious.  Wine and cheese available in the late afternoon.  Coffee and pastries available in the morning.  All included.

title: Good location, comfy bed but small room
text:
The hotel is in a relatively quiet area of NYC so not much noise at night. The room was small but I guess this is standard for NYC. The bed is large and extremely comfortable and soft. Unfortunately I have to agree with previous comments on the aircon - it is very noisy so you have to turn it off at night time, there is no way you could sleep with it on. There is a small safe to put valuables. The bathroom was clean but water pressure in the shower not great. I liked the free bottles of water each day. The breakfast was self service in the lobby area and consisted of pastries, coffee and juice, good for people on the go.
Staff were very approachable and helpful. Check in and out was quick and easy.

title: Para volver una y otra vez - Excelente Hotel
text:
Ocupamos una habitación doble standard y de gentileza nos proveyeron una cuna, ya que viajamos con nuestro hijo de 6 meses de edad. El personal del hotel es muy amable y siempre está dispuesto a ayudar y orientar a los huéspedes. 
Cómo llegamos 2 horas antes del check-in, dejamos las valijas en el hotel y nos fuimos a almorzar a uno de los tantos lugare que rodean a este hotel, estratégicamente ubicado en el corazón de Manhattan. Al volver, nuestras valijas ya nos esperaba dentro de la habitación. La misma es muy simple, pero cálida y confortable con una buena cama, aire acondicionado, LCD con cable y un amplio y completo baño con bañera. El único punto objetable es que el armario es mínimo, pero esto no altera en absoluto la experiencia.
El desayuno es correcto, sabroso y con productos frescos ( café, te, jugo de naranja, leche, frutas y facturas). El espacio para desayunar es en el mismo lobby, es acotado pero diferente e interesante. 
Por último quiero destacar la amabilidad de todo el personal, siempre dispuestos a ayudar y con una sonrisa. Un plus que no tiene precio.
Sin dudarlo dos segundos, este es MI hotel en NYC.

title: Fantastico
text: Abbiamo soggiornato 5 notti a maggio 2016 e ci siamo trovati benissimo. Hotel pulitissimo, letti comodi, bagno ampio e ben attrezzato. Il personale è molto disponibile per qualsiasi necessità! Situato a meno di cinque minuti a piedi dalla metro, in una zona tranquilla. Colazione varia e buona. Ogni giorno venivano lasciate due bottigliette di acqua in omaggio e saputo che si trattava della nostra luna di miele ci hanno omaggiato con una bottiglia di vino e dei dolcetti. Se dovessimo tornare a New York sicuramente sceglieremmo questo hotel!

title: Amazing!
text: The hotel is amazing! In a nice location, small yet suitable and easy access to a lot of places. The staff is really well trained and always willing to help. Highly recommended. Great Value, the prices are decent for NYC when compared to large brand hotels. Close to two train stations for easy access to the rest of the city.

title: Midtown boutique hotel
text:
An excellent boutique hotel in midtown New York close to 2 metro lines. 
The rooms were spacious (for New York) and very clean and in a good condition. Had all the amenities expected - hairdryer, iron and board, toiletries and they would make hot drinks on request. 
There was air conditioning in the room (essential as it was 30 deg when we were there!). This ceased to work on our third day there - they came to look at it within 5 minutes of reporting it and changed our room 5 minutes later as they couldn't fix it. Excellent customer service. 
There was a small free breakfast each morning consisting of pastries, fruit, orange juice and tea and coffee - perfect for a quick bite as we headed out the door. And good coffee too. 
They could provide a wealth of information, including an excellent map of manhattan, restaurant recommendations and book tourist attractions and were happy to arrange a competitively priced taxi back to the airport for us. 
I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend it for it's convenient location and clean, spacious rooms, as well as the great staff that work there.

title: Great Value
text: Stayed here for two nights. I am used to large brand chain hotels, but the Lex staff was great and the prices were reasonable. The location is close to a bunch of the stuff I needed to get to for work. They offer a simple continental breakfast of pastries and coffee which works in a pinch when you are running out the door. My only issues were a lack of an onsite gym (not too common in NYC) and the Army barracks across the street loudly unloading equipment in the middle of the night. However, I don't know how often that happens as I was there for two nights and it only occurred during one of them. Definitely recommend if you don't need a ton of space (the rooms are small, but very functional).

title: Wonderful staff, lovely clean room and bathroom
text:
Let's face it, there's a lot to be said about a chain hotel room when you are a road warrior.  You know exactly what to expect, you get points for staying and generally have a bunch of amenities.

Now, this is not the case with boutique hotels, but in this case, I lucked out with the Lex.  It's in a convenient location on Lexington between 25th and 26th streets.  I immediately loved both the exterior and reception spot.  Check in was fine and, after requesting a fridge in my room, I went upstairs to settle in.  Next thing I know, the phone rings in the room - the young woman who checked me in asking if everything met my expectations.  What a great idea!  The fridge arrived not long after.

The room is perfectly adequate, although it would be nice to have a chest of drawers for my clothes which are strewn about in the packing cubes I use when packing . It's OK - I'm not as organized as I should be so I can deal!  The bathroom is lovely and quite zen-like. And the toiletries smell AWESOME!!  OH and FREE WIFI in the room that actually works well!

The bed and pillows are super comfy and my only minor nits are the AC unit is a bit noisy and the towels could be more generously sized.  Other than that, I have no doubt I will be back!

title: Rapport qualité/prix génial
text:
Hôtel très charmant de 7 étages loin du brouhaha new-yorkais et pourtant bien situé ! Entièrement refait à neuf, propre, chambre spacieuse, personnel agréable et attentionné.
Un prix très raisonnable pour Manhattan !
Je le recommande chaudement !

title: Sehr sauberes Hotel m. super Frühstück
text:
Das Lex Hotel in NYc ist sehr sauber und hat super freundliche Angestellte, die sehr gerne weiterhelfen. Lage gut (Nähe Empire State Building).
Jederzeit wieder! Das Frühstück ist klasse!! Zimmer etwas klein, aber für ein paar Tage genügt es.

title: Great hotel and fantastic staff
text: Stayed at The Lex NYC in room 404 from 3rd to 8th May 2016 and couldn't have been happier. The room was more than big enough for the large bed, cupboard space and our two big cases. It was kept spotlessly clean. A large flat screen TV on the wall and a lovely bathroom. There were also two USB charging ports next to the bed.The reception staff were all very friendly and exceptionally helpful (thanks to Alex specifically). Not only does this hotel deserve its high ranking but it is excellently positioned to walk everywhere south of Central Park (which is all you need to see). Back in January 2017!

title: Bello ed accogliente!
text: Sono stato qui in questo hotel per 5 notti in luna di miele e devo dire di essermi trovato benissimo! Stanze molto carine e confortevoli tenute sempre molto pulite! L accoglienza e la disponibilità dei dipendenti è veramente favolosa! Sono sempre a completa disposizione per aiutarti a programmare qualunque cosa tu voglia fare a New York! Tra l altro l hotel è situato a 10 minuti a piedi dall empire state bulding ed a 15 da Times square! Sono davvero soddisfattissimo!

title: New Experience at a Boutique Hotel
text: We chose the LEX Boutique Hotel because of the location and price.  We were attending an event at NYU and the LEX was convenient and economical.  The room was small, as expected for a Boutique Hotel, but clean with all the necessities for a one or two night stay.  The bathroom was large for the size of the room, clean, and bright and had very nice complementary shampoo, conditioner, etc. Finally, we found the bed to be comfortable and the linens of good quality.

title: Great stay!
text: We absolutely loved our stay at The Lex NYC! From the helpful staff who always greet you with a smile, to close by subway access, clean and tidy room...this place was a great stay. As we are on our honeymoon they gave us a room upgrade and bottle of wine. For NYC we were expecting some noise but didn't have any! We would certainly stay here again 👌🏻

title: Nothing Special
text: Hotel is clean and in a very good location.  Rooms are small, sparse and not very warm or inviting.  Very, very basic.  Air-conditioning was noisy.  Staff is efficient and pleasant, but not really that friendly  Continental breakfast was very good.  I work in NYC and stay in lots of hotels,  I have no reason to return to this estabilishment.

title: L'hôtel idéal pour un court séjour de tourisme
text: Nous avons passé 4 nuits au lex hotel, nous étions au 7eme étage avec vue sur cour. La chambre était propre et  suffisamment équipée. Le personnel a toujours été a l'écoute et est très sympathique. Pour ce qui est du petit déjeuner il était suffisant, la seule chose c'est qu'il faut arriver tôt. En résumé pour quelqu'un qui vient surtout a New-York pour visiter je recommande cet hôtel qui en plus bien situé

title: Convenience and economy with nicer-than-usual touches
text: Conveniently located near Madison Square Park, the Flatiron building, and Chelsea.  Easy access to subway.  Reasonably priced parking lot less than 2 blocks away (on Third Avenue--reception can direct you).  The staff members are thoughtful and helpful.  Even though service is basic at this hotel, there are nice touches: provided hot tea for me when I was ready to turn in, great coffee and other goodies for the continental breakfast in the lobby.  Room decor is spare but modern.  Lighting options in the room are good.  There are places to plug in electronic devices without having to move furniture or cross the room to answer your cell phone.  The shower was large and clean.  Bedding above average for room in this price range.  The only drawback was the all-too-common noisy heating/AC unit in the room.  This hotel seems to draw a really great mix of international and smart business travelers, making the morning mingle in the lobby more interesting than big chain hotels.  There was no desk in my room, which could be an issue for business travelers.  There is no formal concierge, but the front desk staff are willing and able.

title: Fabulous Experience
text: Every staff member here is super friendly and helpful. The room, while small by choice, was extremely clean and elegant. The breakfast is simple but of good quality with fresh fruit, pastries, and hot or cold classic breakfast drinks including more than decent coffee.

title: 5 day break in nyc
text: The hotel is busy funky and cool. Lovely gym,great safe in rooms, and all clean tidy and central. The only complaint I would have is the concierge asked for a tip otherwise was a brilliant hotel would recommend

title: Can't wait to return...
text: The Lex is an amazing boutique hotel. All the staff are very attentive and go over and  beyond be helpful. The rooms are clean, up to date and comfortable. Free wifi! YES! Great coffee in the mornings! YES! Great central location! YES!

title: Just as great a year later
text: Stayed overnight again, and happy to report that all was as uniformly positive as the first time.  Friendly staff, clean, classy, and cheerful accommodations, great location. Excellent value in NYC for the price.

title: Quiet and friendly hotel with helpfull staff.
text: We visited for 5 nights. The Hotel was clean and efficient. Ideal because it's very close to the the main tourist sites. Complimentary breakfast  (pastries and fruit) and bottled water in the room is an added bonus. The staff were great and we're on the ball with directions and information. Thoroughly recommend.

title: great boutique hotel
text: This hotel is in a great location, right on Lexington Avenue.  The breakfast of croissants and coffee were free in the lobby, and after the hours stated, which was much appreciated.  This hotel is perfect for a single business traveler.

title: Average Hotel
text: Can't quite believe how highly rated this hotel is. I was  disappointed with the room with a very small bed and no drawers to keep my clothes. The staff were very attentive though vacuuming the adjoining room before 10am wasn't great after my night on the town. Overall not a great experience and somewhere i can't imagine going back to. though the free breakfast and reasonable location are plus points.

title: Perfekt!
text: Tolles, kleines Hotel in guter Lager, direkt zwischen 2 Metrostationen! Kleine Zimmer aber völlig ok, sauber, WLAN schnell! Mitarbeiter sehr sehr freundlich und bemüht! Wie schon hier erwähnt, machen es hier die Kleinigkeiten aus! Frühstück nett und ausreichend! Preisleistung top! Würden hier sofort wieder hin!

title: Size really doesn't matter
text: This is a boutique hotel with all the personal touches.  Staff are very accommodating and helpful.  Complimentary continental breakfast is great to set you up for the day. 24 hour service, so don't worry if you come in late and need a hot drink to warm you up, or ice to continue with your party fun!  Rooms are kept very clean and linen changed daily. Great location together around the corner from the metro.  10 minutes away from Times Sq, where all the action is at.  The location is in a quite area, which means you get the best of both worlds.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Rien a redire
text:
Très bien placé à mi-chemin entre central park et wall street, pas une super vue des chambres de arrière cour mais elles sont au calme et c'est ce que l'on apprécie après une journée de visite à pieds. Le personnel est pro et sympa, la propreté des chambres est irréprochable. De quoi manger sans se ruiner tout autour.
Bref,nous passons un excellent  séjour dans cet établissement.

title: Clean and functional
text:
Just stayed 5 nights here good place to stay, very clean with all the facilities for a short stay. Desk staff very helpful and polite, nothing is to much for them.
Daily breakfast is coffee and pastries but there are plenty of eateries in the vicinity
If you in New York as a tourist ask at the desk about the Big bus tour packages, they cover all the major attractions and is really good value.
Would definitely use again if going back to New York.

title: Great boutique hotel in a prime location.
text:
Staff were incredibly friendly and location was excellent. It was very easy to grab a taxi or take the different subway lines [6, N, R] to wherever we needed to go. We were able to walk to the Flatiron Building, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, etc. easily and quickly.

Walls were a bit thin, but I'd definitely stay here again.

title: good place to stay
text:
would recommend.
nice room, very clean. 
good location, close to subway.
nice restaurants nearby.
the complimentary coffee, fruit and pastries were a great touch as it was easy to grab a quick bite and take coffee to go in the morning.
the room was spotless and well kept throughout our stay. 
less street noise at night too.

title: Will definitely stay again
text: Great price and location.  Easy walk to subway and great restaurants (we love Turkish Kitchen Sunday brunch - make reservations).  Omar and Andrew at the front desk were super nice and helped us a lot with directions, etc.

title: Accogliente
text: Ho soggiornato 3 notti a maggio dello scorso anno e oltre ad avere un ottima posizione l hotel è piccolo ma accogliente, le camere non molto spaziose ma pulite e moderne. Inoltre alla reception erano sempre pronti a dare indicazioni e suggerimenti. La colazione è servita nella hall, servivano frutta brioches, muffin e da bere. Semplice ma soddisfacente. Contenta di aver soggiornato qui..

title: Great hotel
text:
Lovely clean, friendly hotel.
Rooms are quite small but set our well so good use of space.
Lovely bathroom.
Front desk friendly and helpful.
Breakfast was a welcomed bonus. Lovely muffins and pastries.
Subway close.
I would stay here again and recommend to others.

title: Un excellent hotel pour une semaine à NY
text:
Mon conjoint et moi avons passé une semaine dans cette hotel de taille humaine au très bon rapport qualité prix. C'est un hotel récent moderne propre et ou le personnel est vraiment génial
Vous pourriez voir des avis défavorables sur le petit déjeuner mais n'en tenez pas compte le petit déjeuner est simple mais on y trouve son bonheur sans problème viennoiserie fruit the café chocolat....il se prend dans le lobby ce qui est original mais pas désagréable car cela permet d'échanger avec le personnel qui est à l'accueil et qui est toujours fort sympathique et rendant service
Bref un bon hotel allez y les yeux fermées

title: Increíble eleccion
text:
El servicio de las personas en el hotel fue excelente. Cada uno de ellos estuvo predispuesto a ayudarnos en todo y a darnos consejos de que hacer.
La habitación me encantó, me pareció lo justo y necesario, la cama super cómoda, la ducha increíble. Es una habitación excelente para descansar. 
La ubicación es perfecta. Tiene 2 estaciones de subtes cercanas que nos sirvieron mucho para ir a los principales centros turísticos que queríamos conocer. 
En cuanto a servicios del hotel, fueron excelentes. El desayuno es muy bueno y tipo buffet y el horario ayuda a disfrutar bien el día.
Lo que mas me gustó fue la cama, es perfecta.

title: El hotel en NYC
text:
Sin dudas voy a volver.
El trato del personal es el justo y necesario. Como primordial esta la buena predisposición ante cualquier duda o consulta del hospedado.
Hablan en español, algunos mas y otros menos, pero siempre se rebuscan la manera de darte la ayuda necesaria.
En cuanto al desayuno, me pareció lo necesario, hay facturas, grandes medialunas y hay café, leche, jugo de naranjas, frutas y CHOCOLATADA. (gran punto a favor).

Sin duda lo recomiendo, hemos pasado 12 días increíbles.

title: A bit cozy and in a good location - perfect for a young couple
text:
Stayed one night with my boyfriend

Very nice and clean hotel, at a great price. Look for deals online! :)

Conveniently located - very easy to get to the subway

While the rooms are a bit small, they really utilised the space nicely and fit in everything you could need. 

Service was great - for example, the room didn't have a mini fridge so we asked the front desk to store our leftovers in their refrigerator. I got hungry in the middle of the night and the person at the front desk was extremely friendly and helped me get my food. 

Overall we had a great weekend and would definitely stay at The Lex again!

title: Great stay for my 40th
text: My partner booked a weekend at The Lex for as part of my 40th birthday celebrations. He chose this hotel because it is across from the Lexington Armory, where we were going to the Craft Beer Fest. This was extremely convenient!!! I was beyond happy with our stay at The Lex. First, the staff was great.They were extremely friendly and made you feel very welcome. This is really important to me personally. The Hotel itself is a boutique, so there aren't many amenities. They provide a free continental breakfast every morning and offered coffee and tea brought to the room if we liked. The room itself was nice. Very clean, with plenty of room for two. The bathroom was also really clean and well kept.  We had a small balcony and while the view wasn't spectacular, it was still a nice feature. I would definitely stay at The Lex again and would suggest it to anyone who may be interested.

title: Delightful surprise worth experiencing again
text: Before finding this hotel on TripAdvisor, I had never heard of it. The location was great for my business needs, the price was very competitive, and the reviews were good, so I booked it. The hotel was very convenient, the staff members were very pleasant, and the room was small yet very comfortable, clean, well designed and modern. I definitely want to come back!

title: Nice hotel, EXTREMELY rude housekeeping
text:
OVERALL, the hotel is extremely fashionable and trendy. The rooms are reasonably sized, and comfortable, and the staff at the main desk is friendly.

However, I never been at a hotel with ruder housekeeping. 

I had a long flight, and I desperately needed to sleep through the day, so I went out and got lunch for about a few hours and when I got back, my room wasn't made. 
Now that isn't a huge problem, as I can't expect the staff to know when I would return, although I did put up the sign that says "Please clean my room." 
However, once I went back to my room to try and get some rest, 3 members of the staff approached my door in a 1 hour period. 

1. The first guy was nice, asked if i needed service. I said not right now, he asked when would be a good time and that they had to leave at 4:30. I said 3:30 would be ok. (it was around 3 at that time). I decide to hop in the shower and get ready to leave.
2. Only moments after I start showering, I hear knocking on the door. I KNOW it can't be 3:30 yet, so I assumed it was housekeeping knocking on a nearby door. 
Nope. The knocking grew louder and louder and the housekeeping lady was basically pounding on my door. I quickly turned off the shower, but she had already let herself in. I said, "Not right now, please." It was about 3:15. 
3. So, my shower is interrupted, I can't sleep, and I am forced to leave because of the housekeeping. So I get dressed (this is only moments after the 2nd lady came) and I hear more pounding at my door. I know its them, so I just say, "What?" 
     "Do you want service today?" 
     "Not. Right. Now. Please." How many times do I have to say that???
     And then in the most condescending voice, she says, "Then put your Do Not Disturb sign up." And she walked away.

I understand that you obviously have to leave the room if you want it made, but why ask for a time to clean if you weren't going to respect it? It wasn't even 3:30 when all of these things happened.

Its a shame that this hotel hires this rude staff, because the hotel itself is quite nice and in a good location. However, I won't be staying here again and will certainly not be recommending it to others.

title: Fine and good value
text: Overall I'd recommend this hotel. I was a single female traveller and it was fine for my needs. It's between 23rd and 28th on line 6. There's quite a lot around, seemed to be some good bars and restaurants, which I didn't sample being on my own. But I was fine wondering around at night. Breakfast is pastries muffins and fruit, nowhere to sit really but happy to have in room. The lobby has a cool vibe but the rooms are not as cool, they seem a bit tired - could do with new carpet. They're also a bit narrow but fine if it's just you! Overall this was good value and would be a good base in ny. Staff were helpful.

title: Restful Hotel in Busy NYC
text: The hotel entrance in understated, and upon entering I felt the good vibe of this neat little hotel.  The front desk staff were consumate professionals, efficient and welcoming.  Our room was clean and tidy, and appeared to have been recently renovated.  The continental breakfast was adequate, and the coffee quite good.  I'd definitely stay here again!

title: Sembra un ostello
