text: Per la location mi aspettavo un albergo e non un "ostello".E' pur vero che La colazione a New York è un lusso, ma visto che abbiamo pagato di più per averla,ci sono rimasta male.Viene servita nella hall,su una mensola, non proprio grande, seduti su sgabelli se ti dice bene, altrimenti in piedi e ci sono solo cornetti, muffin,caffè e succo d'arancia.La sera non c'è un'insegna o una luce che indichi l'entrata, buio totale, meno male che c'è sempre un negozio aperto vicino. La nota positiva è la pulizia e il personale alla reception,simpatico e cordiale.

title: Super sauberes Hotel in toller Lage mit 1a Service
text: Bestes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis. Mit gratis Frühstück, das völlig ausreicht (Muffin, Süße Stückchen, Banane oder Apfel,  Tee, Kaffee, Kakao). Tolle Lage in einem netten Viertel. Zur U-Bahn (23 oder 25 ) sind es nur ca. 5 Minuten. Sehr freundliche Angestellte. Zimmer sind in einem TOP-Zustand- es ist alles vorhanden, was gebraucht wird: Fön, Duschgel, Shampoo, Conditioner, Bodylotion, Duschhaube, Nähset,... Mit Bügeleisen und Bügelbrett im Schrank sowie kleinem Wäscheständer! Besser geht nicht!

title: Fantastic boutique hotel!
text:
I stayed at the Lex for 3 nights at the beginning of March and I couldn't recommend it enough.
Really friendly staff, clean and modern rooms with lots of extra bonuses such as the in room chargers for all adapters and free wifi all over the hotel.

title: Great stay, always friendly staff
text: First time we almost missed the hotel as it only has a small entrance and lobby. The staff is really friendly and was always helpful. Baggage storage was also not an issue. Rather small breakfast in the morning in the lobby but had all what you need. Rooms were new, clean, large  bathroom, comfy bed. Got also a sheet with information on restaurants in the area. Tried eately (good for lunch) and blue smoke barbecue (great - don't forget to reserve). Will definitely stay the next time in the Lex!

title: Un hôtel excellent !
text: J ai passé 8 jours dans cette hôtel magnifique ! Le personnel est hyper sympas , serviable et S inquiète toujours de votre bien être ! La chambre est grande , la literie est super j ai dormi comme un bébé ! Le petit déjeuner est bien ( pâtisserie , fruit) avec boisson ( café , chocolat , the, lait jus d orange ) . Pas loin de plusieurs ligne de métro ! Je le recommande vivement ! Et je compte bien y retourner un jour !

title: Short stay, but GREAT!
text: I stayed at Distrikt on 02/20/16 and this hotel exceeded my expectations. Upon my arrival I was pre checked in by Junior who was very pleasant and helpful. My room wasn't ready yet (at 1pm), but it was fine because my friends and I had plans. We stored our bags and went to brunch. Once my room was ready, I received a call which from Junior. Upon my arrival back to the hotel, Eddine checked me in and let me know that my room was upgraded (awesome!!). The room was in great condition, with a great view of Times Sqaure, comfortable beds, and a very nice bathroom. The personalized note in the room was also very nice touch! Overall the staff were very nice and helpful; special thanks to Hugo, Eddine, and Junior! You guys are awesome. My friends and I will definitely be back.

title: Great place!
text: We love the Gramercy area and just discovered this hotel.  The rooms are very well appointed, clean and nice. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful and I loved how low key the lobby was - I really enjoyed not being pressured by a flock of doormen on entrance.  There was a bit of street noise in the night but it wasn't bad. The rooms are also a little bit small (NYC style) but for the price the hotel offers great value. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Best Kept Secret
text:
The staff is so incredible and friendly and willing to please.
I was alone during the blizzard and wanted someone to go out and take pictures of me making snow angels. One of the employees went with me.
This is a very affordable hotel and well worth it

title: Great Trip
text:
Spent 2 nights this past weekend and had s great time. The hotel is spotless and the front desk was super helpful. My room wasn't ready when arrived but they held my luggage and brought it up to my room when it was. They called a few minutes after to make sure everything was okay and did I need anything. 

I will defiantly stay here again.

title: Nothing Bad to say about this place
text: It's a boutique hotel. Stayed here one night. It's not as fancy as other big chain hotels. Meaning there isn't a lot of furniture in the room. It's kind of bare in comparison. But the hotel is super clean. All of the furniture is up to date and nice. The bathroom was clean and updated. I really didn't have any problems with this place. Front desk was nice.  We arrived about 2 hours before check in and they were able to let us up in our room. I would stay here again.

title: Hôtel à taille humaine, où l'on se sent bien.
text:
Nous avons passé 5 nuits dans cet hôtel très bon rapport qualité/prix, nous avons été très bien accueillis.
Le personnel est agréable et à l'écoute, de bons conseils.
Notre chambre donnait sur la rue mais nous n'avons pas été gênés par le bruit, même si les sirènes de pompiers s'entendent, cela ne nous a pas empêchés de bien dormir.
La salle de bains est spacieuse, la baignoire s'apprécie après les longues heures de marche.
Deux stations de métro à proximité, hôtel bien situé proche de tout. Le Madison Square Park et son Shake Shack, le Gramercy Park, ou même 15mn de marche de l'Empire State Building.
Le + : le petit déjeuner le matin pour ceux qui, comme nous, n'aiment pas partir le ventre vide.
Le - : la climatisation assez bruyante, nous la faisions tourner avant de nous coucher et l'éteignions pour la nuit.

title: Great value hotel in superb location
text:
Spent 3 nights at The Lex Hotel for our first trip to New York. The hotel is fantastic value for money and we received great service from all staff members which included printing tickets and advice for eating out. 

The rooms are basic but very comfortable. More than enough space for two people and a small amount of luggage, plenty of plug sockets too. There is no wardrobe space but plenty of hangers available. The room was a good temperature and the heating system was easy to understand. Our bathroom was quite cold however with a slight draft through the window but this may have been due to the -15c temperatures outside. Despite this there was no noise from the road or any other of the rooms, the room looked out onto a water tower. 

The room was well cleaned every day and we were provided with two bottles of water as well. We would definitely recommend this hotel, perfect for a short stay in New York and its location made it ideal for our first visit.

title: Secret gem!!
text: This boutique hotel is awesome!!! Let's begin saying I went in peak winter season but the personel makes this a warm place to stay.... Thanks to Omar, Alex, Odalys, Andrew who knew how to treat the hotel guests in a personal and caring way. Nice room and bath size, enjoyed the morning continental breakfast. Would definitely go back when visiting NY. Lots of restaurants nearby and close to subways.

title: Great stay
text:
We had a great stay at the Lex. The location is very nice and convenient, close to subway, café's and restaurants.
The staff was helpful and did the little extra for us, we had a problem with our air condition and they handled that very professional.

title: Neighborhood gem
text: Quick staycation with the wife. Fantastic location in a great neighborhood. So much nearby. Close to subway, Madison square park and all the area has to offer. Great for a stroll and food tastings. Highly recommend. Clean room, courteous staff.

title: Good stay
text:
I stayed here in February 2016 for 2 nights.

The hotel is warm, welcoming and comfortable. My room was exactly as described online and had a balcony and a patio door. Whilst the view was of a giant hot water tank, the ability to let fresh air into the room was much appreciated. 

The bed was comfortable and the bathroom spacious given the size and price of the room. Everything was clean.

Staff were friendly and helpful and I was able to check in 5 hours early and also leave a little late when waiting for an airport pickup. 

Good value and well presented hotel - I'll return.

title: Diamond in the rough!
text:
I had such a wonderful experience here! It was exactly what I was looking for- a wonderfully priced, clean, no-frills hotel. I wasn't looking for anything luxurious because who goes on a vacation to spend most of their time in the hotel! I was pleasantly surprised by how great the customer service was and how clean the facilities were for how little I paid to spend two nights there with my boyfriend.

The front desk was very cordial and accommodating- we had arrived earlier than check-in but they were able to arrange a room for us despite our early arrival. Our room was extremely clean- the sheets, the bathroom, and what have you. They were even nice enough to provide two water bottles, complimentary on the hotel, and the bathroom was equipped with nicer-than-usual, hotel goodies (shampoo, conditioner, etc).

The next day, we had left to traipse around the city and had left the room in utter disarray. When we came back, the room was impeccably clean and they were even nice enough to have organized some of our things for us, without having rummaged through anything. I had a few shirts that were strewn about (on the floor/bed), and they were folded with care and left on the bed. 

On the day of check-out, the front desk called 2 hours prior and inquired about our stay and asked if there was anything they could do to accommodate us, such as arranging for a car to the airport, or to hold onto our bags at the desk while we tried to squeeze out a few more hours of walking about the city before our flight- we were taken aback by how hospitable they were! 

Excellent service, extremely clean facilities, and very friendly employees! I would come back and stay at the Lex NYC in a heartbeat.

title: Hidden Gem
text: I have recently got back from a 4 day trip to NYC, my first visit in fact. I arrived early and a room wasn't free yet so I dropped off my bags and went exploring, which was no problem with me. When I return my room was ready and I had been upgraded to a larger room which was great. The room was airy, modern and very clean and I had plenty of room. The location is just a short walk from the subway (6 line). What makes this hotel is the service, I consider myself well travelled and have to say this is the best customer service I have had at a hotel. Staff where friendly and welcoming, and genuinely wanted to help. I will most certainly go back to New York and The Lex will always be my hotel of choice.

title: Excellent service from a boutique hotel
text: We had fantastic customer service from all the staff, from arriving Carolyn on reception was really helpful throughout our stay, the house keeper Jessie was lovely and courteous, all the guys on reception(sorry I do not know names) were also so helpful,the room was great, no view , but we didn't care about that , the room was clean tidy and quiet, the bathroom was large , clean and offered everything required, we had a welcome reception of drinks and snacks on the Tuesday evening, again very nice , there is nothing bad about this lovely hotel, it is also situated on Lexington avenue between 25/26th street so midtown ish, we spent lots of time lower Manhattan so it suited us fine. Thank you to the Lex Boutique , we will be back on our next visit from UK

title: Gran elección- Muy recomendable
text:
El hotel es pequeño pero nuevo y lleno de lindos detalles. La ubicación es perfecta, centro, bien conectado pero en una zona tranquila (imperdible el Squareat los fines de semana a la vuelta de la esquina)
Lo mejor: la atención de los recepcionistas. Te solucionan todo, te asesoran muy bien para los paseos y tienen atenciones como traerte un café mientras esperás tu shuttle.

title: Klein aber fein
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral und man kommt innerhalb von Manhattan schnell überall hin. Die Zimmer sind etwas klein aber völlig ausreichend. Hervorzuheben ist das Personal und die Kleinigkeiten. Jeder Wunsch wurde erfüllt, es gab an manchen Abenden kostenlose Snacks (Käse und Cracker) und Wein und immer Wasser in der Lobby. Das Frühstück ist völlig ausreichend und man kann sich sogar Kaffee 24h kostenlos auf das Zimmer bestellen.

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: We headed to NYC during the week to see a concert. We were looking for a hotel close to the venue and wasn't going to cost  an arm and leg. We found the Lex, a small boutique hotel. Cost was $150 for a standard room, which was a perfect price point. The staff was fantastic, rooms were small and clean, and checkout was a breeze. We will definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Good hotel in a convenient area
text: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the staff were super friendly and helpful. Booked a small room, but the air con unit was faulty so they immediately moved us to a another larger room without any fuss. The hotel was near the Flatiron district which has a good selection of cool bars and restaurants and was an equal distance between Time Square and Greenwich/Chelsea areas.

title: Friendly Boutique Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Lex over NYE and couldn't have been happier.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating (allowing us a very early check in at 10:30 after a red eye flight) and our rooms were cleaned with incredible care and detail (especially on the 1st after a boozy night out...sorry ladies!)
The location is perfect in my opinion.  We easily walked most places in about half an hour to an hour but if the subway is your thing it's also a 3 minute walk to the nearest station.  A bus also cruises along Lexington and takes you north or down to East Village. 
We were shocked at how quiet our room was and for the little sleep we got while visiting the city it was uninterrupted.
We were pretty jet-lagged and never awake early enough for the breakfast but I'm sure it was great too.
The rooms aren't huge, but plenty big enough for 2 people as long as you don't have massive bags.
I would definitely recommend the LEX to anyone coming to NYC and if we're lucky enough to make it back we will stay again for sure.

title: A fantastic stay!!
text: We stayed here for a week over New Year. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Fantastic little Gem central NYC! Couldn't have asked for a better stay. Strongly recommend it and will be coming back without hesitation!!! The rooms are great and hotel very central and close to Madison square park.

title: Christmas Holiday
text:
Christmas in New York is so magical!
The Lexinton Hotel is the best place to stay for price, location and Hospitality!! 
  Mia the manager was amazing!
When I had an issue with a credit card. She took care of it right away..
 Also accommodating up with rooms right next to each other. 
  When checking into our rooms.. We were welcomed with a delicious bottle of wine...
  We will definitely be back again..
Thanks from the Ryan family!

title: Great stay at a sweet hotel.
text: We were in NYC to look for an apartment and we stayed at the Lex after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. The front desk folks were fantastic. (Thanks Wellington and Caroline!) We had a Queen Supreme room with a small balcony nestled in between other buildings. The room was super-quiet and comfortable, plus the bathroom design rocked! We would definitely recommend the Lex to couples visiting NYC. This is a truly wonderful hotel.

title: Perfect boutique hotel for weekend
text: Felt lucky to find hotel at last minute for the busiest holiday weekend in December.  About a 20 minute walk from Penn Station.  This is a boutique-type hotel with recently modernized and nicely renovated rooms, although a little small.  Room overlooked water cistern so was quiet, although there actually was a small balcony and the window did open for night air.  Very comfortable bed and soft linens.  Plenty of room on bath vanity for toiletries.  WiFi free and easy to connect. Continental breakfast provided, and fruit (Fiji, not Delicious, apples!) but there are eateries nearby also.   Friendly and accommodating front desk, but no real sitting area in lobby for guests.

title: Great place for quick visit
text: Went there for one night to attend a conference at a nearby hospital. Great neighborhood with nice places to eat, great price. It's a great place for a quick visit, rooms are small but not terribly so, staff is courteous

title: Chilling in a great location
text: Very welcoming staff-notably Carol for us,but all friendly and helpful-in a very laidback hotel. Felt so comfortable here, nice bed, good room layout in superior queen, basic furnishings and storage is a little limited but everything really nice quality-love the nightlight in the bathroom, toiletries, the shower tub. Back facing room pretty quiet (apart from AC). Excellent pastries and muffins for breakfast, and loved grabbing a coffee and a piece of fruit as we left in the morning-plenty of choice when we were around but we were up and out early (it‘s NYC, we weren't going to lie in!) 10 mins to subway (6 train for north/south travel), can walk to Empire State in 15 mins, Times Sq or East Village in 30. Amazing range of eateries and bars on neighbouring 3rd Ave. Would hugely recommend The Lex, looking forward to returning. Thanks all, happy holidays!

title: Lovely little hotel!
text:
Nice hotel with lovely, welcoming reception area and most of the staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and we slept extremely well (at the back of the hotel) for the 6 nights we were there, once we had unplugged the noisy air con/heating system! The hotel is located in a fairly quiet spot so ideal for a good night's sleep. It's just a 5 minute walk to the nearest subway station but be prepared for reasonably long walks to some of the main tourist spots and there is a LOT of walking in NYC! 

The room has almost everything you need: hair dryer, iron and ironing board, small wardrobe, tv, alarm clock. The cozy room is certainly on the cosy side but it was more than adequate. The only problem is there isn't anywhere to store a suitcase or store clothes, other than a small wardrobe so you have to live out of your suitcase on the floor (not a huge problem). The bathroom was a great size, with a bath and was very clean with lovely products to use. 

The hotel does offer a light breakfast in the lobby from 7-9am which is sufficient to start the day but make sure you get there in good time if you want anything other than donuts! 

We were offered a late checkout (without us asking!) on the day we departed as we had a late evening flight, which was a very nice and very welcome gesture. This enabled us to have some extra time exploring the city, which was great. It was also really helpful that we were able to store our luggage at the hotel until we departed for the airport in the evening.

Overall a great little hotel, it's on the expensive side for what you get (we visited just after Thanksgiving, so a busy, expensive time), but overall it's probably worth it!

title: Great hotel
text: Great little hotel in NYC. Small but extremely clean and comfortable for a short stay in NYC. We stopped for 4 nights and couldn't fault the hotel or the staff. Everyone was really welcoming and friendly. Great continental breakfast every morning - coffee, orange juice, fruit, gorgeous pastries. Great location for all main attractions, either by subway or walking. Just make sure the taxi drivers take you to the correct hotel - be specific, give the full address not just hotel name, otherwise you get taken to The Lexington (a completely different hotel). Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: La soluzione perfetta!
text: Boutique hotel piccolo, centrale, molto curat e ben tenuto. A pochi passi da Flatiron Building, Shake Shack e Eatitaly. Per tutto il resto c'è la metro a pochi minuti. Ottimo anche avere la colazione in hotel compresa nel prezzo. Tariffe buone per essere a Manhattan. Camere piccole ma letti comodi e docce grandi e molto pratiche. Ogni giorno ci lasciavano in camera 2 bottigliette d'acqua e il Wi-Fi era perfetto. Insomma tutto veramente ottimo per chi arriva in coppia!

title: Basic, welcoming hotel in good location
text:
We were really relieved to be able to check in early on arrival, thank you! The room was spotlessly clean although really quite small, I thought the night light in the bathroom was a nice idea.

We were impressed by the location - for the 23rd St subway make sure you go down the right side of the road for Uptown/Downtown as there's no crossover once underground.

The staff were really helpful and they left a nice note and some cupcakes as we were celebrating a special occasion. We also sampled the complementary cheese and wine on the Tuesday evening, lovely!

Only downsides - the road outside was really noisy with traffic/horns/sirens and the window didn't keep much of this out, thankfully we were really tired. Air con was also really noisy and woke me up as it was right next to the bed. Breakfast was limited so we skipped it for the local diner (Murray Hill Diner) or Gregory's Coffee the next block over which were both great.

Overall a good stay in a good location, but a few touches to reduce noise etc could make it brilliant!

title: Not a business hotel
text: OK for personal use but a tiny room (even for NYC) with no room to unpack or work. Allowing next door's bathroom to take up a quarter of your room might make sense for the architect but not for the resident, particularly when you hear the toilet flush feet from your head. That said its clean and reasonable in other ways so if you don't plan on spending any time there is lots fine.

title: Superb stay at the lex!
text: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was fantastic. Check in was quick and easy and we were upgraded to a standard room which by New York standards was huge! The bathroom was great, the bed comfy and had all of the amenities we needed. Free wifi another plus! The staff were amazingly helpful, even printing some tickets off for us and looking after our cases. Check out was at 12pm which gave us more time in the city. The location is great with a shop right next door and the nearest subway about 5 minutes away. A very easy walk to the flatiron building and surrounding area. All in all a fantastic hotel, at an absolute bargain price. I would recommend to anyone and wouldn't hesitate in staying there again. Thank you lex!!!!

title: Excellent place with excellent customer service
text:
Superb cosy hotel. 

This hotel is excellent value for money and I can't stress how superb the customer service was. This made our holiday. 
Myself and my friend would definitely stay here again. Check out was midday making the holiday even more pleasurable. 

-greeted by excellent customer service everyday 
-free bottles water daily in the room was a nice touch. 
-we were upgraded to larger room
-we needed to print basketball tickets as the e-mail confirmation arrived when we were there . Reception kindly printed them. 
-Location was perfect. Nearest tube/underground station about 6 mins walk. 24hr mc Donald's 6 mins walk & Duane Reade near by with local shop next door. 
-Wifi: perfect & free 

-Cleanliness : excellent 
-Lift: spacious 
-Air con & heating: superb all manually adjusted by automated wall panel
-bed: very comfortable 
-room service : excellent cleaned daily 
-bathroom: perfect 
-iron & iron board were included in our room
-breakfast: we skipped this as we expected it to be basic, but Starbucks and plenty choice for breakfast in central 
Thankyou lex, this was fantastic .

title: Muy buen personal
text: Hotel tranquilo , muy buena la atención y la pulcritud !!! La habitación , si bien es sencilla , está impecable , la cama súper cómoda , baño amplio y nuevo , todo está muy limpio y cuidado !! El desayuno termina muy temprano ...A las 9 y suele haber poco espacio en el lobby , en cuanto al personal es lo mejor , súper atentos , amables y predispuestos !! Se encargaron de comprarnos entradas para un partido de los knicks , así aprovechábamos el  tiempo en seguir recorriendo esta hermosa ciudad !Ahi van fotos del barrio ! El Madison Square park es hermoso y tiene un Shake Shak que tiene muy buenas hamburguesas 🍔🍔🍔También está Eatly frente al parque otra gloria gastronómica 🍝!

title: Muy buena atencion
text: Los chicos de Recepcion unos genios , me consiguieron entradas para ver los Knics !!!! El hotel está en buena ubicación y cerca de los metros. Hay muchos resto cerca,!sobre la lexinton y sobre park Av . El desayuno es incluido y supera para empezar la jornada

title: Long Weekend in NYC
text:
We booked this small but nice and cozy boutique hotel through Orbitz as part of a package for our anniversary weekend.  The place was cozy but very clean and very convenient walking  to several restaurants, including Spice Symphony and the Empire State Bldg.  The staff was very nice, they had a convenience store next door, and they were 1 block from the 6 line on the metro.  

We will DEFINITELY  stay here again when we return in February.  We loved it and the prices, for NYC, were super affordable.

title: Perfect one week stay, would stay again!
text: I stayed here for one week on business and loved this hotel.  The staff were so friendly and warm.  The continental breakfast was perfect with hot coffee, fresh croissants and some fruit.  The room was nice and comfortable, I slept great and the noise from Lexington was not as bad as I thought it would be.  The location was great, close to delicious restaurants and there was always a lot going on in the neighborhood.  If you are OK with a no frills hotel definitely stay here, you will not be disappointed.

title: Soddisfacente
text: Posizione ottima, ben collegata. Hotel nuovo, camere belle non grandi ma sufficientemente spaziose. Colazione facile veloce e buona. Nulla da dire, se confermano i prezzi si tratta di una soluzione ottima.

title: Fantastisk beliggenhed
text: Min mand og skulle 3 hele dagen på sight-seeing i New York og valgte ud fra beliggenheden Lex Hotel, og det var det helt rigtige valg for os. Herfra kan man sikkert og roligt vandre hele Manhattan rundt, og samtidig er hotellet dejligt. Pæne og rene værelser, sød betjening og morgenmaden inkluderet - det var nok det svageste punkt. Wienerbrød, kaffe, frugt og juice og vand i receptionen.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This gem was a wonderful find. I found a great rate for one of their smaller rooms, called a cozy room, by waiting till the day I stayed to book. Although room was small, it was all I needed. Very clean and contemporary. They offered a free continental breakfast which was very nice. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Free wifi. Hotel is located in the Murray hill section of NY which is close to many great things to do. It's a 10 minute walk from the east village which I visited. I will definitely stay here again

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text:
We recently stayed in NYC for a week for a work trip.  I travel to NY for work about every 2 months and stay at a different hotel every time, but this may be my new favorite location.  My wife came with me this time, it was her first trip to NYC and this hotel was a great place for her to stay.  Great cafe's and restaurants nearby.  Madison Park has a Shake Shake in the middle of it.  The front desk staff was outstanding!  Always welcoming us as we came and went and providing excellent directions which is not always the case at hotels in the city.  Our room was a bit cramped, but very clean and it included complimentary bottled water in the room.  If you planning to stay for longer than a few days, you can request a refrigerator and if available, you can have it in your room (free of charge) and the free WiFi was excellent(again, not always the case in larger hotels).  Coffee/tea service was complimentary to the room as well.  Our room had a small balcony and the bathroom had a shower and tub.  If I wanted to bath, I would actually feel comfortable using this one, it was that clean. 

My only complaint is that the continental breakfast did not have any protein, not even a boiled egg.

title: Nice Hotel at Great Location
text:
Stayed here while on US holiday earlier this month (Nov 2015); nice little hotel in a prime location (just few blocks away from Empire State and New York Metro)

Very friendly front desk staff (sorry I forgot to note down her name); she was always happy to assist you - be it with city information or something to do with the room. our room was very spacious, but on ground floor.. fairly modern and clean.

I liked everything about this hotel except for breakfast; it was basic continental style serving which was fine for me.. but the thing I did not like was that they do not serve breakfast after 9am. We were at the counter one day 10 minutes past 9am, and there was absolutely nothing to eat except for a single crossaint (and it was a Sunday). 

Considering few travellers do wake up late while on holiday, they should have served breakfast at least until 10am.

title: Great home base for our first NYC trip!
text:
Room:  Small yet plenty of room for the two of us. Probably the cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed in which is saying a lot because I am nearly neurotic when it comes to hotel cleanliness.  It was a wonderful respite after spending the day on the crowded, chaotic streets of NYC. Plenty of space in modern bathroom, I especially appreciated the blow dryer that was NOT attached to the wall and actually worked like a normal hair dryer.  Small closet with a safe, hangers, and an iron/ironing board.  Large window overlooking Lexington Ave.  Quiet and efficient A/C/heating unit.  Comfortable, firm (but not hard) queen mattress, nice linens. 

Neighborhood:  Very easy walking distance to subways, restaurants, drug store, Madison Square Park, Flatiron district and Gramercy park. Very good central location to downtown and uptown.  Quick cab ride to Penn Station to catch the train to Newark airport.  I really liked that it wasn't on a MAJOR street like Park Ave or 5th.  Felt a little calmer and quieter.  No problem sleeping at night with the road noise.  

Service:  Each employee we encountered was courteous, knowledgeable, professional, and truly helpful.  They made our stay great! Loved the complimentary breakfast (muffins, pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, OJ) and the free wi-fi.  Check-in/check-out was a breeze.

Overall, I would highly recommend this place, only wish we had more time to spend exploring the nearby neighborhoods and eating at the MANY nearby restaurants!

title: perfect trip
text:
Fabulous hotel , wonderful working team , hotel very clean , Room cleaning everyday
Coffee , Orange juice and Water bottles are free .
Im french and i found some very nice pastries(pâtisseries).
Elevator/good design
No noise and good location
i recommend to all , see you soon.
Manon and Sylvain

title: Perfect hotel!
text:
We are currently in the Lex hotel, our 4th night out of 9. Everything is really great in this hotel. 
The hotel is quite recent and modern decorated, music in the lobby, personal very polite and sympathetic (i.e they call you 2 min after entry in your room to be sure that you are fine with the room! :-))
Our room has a reasonable size considering that you are in the heart of Manhattan, big enough for a couple. Our room is very clean, the bathroom too, the cleaning service is really good, fresh mineral water bottles in your room every day. Modern and nice bathroom. 
Small breakfast in the morning from 7 to 9am, with coffee, tea, milk, orange juice, fruits, pastries... 
Our room is at the last floor, 7th, street side, which offer a great NY view and you hear quite well the animation of the street... For us it's not a problem, as it is part of the charm of Manhattan, and you are in its heart! For those who prefer calm, I imagine the court side rooms more appropriate.
The location of the hotel is very central, perfect for us, just look at the map! ;-)
No doubt that we will warmly recommend this hotel to all our friends and we will come back there!
Thanks to the Lex hotel management and team!!

title: A little gem in a big city!
text: We stayed for 7 nights and could not find a fault. Everything from a speedy check in, helpful staff, good size room (for NYC standards) and a great location with lots of bus and subway options nearby and some good bar and restaurants. Union Square and Flatiron District close by and easy bus ride to Lower East side and West Village for exploring. We asked for a room on a high floor and at the back of the hotel which was organised so it was nice and quiet at night/morning.  Everything you needed was in the room including a lovely power shower.  The breakfast on offer was more than adequate and replenished regularly.  We loved the touch of a note and chocolates in our room when we arrived to wish my husband a happy 50th birthday. A nice touch.  We've visited NYC several times over the years and it never disappoints each visit - we enjoyed the fantastic Halloween Day parade on this visit.  New Yorkers are a friendly bunch (sorry but it's true) and this hotel is a gem so we will definitely return and recommend to friends and family. Although I agree with a previous reviewer that I almost want to keep this hotel our secret so we can get a room when we need it.  Thank you to all the team for making it a lovely holiday!

title: Great boutique hotel in the the center of Manhattan!
text: We have been 5 nights in this nice and friendly hotel. The hotel is modern, clean and has a good style. The staff was very friendly in particularly the receptionist. She was very friendly and supportive! The breakfast although small in variety was good in quality and consisted of fruit, pastries and beverages in the reception area with a view on the street and an interesting armory building. Thanks a lot for the nice stay in NYC...

title: Excellent
text: A lovely modern boutique hotel. Fast friendly check-in by Wellington. The location was perfect for visiting all the places we wanted to go to and only a short walk from the Empire State building. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was a little smaller than we were expecting but this didn't matter as we didn't spend much time in it as there were so many places to visit.  The room was very clean and modern with handy phone charging points.  Breakfast was served nice and early at 7 am and there was a range of fresh pastries and tea/coffee available which was perfectly adequate.

title: Great find in the Big Apple
text: I travel to New York regularly and struggle to find a good and affordable hotel. I have now found it. I almost don't want to review the Lex as I want to be able to always get a room there!  The Lex is situated well in east mid-town near the little India restaurants. The rooms are reasonably sized and the fittings new. There is a light buffet breakfast and the internet works well. The staff are pleasant and helpful.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
We stayed at The Lex for 6 days and we were hugely impressed with it. The staff were always friendly and the room was perfect for our stay. The room itself is decent in size, the bathroom is pleasantly bigger than I imagined and has strong WiFi connection and a TV with over 100 channels.

This was our first time in New York and this hotel certainly made our stay pleasant. Special mention to Wellington on reception who was super nice and friendly.

An amazing holiday.

title: A Nice Surprise in NYC!
text:
I had a business meeting in New York City on the east side and decided to stay at this small boutique hotel.

I checked in around 5 PM, and they were having wine and cheese in the lobby for 
all guests. The lobby is quite tiny, but it is a nice touch and appreciated.

The hotel staff were attentive, and very nice. I had forgotten my toothbrush and some other items and they took care of it quickly.

Omar at the front desk was kind and helpful.

In the morning they have a small continental breakfast with Croissant and coffee, Everything was fresh and nice!

The Decour is modern and the place is very small, intimate and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to be in the area and enjoys smaller hotels off the beaten path.

title: Great Location and Service
text: Upon arrival we were checked in promptly and handed some information about the local area - where to eat close by etc. We tried several of these recommendations during our stay and all proved to be good. The following morning, after breakfast, which was perfectly satisfactory and replenished frequently, we were given a map and directions to the nearest metro stops etc. We mentioned that we wanted to book a boat trip and the concierge then did this for us to save us having to queue for tickets (upon arrival at the circle line booking office we just had to swap our vouchers for boarding passes for the boat). We were greeted with a friendly smile and enquires about out day every time we returned. The room (cosy queen) was fine, and always clean. A little on the small side but we'd expected this. There was still enough room for us and two suitcases, plus the bathroom was larger than we'd anticipated. We would return if we found ourselves in NYC again.

title: In the heart of Manhattan neighbourhood
text:
Lex Hotel has a great location.  Walk around the neighborhood and you can see the true face of downtown Manhattan.  A melting pot where you can find Chinese, indian, Japanese, Lebanese, Thai food around the area.

It is also within walking distance to 5th, 6th avenue...

It is a boutique hotel, with small room (but clean and comfy).  So, for family of 3, we had to take 2 rooms, which was not ideal (don't think they offer bigger rooms for 3 or more).  Breakfast is very simple, just pastries and coffee (but a lot of good breakfast place around the area).

The staff service is good and pleasant.

title: hidden gem
text: I've stayed here a couple of times. Staff is wonderful. Rooms are small but stylish and CLEAN. Free breakfast is a definite plus. Corner rooms are a bit bigger. Cozy queens are VERY cozy. Standard are fine.

title: Top Hotel im Herzen von Manhattan
text:
Waren nur eine Nacht zur Überbrückung dort, aber das Hotel ist absolut spitze. Preis/Leistung ist top, hatten ein riesiges Zimmer mit 2 großen Betten und einem riesen Bad (war auch schon in anderen Hotels in NYC, da ist teilweise das Zimmer kleiner als das Bad im Lex). Das Personal ist super freundlich und hilfsbereit.

Absolut zu empfehlen! Beim nächsten mal NYC wenn der preis stimmt werde ich wieder dort absteigen.

title: New York
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel nel mese di maggio 2015 e ci siamo trovati benissimo, la posizione è ottima si trova vicino a due fermate dalla metro e a dieci minuti a piedi dal Flatiron Building dove si trova un'altra stazione della metro ideale per muoversi. Le camere sono molto carine e pulite un pò piccoline ma per il tempo che si passa in camera basta e avanza, il bagno è ampio e carino. Il personale dell'albergo è molto disponibile ad aiutare e dare consigli, c'è anche la possibilità di fare colazione offerta dall'albergo, noi solitamente andavamo allo starbucks praticamente dall'altra parte della strada rispetto all'hotel. Insomma noi ci siamo trovati veramente bene e se dovessimo tornare a New York rialloggeremmo sicuramente al Lex!

title: First time in Nyc
text:
I've never felt the need or had the desire to write a review before but having stayed at the Lex for a week I just had to let others know what they would be missing if they didn't stay at the Lex!! 
We arrived very tired after a long day travelling to be met by the first smiling face I had seen since landing !! The young lady swiftly checked us in and we were soon asleep in our lovely bed. The room isn't big but is extremely well appointed, ours was quiet and had a small balcony !!
Morning came with our first look at daylight in nyc !! The breakfast was fresh , coffee hot and in fact we had it everyday for our 7 day stay. 
Not knowing where anything was we asked the guys in reception who were not only knowledgable but friendly and funny too. They gave us help and useful tips throughout our week and always asked how our day went etc. 
We were out all day and night seeing everything but it was so good to get back home to our room and get coffee or tea bought up to our room to refresh us. 
All in all I cannot say anything negative about the lex and would love to go back soon. 
Keep it up guys !!

title: Brilliant Stay
text: As soon as we walked into the lex, we were greeted by a very happy Angelica who recommended places to eat and go in and around NY. Our room was very comfortable and very tidy and the cleaners did a brilliant job replacing towels and such even when we hadn't asked them to!! The atmosphere throughout the whole hotel was lovely and there was no hesitation from the staff when we required some help or needed information! Wellington organised our taxi back to the airport for us aswell as recommending a fantastic Italian which is just around the corner. I very much recommend this place to stay whether it's your first, second or 100th time in NY!!

title: Perfect hotel
text: We Stayed in the lex for 4 nights in October 2015, upon arrival we were greeted and checked in by the most lovely lady who helped us get to grips with where we were and recommended us some places to try ( BLUE SMOKE IS A MUST, only a block away and was the best place we ate, along with their neighbours Itruilli) the rooms were very comfortable and spotlessly clean, as they were every day when we returned from looking around the city, the staff really make this place, so friendly and helpful, whether it comes to places to eat or just information about the city they knew it all, and were never wrong! And Wellington was awesome! Location wise you can't get much better, short walk to time square, and all the important places, but just enough off the main streets to not be too crowded outside. there is no need to look for another hotel in New York this is the place to stay! we will definately return when we visit the city again. Thank you so much.

title: Great place to stay!
text: My husband and I could not have been happier staying in such a nice hotel.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location was perfect for us.  The room was clean  & compact. Who needs a big room when you should be exploring NYC?Would stay again!

title: Lovely !
text: We stayed at the Lex for 4 nights ! We arrived to a warm welcome ! Our rooms were very spacious especially by NY standards and the bed very comfy just what we needed after a day pounding the streets ! The bathroom was lovely with complimentary toiletries and a hairdryer. But it was the staff who made our stay extra special ! Nothing was too much trouble and they were a mine of information ! Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone wanting a fab hotel in a good location . Many thanks x

title: Fantastico
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel nel mese di marzo e ci siamo trovati davvero bene...camere piccole (come in tutta Manhattan d'altronde)ma molto pulite...bagno grande rispetto alla camera...e poi la colazione inclusa nel prezzo (molto ma molto onesto rispetto a tutto quello che si trova online) ottima e ricca...l'albergo si trova al centro di Manhattan, con pochissime fermate di metro si è a Times square..quindi posizione ottima così come lo è stato il soggiorno...consigliato!

title: Good value
text:
If you are the kind of person that needs a hotel where you can lounge in the lobby, have a drink or a soda after a long day etc, The Lex is not your place. But if you are looking for a nice place to stay when in NYC, this might be your thing. Very nice and service minded staff, clean rooms and good location. The rooms facing the back are both bigger and more quiet, so ask for one of them.

The breakfast is simple and something you could take on the go, but why not eat out when you visit New York? 

The Lex is good value for money, if there is such a thing on Manhattan.

title: Modern Hotel with a Convenient Location
text: The hotel is modern and clean with a sleek vibe.  The staff is EXCELLENT.  The continental breakfast has nice fresh fruits, a variety of pastries, but no protein.  Fresh ice water with fresh lemons is always available in the lobby...even at 2:00 am.  When I requested tea in the evening it was delivered to my room.  Rooms are small and closet space is limited.

title: Great value and nice location
text:
The Lex offers great value (on the NYC-scale) on a nice location. 
The Lex is located on Lexington ave. , between 25th og 26th street. 
Madison Square Park / 5th ave / and the Flatiron bld. is just a 5-7 min walk away. 
The Empire State bld. 7-10 min. and Macys about 15 min. 
Several Subway stations nearby. 
Rooms at the back are very quiet, and you are not likely to be kept awake by traffic or discos. Rooms in the back also seems to be a little bit more spacious. 

Staff is friendly and helpful. 

Luggage storage between you checkout and departure is managed by staffed and seems to be safe. (Luggage are kept in a locked room) 

All in all, The Lex gives great value for money if you're looking for a clean place to sleep and rest, without the need of spa, room service, a fancy lobby bar and so on. The beds might bit a little bit firm for my taste, but not firmer than an average hotel-bed.  During hot summertime I could wish for a refrigerator. 

I would be happy to stay at the Lex again.

title: Wonderful, quiet, clean lodging in NYC
text: We chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews, knowing nothing about NYC.  We felt very lucky our entire week there.  We paid alittle more for a room on the top floor, near the back.  We heard absolutely no noise, till our very last night, and that was a party in a neighboring building, and it didn't last after about 9:30 pm. The room was a pleasant size and very clean.  All the staff were consistently pleasant and very helpful, we dealt mostly with Andrew in the mornings, but again, they were all great.  It was an easy walk to a very central subway station, plus walkable in general. We felt safe in the area.  The only complaint would be fairly firm beds, but that's very subjective...it was offset by how quiet it was.  Very good AC also.  There were multiple restaurants close by, the hotel also gives a list, which was convenient, plus drug stores and deli's.

title: Boutique hotel at a reasonable price
text: We spent a week at the Lex NYC and enjoyed the impeccable service, the well maintained room fitted with modern technology (AC, internet) that really worked as well as the decent location. The main negatives were the fairly small room and the breakfast. While croissants and pastries were excellent, the breakfast was being served in the fairly tiny and cold lobby (and not in a separate room with chairs and tables). As a European, I missed orange juice, bread and butter and a decent seating option for breakfast. Compared to other NY hotels, the service and the well maintained rooms provide good value for money, while the decent location (5 minutes walk to the subway) gives you easy access to the metro. Quite a few good restraurants within a five minutes walk (Blue Smoke, Amber, Florian Café, etc.).

title: Gran hotel.
text: Estuvimos 10 días en el hotel y estuvo genial. Bien ubicado, un trato excepcional y las habitaciones muy limpias y modernas. Volveríamos ahí sin problemas. Por poner alguna queja no está del todo aislado del ruido y alguna vez se oye el ruido de la calle o de otras habitaciones.

title: Great location excellant service!
text:
Great location in the middle of Manhattan, quite  a small hotel but with excellent staff. Wellington on reception was wealth of local knowledge, very hospitable and a caring laid back manner!
Easy walking distance to Empire State Building and must go to Madison Park for a burger at the Shake Shak. 
at the hotel the rooms are compact very clean and a perfect retreat after a days exploring. Try Big Daddies Diner a few blocks away for a great breakfast.
Would recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

title: A nice, out of the way hotel.
text: The Lex is a nice out of the way hotel located on Lexington Ave. between 26th and 27th Sts, on Manhattan's East Side. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but only a short $10 to $12 dollar cab ride away. The room was spacious enough and the bed was fairly comfortable(though a bit firm for my taste). It was spotlessly clean and even had a small veranda with a chaise lounge. The one problem I did encounter was that the shower was turned on by pulling on a knob attached to spigot, something I did not know and after I searched for the way to turn the shower on for about five minutes I decided to call the desk. But the fellow who answered the phone was very helpful. I got the feeling I was not the first person to encounter this problem. All in all though my stay at the Lex was a pleasant one and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Mi alojamiento en NYC
text:
Hotel muy recomendable. Buena ubicación, hotel sin lujos pero muy limpio, el trato del personal fue excelente, resaltar la atención de Andrés y Odalis. sin duda, volveremos.

Bajo mi punto de vista los desayunos los podrían mejorar añadiendo a los donuts, magdalenas... un poco de mantequilla, aceite de oliva y ya el remate serían unas tostaditas!

title: Moderne et bien situé
text:
Hotel récent ce qui signifie qu'il est parfaitement isolé (d'une chambre à l'autre et vis à vis de l'extérieur) .Notre chambre étant de surcroit situé sur cour , nous n'avons pas été gêné par le tintamarre des véhicules de police et de pompiers , spécialité de New York . La chambre était de taille satisfaisante et disposait d'une belle salle de bains .
Accueil attentionné mais exclusivement anglophone (mais les logiciels de traduction automatique sont là en cas de besoin...)
Seul bémol : le petit déjeuner dit "continental" se résume à de la viennoiserie ,des bananes et des pommes et l'on doit s'installer dans l'entrée devant la réception sur des tabourets...
Enfin il est entouré de restaurants indiens permettant d'échapper aux burgers .

title: Great boutique hotel!!
text: Stayed at the Lex with my boyfriend and it was amazing.  Great location and steps to the subway made it easy to get around.  The staff was fantastic and helpful for recommendations.  The room was clean and the bed was great.  Even the general manager introduced himself and made sure we were taken care of.  Great experience all round.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great experience!
text: My husband and I stayed at The Lex for five days the end of August and into September.  As first time travelers to NYC, I spent tons of time reading reviews and made my decision to stay at this hotel based on TA recommendations.  We stayed in room 607, which has a queen bed and nice bathroom with a small balcony.  The balcony faced the exterior of other buildings so visually not appealing, but a nice way to catch a breath of air in the morning, rather than hanging out on the street.  The room was adequate for the two of us.  Comfortable bed and most of all, clean!  They do supply a hair dryer.  Only improvement I could make would be to put a small 3 drawer dresser under the TV for those of us that like to unpack and stay organized.  The breakfast offerings were good enough for us with pastries, fruit and coffee.  We were up and out of there by 8 most days so always plenty for us.  My husband watched some people stuff their pockets.  Come on people. The hotel gives you a list of food recommendations.  Our favorite spot, however, not on the hotel's list, was Molly's Pub & Restaurant, which is an American, Irish pub close by.  Good food, service, beer and bar. The hotel is close to the 4, 5 and 6 train stations.  We bought an unlimited pass for $31 (cost plus a card), immediately took a wrong turn but was rescued by a nice NY lady and her little kids.  Cheap, safe transportation.  Little confusing on the weekends with closings for maintenance, etc. but ask the attendant at the desk of each station or the guy running the train; seemed they opened their windows when they stopped at the stations to answer questions.  We took a taxi from JFK for $52 plus tip.  Easiest, but not the cheapest way to get to the hotel after a long day of travel.  The Lex doesn't have the craziness of Times Square but a good place for almost 50 year olds to drop after a long day. They left us chocolate for our first trip to NYC!  The staff at The Lex gave us every reason to return to their hotel and to their great city.  We'll be back!

title: Very Good Experience
text: We arrived before check-in and the couple in front of us got the last room so I waited on the couch in the small but cute lobby.  I could hear the front desk person, Wellington, dealing with guests in person and on the phone and he was just so likable and professional I didn't get annoyed when our room wasn't ready until after check-in time.  He called me over and said they had upgraded us to the next level of room due to the wait.  It was very nice of the hotel given we don't have status there.  Wellington is definitely a great employee and they are lucky to have him!  The room we had was still small but definitely enough space for what we needed.  The bathroom was about the same size as the room so plenty of room in there.  The room was very clean.  We didn't get to see the morning buffet but there is a deli next door and then tons of places within walking distance.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: The Lex -67 Lex Ny
text:
We visited Sep 2015. great location , very attentive helpful staff.they even serve a complimentary breakfast . First room we got was small but we got upgraded the second night at no additional cost to a , 
.fantastic quiet larger room. It was also Very clean

title: Hotel parfait !!!
text:
Hôtel vraiment très bien situé, le personnel est très agréable, le petit déjeuner est très appréciable et très bon :-) ( si j'avais une remarque, il manque du jus d'orange) ...
Les chambres sont très confortable, nous avions pris une junior suite pour deux car new-york était notre destination finale après un mois de voyage a travers les etat-unis et nous voulions avoir un peu de place pour nos bagages ... Nous n’avons pas été déçu, la chambre était gigantesque, nous aurions pu être 4 adultes et ne pas se marcher sur les pieds ... Dans ce cas-ci, nous avons eu de la place pour nos nombreuses valises ....  Une bouteille d'eau est donné tous les jours, c'est un plus .... La salle de bain est très agréable et les produits de soin sentent hyper bon ... Nous étions coté cour, la fenêtre donnant face à un mur (seul petit bémol) et encore, pour le peu de temps passé en chambre, cela ne nous a pas dérangé car au moins pas un seul bruit la nuit .... 

La liste des restaurants proposés par l’hôtel comme se situant pas loin sont effectivement pas loin et sont très bon ... Une préférence pour Little Basil, vraiment à coté, excellent et pas cher .... Un rajout à faire peut-être est shake Shak situé dans le madison square park ... Un vrai délice ...

Je vous conseille aussi le service de voiture proposé par l’hôtel pour aller et venir de l’aéroport ... Nous l'avons pris pour aller de l’hôtel a l’aéroport pour notre retour chauffeur parfait connaissant les petits chemins détournes afin d'arriver à l'heure et pas beaucoup plus cher que le taxi .... Si nous en avions eu connaissance avant d'arriver, nous l’aurions réserver de l’aéroport vers l’hôtel ... 

Pour avoir déjà été à New-York deux fois, dans deux hôtel différent, je peux vous dire que maintenant que nous avons trouvé le Lex, nous y retournerons ...

title: If cleanliness is important to you, pick the Lex NYC!
text: At first I thought I picked a place too far from where I needed to be & that it was more money than I should've spent on a room. Wellington & another man greeted us when we arrived & helped with our bags. We had a red eye flight and arrived a few hours earlier than check in but we were able to get into our room right away which was awesome! I brought my son out for NYU housing move in day. He was only going to stay at the Lex the first night, but then, since he & I were so busy getting him settled into the dorm, and with the NYU welcome week events he attended every night it always ended up being really late & he didn't want to bother his new roommates so he came back & stayed with me. The Lex had no problem with our change in plans and were very nice about it. Even though we were hardly there long enough to make a mess, they still wanted to be sure the room was given a good cleaning everyday. I felt bad & tried to only trade out towels and reassure them that it was perfectly fine (I just didn't see any sense in them going through all the work when we hadn't even pulled the covers down on the bed the first couple days because my son had his blanket & pillow on top & I have insomnia and didn't sleep much & I had my own pillow too). I was content with them skipping my room, but I could tell it was a little unsettling for them to walk away without completing the task because they wanted to be absolutely sure it was clean. Housekeeping even called my room to make sure it was taken care of. Which shows they really are on top of the cleaning, it's important to them and it really shows! I'd like to mention that another guest had commented on the restaurant & wait staff. There isn't a restaurant or wait staff (all of the hotel staff were great though) but they do have fresh items delivered each morning for self serve, like croissants, pastries, fruit, coffee & hot water for tea & cocoa (like you see in the pictures) And I'll have to say, that prior to my stay, I'd read a review that mentioned the breakfast & said if you want anything you need to get down there early or it'll be gone and that's true because we went down at 8:30 an there wasn't even a drop of coffee and literally only 2 drops of hot water, a banana & one croissant. I was crabby (not a morning person) and rudely left my cup at the front desk & took the stairs back to my room. So later that night when I was talking to Mario (the best front desk clerk) about it & asked if he'd apologize to the morning staff for me because I felt bad for being rude. He said I will but you don't have to apologize. He said they try to keep on top of that & will run out & get things if needed & was very apologetic about my experience. And he reminded me that there's always coffee, tea & water that I could have brought to my room. I told him I knew that, I was just not ready to be around a bunch of people & then have someone push me out of their way to grab another danish. I didn't blame them, I said it wasn't his fault I didn't get down there early and he certainly didn't have any control over other guests (especially since he worked the night shift, ha!) seriously though I was just a crab. Well if it happens again he said just let them know and we'll take care of you if you don't get anything. So my advise-if you're really wanting something to eat- is to be down stairs by 7:00 am if you want first pick and probably no later than 8:00 if you want anything at all because they are tasty and there's no limit so if the first person takes 30 items (you never know!) you're probably not going to have a lot of choices if you're the 10th person down there! Oh yeah, and don't be crabby & storm off (like me) if there's nothing left, instead ask the wonderful staff behind the desk if there's anything left and then see what they can do for you, as I'm sure they will do their best to accomodate you! So overall I was so pleased with my stay there that I was happy I ended up there and the distance to NYU was still within walking distance & the dorm was in between NYU & The Lex so it worked out well for us because we also walked to Times Square and Grand Central as well as the Rockefeller center & Madison Square without a problem. I have to say that the staff was absolutely the best! I'm sure I was even annoying Mario every night as I'd request ice & I'd wait for it so they wouldn't have to bring it to my room. But if he was annoyed he didn't show it & was attentive & always very nice. He was training Dina the last night I was there & I ended up talking to them for quite sometime and I probably screwed them up because they couldn't discuss their work with me talking away. But they just let me keep on with smiles on their faces then I realized Mario's shift would be ending soon & I had cut into alot of the time he was expecting to use to train Dina! Oops! I felt bad but they were super nice and said it wasn't a problem even though it probably was! So you two, I hope I didn't screw you up too much!! I thank you all especially you Mario for listening and putting up with me! The Lex would be my first choice if I needed to stay in the city again. But next time I'll probably have to stay in CT with my boyfriends family so I won't be as lucky and neither will you because I'll still come say Hi! Anyhow, I loved my stay there & will recommend it to anyone who needs a great little hotel that's quiet, clean & has a wonderful staff! The Lex NYC is Perfect!

title: Great location
text: This is a nice hotel in a good location. The common areas are very nice and the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small which is to be expected in NYC. We were disappointed with the food in the lobby restaurant, but the wait staff was great. The lobby is always busy and bustling and you can walk to many of the sights.

title: Unique hotel, helpful staff
text: Really lovely hotel, and quite unique. Rooms were really clean, and the staff go over and above to help you. A nice addition was complimentary wine and cheese one evening. Good location for being central to all parts of Manhattan if you want to see all parts.

title: Excelente estadia
text: Mesmo chegando antes do início da diária fomos muito bem acolhidos e alojados em um apartamento que para ser perfeito só necessitava de um frigobar. Excelente localização com vários restaurantes ao redor, acesso fácil ao metro. O café da manhã é bem básico e de excelente qualidade, o suficiente para iniciar o dia.

title: Good stay
text: This hotel is very well located, blocks aways from Flat Iron and Eataly as well as just a couple of blocks from the 28th st subway station. The hotel is new and rooms are average size for New York standards. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The area is surrounded by Indian restaurants.

title: great stay
text: I stayed here from 8th sept until 12th, really enjoyed my stay, the staff were very friendly and helpful.  i would stay here again.the room was cozy and the location was good and once i found my way around it made it easier.

title: Fabulous find
text: This hotel has risen to my #1 favorite in NYC. Dina and Odalis so graciously assisted us with luggage, coffee requests, and directions. Our room was clean, the bathroom roomy, everything we needed for our stay. I will definitely return to this gem!

title: Friendly, Informative Staff! *****
text: For a last minute one night stay for business, the Lex NYC had to have been  the most stress-free night I've had in NYC. I started off being greeted by Andrew at the front desk. When arriving at the hotel Andrew immediately greeted me making my experience that much, like I was at home! Furthermore Andrew was very knowledgable with the local hot spot restaurants and dining establishments of my liking; making my stay that much better! The Lex NYC offered a white glove service of cleanliness and friendliness, there's not much more you can ask for with a last minute booking.  Thank you!!

title: qualità prezzo inbattibili
text: ricordiamoci che siamo a new york in agosto ed  i prezzi sono alti.Hotel pulito, personale molto disponibile, camere piccoline ma pulitissime e moderne, situato in ottima zona vicino a tutto quello che volete fare! Se propio dobbiamo fare una critica è la colazione un po povera.Da consigliare.Ci ritorneremo!

title: Eccellente hotel!!!!
text: Sono stata in questo hotel una settimana in agosto 2015 con il mio compagno e devo dire che e' stato un soggiorno perfetto. Oltre al fatto di essere centrale, comodo per prendere la metro e veramente economico rispetto ad altri hotel di pari categoria, devo elencare molti altri pregi: colazione inclusa nel prezzo, buona continentale, abbondante, l' hotel nuovo, pulitissimo, veramente curato, la camera non grande ma silenziosa rispetto ai rumori esterni ( avevamo chiesto una camera sul retro) e interni, il letto comodissimo, camera con  tutti i confort, bagno bellissimo doccia davvero spaziale, comodo avere tutti i giorni in camera due bottiglie d'acqua, wifi gratuita, asciugamani e biancheria ottima, personale gentile e cortese, l' ultimo giorno ci hanno procurato una macchina privata per raggiungere l'aeroporto meno costosa del taxi! insomma lo consiglio assolutamente sopratutto a chi vuole stare a Manhattan ma senza la confusione presente nella zona di Time square.

title: Wonderful boutique Hotel
text: Hotel Lex was a perfect overnight or longer hotel. We were met by Andrew at the front desk. We travel a lot and hands down he was the friendliest , most accommodating , front desk person ever. The rooms were decorated beautiful the bed was very very comfortable. Great location. The morning we were checking out the General a manager Matthew Slippoy met us, introduced himself to us, and asked how our stay was. Boy did we ever feel important..thank you Hotel Lex we Will be back. Thanks again Hope

title: One night stay
text: We chose to stay here forthright last night on our honeymoon. The hotel is in a fantastic location and provides  service. The hotel is very clean and the staff cannot do enough for you. We thank you for our great stay. A special mention to Andrew who was excellent at main reception.

title: The City that never sleeps!
text:
We visited NYC 10-15 Aug this year. Just my wife and I so a large room wasnt top of the list of requirements. Our room was small,  a wee bit 'spartan', had minimal storage space (x1 narrow wardrobe) but did have a nice bathroom, bath & Shower. Space is at a premium in NYC so as long as you expect a bit of a squeeze it should not cause too much angst. If like us you intend to spend most of the days out exploring, the Lex is in a very good location and the the small basic rooms will not be a problem. The hotel does provide a simple continental style breakfast buffet and will also supply coffee/tea directly to your room. 
The staff are all very helpful and special thanks to Salomon and Wellington for their great tips and advice during our stay. Overall the Lex Hotel is a good choice for a city stay.

title: A gem in NYC!
text: I discovered this hotel on NightNight, it was featured among the coolest affordable hotels in NYC. Definitely a gem! Good vibes, great location with the Flatiron and Madison Square Garden a few minutes away. Rooms are simple but have nice design touches--wooden floor, black tiled bathroom. A little complimentary breakfast is also available in the morning. Really awesome value for money, I highly recommend!

title: Boa localização!
text: Esse hotel tem uma ótima localização, fica próximo ao metrô, a Times Square e a outras avenidas bem movimentadas, onde facilita o acesso dos turistas. O atendimento é muito bom, com funcionários muito prestativos. Recomendo

title: Good hotel - just watch what you use!
text:
Staying in the Lex Hotel is an experience. From the outside, the hotel appears to be just another storefront, with some barstools and a countertop. However, upon stepping in, the counter staff has a warm greeting from the start coupled with a smile.

I had Omar to help me check in, and there was barely any hassle, even though I was checking in at about noon (check in time is about 3pm) and my room was already prepared and available.

Lift service is a little slow, but at least it works. There is always the option of stairs, but luggage makes this less likely.

The room itself is a little smaller than other areas or cities, but this is New York and evidently the trend. I was staying on the 7th floor, and the water pressure was rather weak, but enough to get by. Temperature was good and hot. It was nice having a tub, even if I chose not to use it. Having the option makes it lovely, especially compared to other properties that despite having higher costs, lack this.

Breakfast was complimentary. Served in the lobby, where seating is at a premium, it consists of pastries, croissants, coffee, tea and milk. Fruits are present. Hours are from 7 to 9, and the clearing up is rather punctual.

Location wise, it is within walking distance of the subway, and there are some interesting places around to see: Madison Square park, to name one. Getting to hte hotel via subway is not recommended, as navigating the train stations with luggage is difficlt (not all are lift-equipped).

Aside from the few minor nigglies (low water pressure, lack of seating for breakfast), the only major gripe I had was that of calls. I had issues trying to make calls, even though I dialled 9 followed by the number. The only way to connect evidently was to dial 1+800+whatever number. On top of that, when I checked out, I was charged for the calls. For a property of this standard, usually calls (at least locally) are included!

The staff were apologetic about it, but there was not much they could do, since I did make the calls. However, it irks me still even thinking about it.

Overall, it is a good hotel, with good location and awesome helpful staff. However, always ask before using anything, to avoid charges!

title: Hidden gem
text:
I was in the city playing host and tour guide to family from out of town , so I was looking for a simple and clean hotel knowing we wouldn't be spending a lot of time there . ( amenities were not a no 1 priority )
The lex fit the bill perfectly .
The hotel is in a relatively quiet part of town if there is such a thing in NYC . The best thing about the lex are the staff , polite friendly and helpful, every single one of them . The rooms were clean and modern and the quietest room I think I have ever stayed in in NYC . If room service , a gym and a mini bar aren't high on your list of priorities then the lex is for you .

title: clean and well located
text:
The Lex was conveniently located and very close to the subway.
The hotel looks new and modern with a clean spacious bathroom.
The staff were very friendly and professional.
We got a good deal on our room for the couple nights we stayed there so it was well worth the money.
I regret not stressing that i wanted a room with a view ..ours faced to boilers and a brick wall.
The breakfast wasn't much ..but we didn't mind because we were preferred to eat at the many restaurants the city has to offer (if you're looking for breakfast included you might be disappointed.
The staff kindly stored our luggage for an entire day after check out.
Overall we were happy and would stay there again visiting NYC provided we ask for a better view.

title: Great stay
text:
Our trip to New York was made all the better from staying at the Lex. The room, although slightly on the small side when you are travelling with a baby is adequate and is most certainly excellent value for money. Very clean and modern amenities.

The staff were extremely friendly and always helpful with their recommendations...especially when it came to places to eat!

Location was excellent...in between Downtown and Midtown.

title: Ótima localizacao
text:
Esse hotel é muito bem localizado. Se vc gosta de andar a pé para ir conhecendo as redondezas, esse é perfeito! Dá para ir a pé para a Times square, empire states, macy's, quinta avenida, rockfeller center  e até para o Central park.
O quarto é pequeno, mas a cama é queen sise  e muito confortável. O banheiro também é bom! Tudo novo e bem limpo.
Tem um café da manhã que eles servem na recepção e come-se de pé, mas nunca consegui chegar a tempo de aproveitar. Umas nove horas já acabou quase tudo.
O pessoal da recepção e super prestativo. Eles dão muitas dicas e ajudam no que podem!
Gostei e voltaria a me hospedar nesse hotel.

title: A First-Time Gem
text: Our very first visit to NYC was made all the more better by staying at the Lex NYC.  From the time we pulled up to the front entrance until we checked out, the staff was courteous, helpful, and knowledgeable about our needs.  The room was clean, adequately appointed, and spacious enough considering we spent very little actual time there.  The hotel is conveniently located near two subway stations, and the continental breakfast every morning was just enough to get us started on the day's activities.  The neighborhood was generally quiet, and has many different restaurants and bars within walking distance, as well as several nice parks.

title: A fine cheese wedge shaped little room!
text: Shape of the room looked like a cheese wedge,  so did the bathroom as well , however it suited our needs. The shampoo and conditioner smelled like 7up and the hotel was also difficult to find as my man and I went to the Lexington hotel first , when we were told we were at the wrong hotel. The pillows were not comfortable. The shower head was lovely though !

title: Urlaub
text:
Nach 3 wöchentlichen Aufenthalt in den USA,  Abschluß in NY. Dieses Mal in diesem kleinen feinen Hotel
Es befindet sich in einer sehr urbanen Umgebung, voller Leben und Lebensfreude in Manhattan. Hotel prima
Wir fühlten uns gleich wohl. Alles sehr unkompliziert und man wird bestens beraten. Immer wieder gerne.

title: Average hotel. Clean and comfortable enough.
text: Went to NYC for the weekend and wanted a decent hotel that was centrally located, clean and reasonably priced (for NYC). This is basically what we got. The hotel itself is small, the lobby and rooms are small and the elevator moves at a glacial pace. The room was clean and had A/C. The A/C unit was incredibly loud and was hard to sleep with it on. The wifi was free, fast and easy to connect. The staff were friendly. The continental breakfast was minimal and pretty much gone by the time we went down at 8:30am). The hotel is not bad for a NYC hotel, and I would not be opposed to staying there again; however, I would probably look for a slightly nicer property on my next visit to NYC.

title: Efficient hotel
text: We stayed 2 nights at The Lex.  It is located in an area of NYC with many small local bistros.  The lobby is tiny, the morning breakfast is sufficient but go early because there is not much there if hungry people get there first.  The rooms are small like others have stated, but the design of the rooms is quite efficient,  Room was spotless and bathroom was very nice for NYC hotel standards.  What was most impressive was the high level of customer service.

title: Sometimes its the little things
text:
Stayed here for business, Problems started first night, I arrived in NY early, thought Id stop by the hotel to see if they had my room available, being 11 am I didnt figure they would but at least I could drop off my bag. The gentleman at the front desk was most helpful. Professional and very helpful. He let me know that the room was not ready but he would call me when it was and gladly stored my bag.

I returned to a new Gentleman running the desk at 5:30 - The room still was not ready (check in is posted as 3pm) after about 10 minutes he said he had a room for me. 502, To the gentleman already occupying 502 in the shower I apologize for walking in on you. I went back to the lobby where the Manager? a very nice woman helped the front desk get things straightened out. I was given a complimentary bottle of wine and upgrade. 

Some small things, the AC unit in my room when on smelled like burning rubber, No fridges or coffee makers in the room - I requested a bucket of ice and a glass to drink some water, 30 minutes later a man appeared with ice and a champagne flute and i must tell you the amount of ice that fits in a flute vs water ratio is barely a sip. I had the do not disturb sign on the door and house keeping called the room while I was taking a nap to confirm the sign on the door. 

The rooms are small however very clean. beds are comfy - If you are one for hard pillows you may want to bring your own, those bad boys swallow your head like quicksand.

title: A Great Base for Exploring Manhattan
text: We stayed 4 nights in this boutique hotel. The rooms are relatively small but very clean and comfortable. We liked the price, which includes coffee and pastry for breakfast, and the location. The staff on the desk are very helpful and recommend local places to eat. We will use this hotel On future visits.

title: WOULD STAY AGAIN!
text: Was here for an overnight getaway in March.  Lots of snow still around.  Room was clean and comfortable.  LITTLE terrace (still snow covered), but when you stepped out onto it and looked to the left, view of Empire State Bldg.  Very nice staff.  Good location between 3rd Ave & Lexingston, 25th & 26th Streets.  Terrific pastries with coffee in lobby in morning. Tasted as if they came from a local bakery.  I think I'd even return just for THAT! Walked around the corner to great Thai Restaurant, Little Basil, then walked only two blocks from hotel to Jazz Standard and enjoyed the music of Anat Cohen!

title: Très bon hôtel, design, parfaitement situé
text:
Nous avons vraiment apprécié notre séjour au Lex, où, pour un prix -relativement- raisonnable, nous nous sommes sentis comme dans un hôtel de standing. 
Le design est très moderne, épuré, coloré, mais de bon goût, l'accueil est impeccable, le staff se met en quatre pour proposer un accueil agréable, donner des bons conseils, et rester à la disposition du client à toute heure du jour et de la nuit. 
La chambre est de taille convenable, la salle de bain très jolie, et le lit est très confortable. 
Extrêmement bien situé, dans le quartier du Flatiron, et non loin de Union square, beaucoup de choses peuvent se visiter à pied sans aucun souci, et les métros ne sont pas très loin de toutes façons. 
Les (petits) - : 
Les chambres sont peut-être légèrement bruyantes, mais de toutes façons, il faut se lever tôt pour profiter de la ville! 
Le petit déjeuner est un peu chiche, et en raison du manque de place se prend dans le petit hall d'entrée. 
Conclusion, à notre prochain passage à NY, nous savons déjà où nous résiderons.

title: Hotel bien situé et convivial
text: Nous revenons tout juste de New York où nous avons dormi 6 nuits dans cet hôtel. Ce fut un séjour très agréable. L'hôtel est propre, les chambres sont belles, le petit déjeuner très correct et surtout gratuit (!), et la situation géographique est quasi parfaite : plusieurs stations de métro sont à proximité, on est là à peu près au milieu de Manhattan et on peut donc se rendre très rapidement partout. Il est possible d'avoir une chambre côté rue ou côté cour. A priori je pense que le côté cour est le mieux car la rue semble vraiment bruyante, mais il y a tout de même 2 grosses souffleries qui se font un peu entendre dans la cour. Rien de bien grave cependant.
