Pour le reste voici ma sélection de restaurants dans le coin : Little Basil pour un bon repas Thaï à faible coût, Brother Jimmy pour d'énormes Ribbs et l'ambiance américaine, Shake Shack pour un déjeuner ou dîner hamburger bien sympa à l'air libre au milieu d'un parc, et enfin, pour finir le repas, un petit vendeur de glace à emporter dont je ne me rappelle plus le nom mais qui est au début de la 2ème rue sur la gauche en sortant de l'hôtel. Je termine cet avis en adressant un grand merci à Souleymane qui nous a accueilli à l'hôtel de façon extrêmement sympathique, qui a toujours été disponible et plein de très bons conseils, et qui parle de plus français couramment. Merci Souleymane !

title: Amazing NYC experience
text: Went alone unexpectedly to NYC for my first trip and my stay at The Lex made everything better and was able to live and breath the city to the fullest. The rooms are amazing and the beds very comfortable, always super clean. The staff was also always very helpful, especially Angelica. I wanna go back as soon as possible <3

title: Service from the heart
text: In New York, the service is generally not excellent. Perhaps that´s why the service at Lex hotel feels so extraordinary good. With personality and presence, the personel gave us the best possible experience of the hotel and NY.

title: Short stay in New York
text: Couldn't fault them!  We flew into New York early in the morning knowing that our check in time was not until mid afternoon.  Despite this the staff happily agreed to store our luggage and we were offered coffee and muffins and a place to freshen up before we went sight-seeing.  The room was not as small as I had anticipated from reviews - certainly large enough to accommodate our luggage comfortably.  Everything was fresh and modern and when we finally retired, the bed was heavenly!  The staff were knowledgeable and helpful and on checkout again stored our luggage until our departure late in the afternoon.

title: Incrível!
text: A localização é excelente! Fuja dos turistas da Times Square e se hospede próximo ao Gramercy e Madison Square Park. Dá pra ir andando até a 5a Avenida e você tem fácil acesso à qualquer ponto de NY já que o hotel fica do lado de duas estações de metrô. Os quartos são novos em folha e o atendimento é impecável!

title: Superb rooms, well situated and helpful staff.
text: Stayed for four nights for a leisure trip to New York. The room was modern and spotlessly clean. It was advertised as a "cosy" room.so I was a little apprehensive about the size but it was perfect;y adequate for two people.The staff were very helpful, particularly about advice for the July 4th fireworks. It is situated mid Manhattan and is quite close to the subway..The breakfast was fairly minimal but I didn't mind this.Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for the price I paid.

title: Nice boutique hotel
text: You immediately feel welcome, the staff at the reception is nice, warm, efficient. It stays like this through all shifts, all times of the day until you leave. That alone is worth a lot. The hotel is not big (48 rooms) but the rooms are nice. Not big, but also not as small as other hotels, but modern, fresh and clean. WiFi is perfect, fast, easy, good connection, and free. The way it should be. The location is a bit off, but still quite central. It is in an area with many Indian restaurants, and the usual Starbucks etc. Park, and 5th are not far. There is not really a breakfast room. In the lobby they serve some coffee in a thermos, croissants (not crispy), and some pastries. No proper place to sit, not American style breakfast, no healthy options. OK, Starbucks is across the street, but still, if they had a bit something better for breakfast, I would rate them Excellent hands down.

title: First visit to NYC..Lex helped make it fantastic
text: We booked the Lex online about six weeks ago on the recommendation of a close friend who had stayed here a few times. It took some persistence to reserve a room online but it is worth it. This is an ideal location to visit downtown and uptown! Our daughter had an internship in the financial district and was staying in the NYU dorms. This was very easy to get to dining and shopping via Uber or taxi. We stayed in a Junior suite and it was very quiet. No hassle with elevators and the breakfast was just right. We found the front desk staff to be very friendly, helpful , and accommodating. Street is just steps from the lobby of this immaculate boutique hotel.

title: Great location and staff, clean contemporary hotel
text:
We stayed here for a The Bird and The Bee concert we walked to at Webster Hall.  It's just a couple blocks from Grammercy park and Joe's Pizza (3rd and 14th).  You can also hit Fashion Ave or Madison Square Gardens with a short walk.  Tons of food options around the hotel.

The room was very clean and contemporary.  The bathroom had plenty of space, and the water was hot and had good pressure.  Everything was clean and neat.

The bed was great, we both had very restful sleep.  Different pillows for those who prefer harder or softer ones.  

It was nice to sit on the balcony for a few minutes before going down to the free Continental breakfast.  I unfortunately couldn't eat them, but my companion loved the croissants and muffins, which had to be fresh baked from a local bakery; not like the frozen, packaged kind you would get at a chain.  The coffee and fruits were fresh and good.

The staff was great.  Since we had a car, they were able to suggest a garage to park in a block or so away, and even gave maps and price estimates.  They offered maps of the city and suggestions on the local area.

We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again next time we visit Manhattan.

title: Gem
text: Great hotel! We went for the 4th of July weekend and our 2 year anniversary. Very modern and updated. It was clean, friendly, and wonderful location!  Staff was helpful and pleasant. The room was small but met all of our needs. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Plenty of outlets in the room. No coffee maker in the room but you could call and they would bring it up to your room :) Little store next to the hotel for drinks and breakfast sandwiches.  Hop on the subway in all directions easily. Two wonderful parks located in walking distance to take a bottle of wine and glass to enjoy the evening or a cup of coffee to start your day. Lots of restaurants with in walking distance. I quieter area compared to most. Would definitely stay again.

title: A great spot
text: My husband and myself were staying in NYC for about a week and stayed at the LEX NYC it was a surprisingly modern hotel if you look at what you can get dollar for dollar in New York. The Service was always warm and welcoming. We even got the car service to the airport and the guys were nice enough to shield us from the rain while we ran to the car lol. My one and only thing that could have been improved in my opinion is the breakfast that is offered, there isn't a lot of variety and especially if you are late down to it. Also seating in the lobby for breakfast isn't the greatest. In saying that. The Tuesday drinks and nibbles in the lobby was a nice way to meet other travelers. :)

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: My husband recently stayed here while dropping my daughter off at school for the summer.   He recommended it for a girls weekend and it was a great recommendation.   We absolutely loved our junior suite and it was the perfect size for the three of us.   Room was super clean and housekeeping made sure it stayed this way during our three night stay.   The hotel staff was absolutely outstanding from the minute we checked in until the minute we checked out.   They took care of everything we needed and always with a big smile.    Location was perfect.  Subway was close by and staff was always available to grab us a cab if needed.   I will definitely stay at the lex next time I am in nyc.   Can't say enough good things!

title: Great location for walking around town!
text: This boutique hotel was clean, comfortable and convenient. We  walked everywhere and ate at fantastic places close by. It is really close to excellent restaurants and easy to get to Grand Central (central hub for subways to get anywhere in the five boroughs as well as Metro North to Westchester and Upstate). Helpful and friendly staff and small and cozy clean room. Found it on hotels tonight app. It was a super find in midtown. Great stay!

title: Very nice Hotel , would recommend !
text: Hotel is nicely located . The staff was amazing ; helpfull , polite and very accomodating . Small but clean and functionnal room . Also near the subway wich is practical . Would go back without hesitation .

title: Muy recomendable
text: La gente que atiende este hotel es estraordinaria,la conserjeria se destaca ampliamente,es increible me senti como en casa,a los que hablan español se los recomiendo,pocos hoteles de estados Unidos tienen esta atencion para los de habla hispana,las habitaciones son comodas de un hotel de 3 estrellas.El desayuno es lo que me impide poner excelente porque no esta bueno, las instalaciones muy buenas.wifi muy bueno,excelente.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel!  We got there early and they accommodated us and allowed us to check in early.  Small room but you don't go to Manhattan to sit around your hotel room. Everything was clean and comfortable.  Free wifi.  Conveniently located, could walk to a lot but also easy to hail a cab.  Parked nearby for $35 overnight.  Noise was no problem for us at all.

title: Lovely ,spotlessly clean hotel with great staff
text: Hotel is in a good location, easy to get about, plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance and is opposite the armoury which is quite interesting. Room was smallish but well laid out with a comfy bed and was bright, clean and modern. Bathroom was great, good shower and everything you needed. The staff we encountered , Wellington and Andrew, were helpful , polite and very patient! As it was our first trip to New York, we had plenty of questions for them!! We would definitely stay here again and will recommend the hotel to friends and family.

title: Flawless Stay
text:
When I am in NYC this isn't where I usually stay but I wanted to mix it up some and made a change and I did not regret it. My concern about giving this glowing review, and the others that will follow  by other travelers is that they will end up raising their prices. I hope not because that is part of its beauty and charm is that its one of the few hotels in NYC that you don't feel like you are paying way too much for way too little.

I arrived before my room was ready and the gentleman behind the counter was courteous, and efficient even though he couldn't get me in he recommended a great coffee shop with free wifi. 

I failed to get any pictures of the lobby but it a great space with a mired and glass tile covering much of the walls. Accented by black (can black accent?) and big windows looking out onto Lexington.

Check was smooth and painless. I got a quick run down on things to do in the area and where to eat. 

My room was on the very front of the hotel, 2nd floor over looking Lexington but there was a nice think pane of glass keeping the noise mostly out and two levels of curtains. one for diffusing the light, the other to block it out. 

The room is cozy, as in small, but it was very clean, very well appointed, and obvious care was given to its furnishing and no space was wasted. It isn''t the place to go if you are having a group and expect to lounge in the rooms. I do speak from my room, but i teems from the pictures all of the rooms are equally cozy. I didn't feel cramped in this room, but there wasn't any extra space, or a sitting area. There is a small desk, with a chair but it too was cozy.

The bathroom was nicely sized for the smallness of the living area. Again, nice attention to detail with excellent products and obvious care taken in how it was designed. The sheets, blankets and towels were all clean and very plush. 

When I called the front desk I was greeted with my last name and every body was friendly every time at the front desk. I was there for 6 nights and saw a good cross section between the morning breakfast, the Tuesday wine and cheese and my nightly request for ice. By the second night when the front desk picked up the phone they greeted me and asked if I wanted my ice. It shows they were paying attention and they were on top of things.

There wasn't an area that they slipped in other then one night I called for me ice, and 30 minutes later I called back down. They apologized and it was taken care of immediately.

I highly recommend you trying The Lex out for its NYC value, outstanding service and its well appointed rooms.

title: Great place to stay
text: I just spent 2 nights at this hotel and I have nothing but good things to say about it. The room was clean.  The Staff was very friendly and willing to accommodate in any way.  In the morning, hot coffee and wonderful pastries and fruit.  Most important to me was that my dog was welcomed.  As long as they continue to welcome my dog this is where I will stay every time I visit New York.

title: Fantastic across the board
text: For starters, the staff is absolutely incredible.  From the minute you walk in, until the moment you leave.  This crew gets in.  Omar, Jessie, the entire team -  Thank you!!  Welcoming with open arms, providing guidance and recommendations for the area, and quite simply, just ensuring that you have everything you need.  The rooms themselves are well appointed, yet also simple, which I loved.  Nonetheless, you feel really good coming back to this Hotel after a day of walking and eating, or eating and walking, or heck, just eating.  Whatever.  The Lex sits perfectly within an area that provides a sleuth of upscale and outstanding restaurants, yet you are never too far off the beaten path to explore the greatest city.  I honestly cannot say enough good things about this place, and look forward to staying at the Lex NYC Hotel sooner than later.  Thanks again to all of you.  Awesome staff with great personalities, and a true focus on customer service excellence!

title: great hotel, great staff!
text: stayed in this hotel for a few days at the end of April. great clean hotel, brilliant base to explore the city and absolutely wonderful staff, willing to help with anything. can't recommend it enough!

title: Genuine warmth and hospitality in the middle of Manhattan
text:
I have been staying at this hotel multiple times to visit my daughter who is studying in New York. Some times I have stayed here with my wife and sometimes by myself. Every time I have been amazed at the genuineness and warmth of folks at the reception desk. For those who are not familiar with NYC's rushed culture - let me clarify that genuine warmth is rare find in Manhattan.

I have stayed in standard queen room on upper floors as well as in double queen room on the 1st floor. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. Simple breakfast and coffee in the mornings is excellent in quality. Tuesday evening wine and cheese reception is great as well.

I love the fact that the hotel is in the neighborhood of Madison Square Garden which is convenient for morning and evening walks; and that it close to so-many excellent Indian restaurants which is super cool for getting simple South-Indian or North-Indian dinner and chai every day.

I would heartily recommend staying at this hotel for both personal or business trips.

title: The Lex
text:
Stayed in a standard room on the 7th ( top floor )
Room was decent size for NYC , spotlessly clean , efficient if a bit noisy air com.
This is NYC so take ear plugs as this city never stops !! 
safe area , breakfast a added bonus , but croissants run out about 8 am !!
All staff are great , helpful and full of local advise !!-- leave a decent tip
Note to management -- give them a 10% pay rise -- they deserve it 
Would stay there when next in NYC

title: Fantastico!!!
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel una settimana, dal 15 al 22 giugno. Personale molto cordiale e disponibilissimo. La camera favolosa! Piccolina ma pulitissima, bagno spazioso con una doccia enorme. L'unica pecca è stata la mancanza di un armadio per i vestiti che sono rimasti nelle valigie. La linea Wi-Fi, gratuita e velocissima, ha sempre funzionato alla perfezione. Il letto era qualcosa di magnifico! Mai dormito in un letto così comodo! Una manna dal cielo dopo una giornata passata a camminare per chilometri alla scoperta della città. La colazione è diversa da come siamo abituati in Italia, ma anche questa davvero buona: selezione di brioche, muffin, frutta, latte, caffè. Menzione d'onore per le girelle con uvetta e cannella! Il check out è solitamente previsto a mezzogiorno, però dato che il nostro volo era alle 20:30 ci hanno lasciato la camera disponibile per un'altra ora gratuitamente, cosa che abbiamo apprezzato davvero molto. Dopo il check out abbiamo passeggiato un'ultima volta per le vie di Manhattan e le nostre valigie sono rimaste in hotel senza costi aggiuntivi. Che dire.. non so se avrò ancora l'occasione di tornare a New York, ma se mai dovesse succedere so già quale hotel scegliere! Complimenti davvero!

title: Hôtel très soigné, accueil parfait, très bonne situation
text:
Hôtel très soigné: propre, bonne literie, design agréable
Accueil parfait: réception très aidante et disponible
Très bon emplacement, bcp de restaurants sympas à prix raisonnables autour
petit déjeuner gratuit, et de bonne qualité, pas une habitude des hôtels new yorkais!

title: Great little hotel!
text: Just visited for a long weekend and was very impressed!  Me and my wife and little dog were made to feel very welcome.  Excellent front of house staff and everyone was very friendly and willing to go out of their way to be helpful.  Small but well planned, clean bedroom and bathroom and quiet.  You couldn't hear any traffic noise from Lexington Avenue.  Very happy, would definitely stay there again.  Thank you!

title: Приличный отель
text: Приличный отель с хорошими и светлыми комнатами и отличным месторасположением в центре города, рядом  публичный транспорт и много интересных мест которые стоит посетить! Отель имеет ресторан  в котором накрывают завтрак, подают  обеды и ужины!  Комната  была просторной, с отличной  большой ванной комнатой! Все чистенько и не дорого!

title: Great hotel on great location
text:
The Lex NYC is just 2 blocks away from Madison Square Park. We visited this place for 5 nights in June. The staff was really wonderful, going the extra mile to make guests happy. The hotel also has a nice interior, the pictures shown are not lying!

Our room was 403. As it turned out, this is a room with a connecting door. The major disadvantage of this, is that you can literally hear what the people in the other room are saying. This is quite annoying when people start talking as early as 6am. Luckily for us, this only happened one morning, and after 30 minutes we called the reception to complain about the noise. The other guests were then called by the reception, and all went fairly silent after that. 

Breakfast was good, although the choice is a bit limited: pastries, croissants and fruit. Also, the seating area is limited: only around 10 people can sit in the lobby (where breakfast is served) at the same time. We took our breakfast to our room when all the seats in the lobby were taken. This was no further problem. 

The cleanliness of the hotel was very good, everything you could wish for. 
The neighborhood is like you expect in Manhattan: busy streets, restaurants and little shops everywhere. We especially liked the Madison Square Park, with the famous Shake Shack. A must-visit! The ever-present waiting line says enough,

If we ever go to NY again, we will definitely consider this hotel again.

title: Totalmente recomendable
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado, con dos paradas de metro a escasos cinco minutos de distancia. El trato del personal del hotel fue excelente. Se preocuparon por ayudarnos en todo lo que estuvo en sus manos. Muchísimas gracias a todos, en especial a Andrés y a Armando.

title: Brilliant long weekend away!
text:
Cannot fault this hotel. Very new so no problems at all. Very clean. What made it excellent for me would be the front of house staff. Remembered us every time and asked how has your first day been? Have you had a lovely birthday? Really good service, personal touch.
Area is fab. Little walk up your at grand central little walk left your in Broadway/Empire State building area.
Straight out of the hotel and up two blocks is the best curry I've ever had.
Thanks you Lex for a fab birthday weekend.

title: Our EXCEPTIONAL stay at the LEX!
text: After a long drive to NYC, we looked forward to settling in our hotel and getting a few hours of sleep. LEX Hotel provided us with a very comfortable, welcoming and friendly stay. The staff welcomed us the moment we walked in and our room was ready within minutes even though we arrived prior to check in time. Once we saw our room, we were satisfied as it was clean and spacious for a downtown hotel. The beds were very comfortable too and my 6 month old daughter had a crib for her comfort as well which we appreciated. We would definitely stay at this hotel during our next trip to NYC!

title: Excellent location to explore NYC
text: We recently spent three nights at The Lex.  It is an excellent location to investigate the city and all its boroughs.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  The room was small and compact but all that we required.  We can highly recommend the good value for money hotel.

title: Excellent service and clean rooms
text: Stayed in NY for a week at Lex hotel and we truly recommend it. 10 min walk to union square, and many nice restaurants nearby. A newly renovated design hotel with fresh and clean rooms, aircondition and comfy beds. But the best is the staff👍 very serviceminded and helpful, always with a smile. Ok breakfast, coffe, the, muffins, pastry and fresh fruit. We will book it again!

title: Nice staff serve would-be breakfasts in trendy paper walled boutique hotel for a price
text: This hotel is well located  between upper and lower Manhattan. It has nice and professional staff helping you out in a friendly way. The environment has a trendy touch but the walls must truly be made of paper. The same goes for the windows on the third floor letting in all the noise of the avenue below. Breakfast has a spartan timeframe between 7 and 9 a.m. (even on Sunday!) and consists of dry muffins, coffee, tea and croissants (if the early birds before you left any). There are also oranges and bananas, of which staff got some more when they themselves got a bit embarrassed seeing me looking at the empty buffet on Sunday morning. So all in all not such a good deal for a not so small price.

title: Another perfect stay at The Lex
text:
This is the third time staying at The Lex and I finally got around to writing a review. Each time upon arrival I've been greeted from an amazing front desk staff, very genuinely kind and courteous. Check in was very quick (they'll let you know about a free wine and cheese lobby party every Tuesday), free wifi (which was fast), and many surrounding restaurants and attractions. 

The room was great - clean, very comfortable beds, great big TV, well stocked toiletries. Was really quite excellent. 

Location was great, so many great places to eat and shop close by (Blue Smoke, Eataly, Shake Shack). 

My favorite hotel to stay in NYC.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: This is a wonderful find in a good location and at an excellent price (for New York..) The room was clean and modern. We had a Superior room (607) on the back with a balcony facing onto the quieter back courtyard so we could open the windows without the noise from Lexington. Good included continental breakfast (good pastries). The most important thing was the staff. Everyone I had contact with was extraordinary and contributed to a lovely stay in New York. Would recommend to anyone and will stay there again for sure

title: Chic, convenient location and fantastic servce
text:
I've been warned many things about New York, but staying at The Lex NYC alleviated many of the fears I had during my first visit to this city. 

We had just gotten off an overnight flight and were just desperately in need of check-in and shower. Front desk were exceptionally helpful and despite the recommended check-in time of 3:00pm, they were able to advise that the room could be available as early as 1pm. We were able to leave our luggage there as we tried to kill a few more hours in the city before check-in, and they delivered on their promise as the room was available at the advised time. 

The location is quite convenient - close to one of the subway stations, and walkable distance from 5th Avenue which is the nexus of the universe in New York (divides the East & West streets). 

NYC is a noisy city, so there are few places you can stay without the sound of sirens passing through 24/7. This was not an exception, but granted, given the territory. 

Things I love about The Lex is that you almost don't feel you're in a hotel and get to experience life as a local. There is no on-site restaurant because NYC is a 24 hour city and you can stroll downstairs and get a cup of whatever, whenever. Also has all the basic things you need, and nothing you don't. Basic breakfast pastries, coffee is provided in the lobby in the morning. As a foodie I found the list provided in the room of recommended nearby eats extremely useful, and delivering on both taste & quality!

I'll be back to the Lex NYC on my next trip to New York - keep continuing to maintain the standard and updating the hotel!

A special thanks to Wellington at front desk as well - you made check-in & check-out painless and pleasant!

title: 67lex
text: Hotel très agréable et propre chambre bien équipée fer à repasser, et très bien  situé station de métro à proximité et beaucoup de commerce, le personnel gentil et serviable ainsi que le petit déjeuner de bonne qualité  à refaire sans hésiter.

title: clean, updated hotel in good location
text:
we stayed here for 1 night for a wedding in the City. I am from NYC and have also stayed in a bunch of hotels around. The hotel is clean and nicely updated. There is a very small lobby. No bar or restaurant, but for our purposes it did not matter. Everyone who worked there was very helpful. The location for us was perfect, it is on Lex and 26th Street. Lex in that area isnt great, since it is not that residential and across from the Armory; however, it is not unsafe. Super east to grab a cab and there is a 24 deli downstairs. 
The rooms were very clean and updated. They were also a nice size. We asked for a fridge and one was sent right up. We had a deluxe queen as we wanted a terrace. The terrace was smallish and faced the back of another building, so nothing to look at. But it was perfect for our purposes, as my hubby is a smoker. 
would def stay again.

title: Will not stay anywhere else!
text: Amazing staff, awesome location, free wifi, free breakfast, complimentary wine and cheese at the end of the day, free water bottles in a clean and comfortable room.  Did I mention the extremely helpful and friendly staff?? I Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Wonderful Little Place... Even Better Staff!
text: Stayed here for my first trip to NYC for business... what a gem! Location was wonderful, the room was spotless, and the guy at the front desk was SUPER helpful! Needed food recommendations, and he will tell you what is questionable and what is awesome. Will return another time for pleasure with the family.

title: Service done right!
text: I'm in NYC every year for an event and each year stay at a different Midtown East hotel. I'm a bit of a travel snob and usually anything less than a 4-star eludes my radar. This year I booked at The Lex NYC since it was a block from my venue--boy was it the right move. While the location was great and the room was perfect for my needs--what really stood out was the service. From top to bottom, every one of the staff I met was truly excellent at their job. Having hired over 100 people in my own business I know what it takes to build and keep a team running at the top of their game and whoever manages The Lex NYC is doing it right. Angelica, Armando and Wellington (?)--thanks for making my stay an absolute pleasure. I'll be back!

title: Hotel con sorpresa
text:
El hotel está bien: moderno, habitaciones bien equipadas, limpio, cómodo, trato amable del personal,...
Pero hay que destacar dos cosas:
Queda lejos (andando) de los principales puntos turísticos de nueva york y lo mejor:

TE CLONAN LA TARJETA DE CRÉDITO CUANDO HACES EL CHECK-IN !!

Solo la gasto para hoteles y alquileres de coche. En NY solo la entregué en el hotel.

Mi pareja y yo fuimos de luna de miel y otra pareja de nuestra ciudad también acudió un par de semanas después con el mismo resultado: TARJETA DE CRÉDITO CLONADA.

El recepcionista que nos atendió: Un tal Andrés.

Avisados quedáis.

PD: Nos hicieron un cargo de 578€ y tuvimos la suerte que nuestro banco detecto que dio error y cancelo la tarjeta.

title: Great place to stay!
text: This hotel is beautiful!! Very elegant and clean. I was surprised to find such a spacious room in a city like New York. The staff are very helpful and kind and we loved the fact that everything is within a walking distance. They offer a very light breakfast which is great for the price, considering that most hotels don't provide breakfast. Definitely recommend it!

title: well done!
text: Stayed for a night in NYC, great location, clean room, and affordable. The staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful. Room was very nice, all we needed for a quick overnight stay, very convenient and comfortable. Loved the fresh, iced lemon water in the lobby! Will definitely stay again sometime. Thank you!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: This hotel is down as an affordable boutique hotel so we were not expecting high level service. I was completely wrong - staff are incredible, really friendly and helpful giving you suggestions on where to go as they get to know you more. Breakfast is easy but good. The staff will bring tea and coffee to your room whenever you ask for it and give you umbrellas when it's raining. Rooms are a good size, bathrooms are lovely, clean and new and all mod cons are in here. The location of the hotel is only a 20-25 min walk from Times Square and near a number of subway stations. I've stayed in some of the extremely smart hotels in NYC for £500 a night and the Lex Hotel NYC has by far been the best experience customer service wise so far!

title: zentrales, nettes Hotel - Perfekt für Manhatten
text:
Das Hotel ist durch seine zentrale Lage mitten in Manhatten ausgezeichnet gelegen und eignet sich daher bestens für Städtereisen.
Das in der Lobby angebotene kostenlose Frühstück umfasst nur Croissants, Muffins, Süßgebäck, Kafee und Obst. Es ist aber trotzdem sehr sehr nett, da sowas in den USA bei weitem nicht selbstverständlich ist und es für den kleinen Hunger am Morgen vollkommen ausreicht.

Zimmer:

Die Zimmer sind zwar recht klein, aber modern ausgestattet. Es fehlt soweit an recht wenig, ausser an einem Föhn & (ungewohnt) an einer Toilettenbürste. Diese sind in den USA sehr unüblich und eigentlich in keinem Hotel vorhanden.
Durch die zentrale Lage mitten in New York gilt zu beachten, dass dementsprechend auch häufig die Geräuschkulisse ist. Gerade neben relativ häufigen Kranken-, Feuerwehr- oder Polizeieinsätzen und rangierenden LKW, sind auch Autofahrer in NYC nicht zimperlich was die Hupe angeht.

Da man aber mitten in NYC wohnt sollte man das verkraften bzw. eh erwarten können.

Sonstiges:

Das Personal ist äußerst freundlich und händigt einem beim Check-In neben einer Karte auch einen kleinen Infozettel aus, auf dem neben den allgemeinen Hotel Infos auch Infos über empfehlenswerte Restaurants usw. zu finden sind. Kleine, aber feine Sache.

Anreise per U-Bahn: Bitte beachten, dass in New York U-Bahnstation nur selten Aufzüge haben und es daher an Treppenaufstiegen zu Schlepparien mit Koffern kommen kann. Auf größere Station wie z.B. die Penn-Station trifft das nicht zu, hier ist ein Aufzug vorhanden.

Fazit:

Alles in Allem ist das Lex eine wirklich gute Adresse für eine Städtereise um Manhatten bzw. Brooklyn zu erkunden. Durch die in der Nähe gelegenen U-Bahnstationen ist man überall recht schnell (das Empire State Building ist sogar zu Fuß gut erreichbar!) und immer mobil.

title: Outstanding Service in the Big Apple
text: Stayed for 2 nights at the Lex Hotel in NYC...I have to say it was one of the most pleasurable stays I have had..The Hotel was very clean and the room was very good and not your typical shoe box like I have stayed at in other hotels in NYC..The staff went out of their way to provide the very best of service and really made you feel comfortable.I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a place in NYC..It's not your huge hotel but it's really a nice cozy place at a very affordable price..Hats off to all the staff at the Lex in NYC!

title: Great location, rooms, and service
text: We stayed at the Lex for two nights during Memorial Day weekend and had a great experience. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful as soon as we arrived. They helped us find a place for lunch and told us about some great places in the neighborhood. The rooms were small but clean and perfect for a weekend away. We would totally choose the Lex again.  The location was very covienent for Madison square park, Chelsea, and also not a bad walk to times square.

title: Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff
text: We stayed here in May for five nights and would stay here again.  The rooms were small but what you'd expect in NYC.  More importantly for me, the rooms were very clean.  The staff were very friendly and remembered us from one day to another and went out of their way to try and accommodate us.  The air conditioning was broken and they fixed it right away.  Then when we would walk through the lobby, they would ask if it was working ok.  I did not eat the continental breakfast because I am gluten free.  There are plenty of restaurants nearby and places to get juice if you're in to juicing.

title: Clean, quiet, and a great location and wi-fi is included!
text: The Lex is not fancy,  but it is very clean, quiet, in a great location, and the staff is exceptionally helpful. Our room was small but well appointed, perfect for the budget minded traveler who still want a comfy bed and wi-fi after  long day of seeing the sights.

title: Goed en Leuk hotel
text:
Leuk en modern hotel voor mensen die aan het citytrippen zijn.
Het hotel ligt in een leuke buurt, niet te druk en op loopafstand van het centrum. Dichtbij twee metrohaltes, die u overal naartoe vervoeren. 
Het personeel is er super aardig, ze willen alles voor je regelen.
De kamer is prima, goed bed, ruime douche en ziet er netjes uit. Ontbijt is prima, niet heel uitgebreid. Zeker een hotel dat aan te raden is voor mensen die naar New York willen gaan. 

p.s. Zeker een aanrader, restaurant Kokum, als u van indiaas eten houd. Zit aan de lexington Ave, om de hoek.

title: Tutto perfetto
text: Servizio eccellente: pulito, ottima colazione, personale gentile e disponibile, Wi-Fi gratuita, servizio di deposito bagagli!!! Davvero complimenti, super consigliato!!! Posizione ottima per visitare la città, due fermate a cinque minuti!

title: Good first impression of NYC
text: This was our first time in New York. From the get go I was pestering the staff with requests for late check out and double checking it was on our reservation (we had a late flight back to london and didn't want to be hanging around; I am a worrier!) the staff were very accommodating and reassuring. I was able to have a late check out of 3pm for the price of half a days stay; not a bad deal. Our flight was delayed coming in by 9 hours and we arrived well after midnight. The gentleman on the front desk was very friendly. When you check in they give you a sheet that gives wifi password, number to call the front desk, breakfast times etc and also a list of recommended nearby restaurants. It came in very handy. The room itself was definitely 'cosy', but we didn't spend much time in the room. However the bathroom was really big which was surprising. The only qualm I have with the bathroom was that the toilet seemed to be one of those saniflo/macerater toilets, as once flushed, the toilet paper reappears in a thousand pieces floating around. Our room did not have a view... Well it did have a view of the wall of the next building. This didn't bother us, in fact I was happy not to have a street view as this would have been noisy. The walls are pretty thin, I got woken up a number of times by people coming back in the evening and talking quite loudly in the hallway. The room had toiletries, iron, ironing board, safe, cable tv, alarm clock and each day you get 2 complementary mineral waters. We would leave our room quite late in the morning (around 10/11am) and when we came back, our room had still been made up. Although we didn't take advantage, a grab and go style breakfast is offered every morning and they have a wine and cheese night on a Tuesday. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit New York. It is only a short walk from a subway station, and the area is very nice. Also there is a Subway (sandwich shop) right next door, and a convenience store on the other side!

title: Un Hôtel de rêve, avec sont  personnels aux petits soins
text:
De retour de NY, ou nous avons eu 10 jours de rêve, cette hôtel à grandement participer à ce bonheur,

Points Positifs:

Personnels attentionnés, et serviable, malgré leur absence total de la langue de Molière (french).

Petit déjeuner, avec thé café,  lait, croissants énormes, pains au chocolat & muffins, fruits frais

Tout est neuf, literie Queen Size avec 4 oreillers à mémoires de formes, et sa couette d'été,

Salle de bains avec sa baignoire taille basse, très pratique pour y rentrer, douche toujours chaude à toutes heures, produit de bains remplacé tout les jours.

Un ménage de qualité avec remplacement des serviettes tout les jours

une chambre sur cour pour l'absence de bruit.

Jus de citrons frais a dispo avec glaçons en libre service a l’accueil, très apprécier après une bonne journée de marche.

Port USB, pour recharger portables, caméra ou tablettes sans passer par une prise US

Connexion Wi-fi gratuite avec un bon débit

Points Négatifs:

Clim, qui fait un bruit de ronronnement pas trop sympa surtout la nuit.

Et comme on nous avait donnés une chambre sur cour, la vue avec le mur d'en face en brique.

Absence de jus d'orange au petit déjeuner.

Coffre fort digital, posé au sol pas pratique.

et un mini frigo serais appréciable.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Nous avons passé un merveilleux sejour, l'hôtel est récent, la chambre impeccable et le personnel attentionné. Situé au cœur de Manhattan, il profite d'un bon emplacement. C'était notre premier voyage à New York et espérons revenir bientôt. Merci pour tout !

title: Two days in the City
text: We loved this hotel. Nice surprise to find this gem and would love to stay again. We travel a lot and we found the staff to be the most friendliest and helpful ever encountered!!! They made our first visit to the city a great one. Our room was a pretty spacious and quiet. Very clean and in a nice neighborhood. We could walk to subway stations and nearby restaurants easily. Comfortable bed, well appointed room, daily light breakfast, and our room had a nice balcony. We are planning our next vacation to come back here already.

title: The staff makes the difference!
text:
This was our first time in NYC and we went there to celebrate my 40th Birthday. Whilst there were no special surprises for me when we arrived (and we didn’t necessarily expect any, even though my fiancée had mentioned it was my big 40) everyone was extremely pleasant and polite, assisting us with anything we requested and advising about what to do/what to see in NYC. They even managed to find 3 little candles on the evening of my birthday when I mentioned that I hadn’t blown any and that would have been bad luck… (thank you Angelica!!)  
The room was immaculately clean and maintained and was more than adequate for our stay. Even though it was fairly small (which we expected as we booked the ‘cosy’) it had everything we needed (i.e. no cupboard but coat and clothes hanger in the corner of the room). It was at the 7th floor so the noise wasn’t too bad, provided you kept all the windows closed – you are in NYC, what do you expect!?
The breakfast was served in reception – standing room only kind-of-style - and consisted of pastries, fruit, coffee, juice. Not the kind of breakfast that fills you up, particularly if a group of Russians is staying there at the same time as you (then you have no chance for anything to be left for you to have!) however, a lot of Hotels in NYC don’t even offer breakfast, so this is more than enough to get you going. The staff always allowed my other half to bring coffee and bits up to the room whilst I was getting ready and the lovely housekeeping guys, by day 2, was already ready with a box to carry it all up to the room (we didn’t even need to ask for one!). Just lovely little touches like this make the whole Customer experience so remarkable.
The staff at The LEX in fact, is what made the difference for us. They were all lovely and extremely helpful. Angelica, Wellington, Omar, Andrew - everyone was great to chat to, before and after our long days out, and they offered more advise on things like Subway closure on certain days, President visiting etc and anything else tourists should be aware of.
Location wise, the hotel is 5 minutes’ walk to the Empire State Building and very close to Union Square where you can take the Subway if you are not a ‘walker’. Go to Eataly if you can. This is an Italian market with a Bar and a few Restaurants within. It is on the other side of Madison Gardens and it’s just amazing and does great food! Beware – whenever you buy anything in NYC, tax gets added on it!! So the price you see is almost NEVER the price you end up paying. Do not have the exact change! 
We had an amazing, unforgettable time in NYC even though it flew by, our feet were absolutely killing us but we certainly made the most of it!
Other suggestions: 
Hop on and Off bus – do that at the beginning of your stay, so you recognise things later on (i.e. from the Empire State) and you know where you may want to go back to, to explore further.
Go to Staten Island for free!
If you can afford it – the Helicopter ride is well worth it! It was my birthday surprise and I absolutely loved it. The memory of a lifetime!! 
Brooklyn is a must – definitely has the WOW factor (more than Manhattan in my opinion)
Penelope’s is just up one street on Lexington Avenue and does lovely food and bottomless coffee. 
We also went to Uncle Mario for a pizza (as suggested by one of the tour guides) and the pizza was very good – one of the best I have eaten outside of Naples (my hometown, very well known as the Kingdom of pizza!). The lady (who I assume the owner/Manager) comes across as a bit rough but I guess it goes with the atmosphere of the restaurant…. 
Negative note: 
On our last day we went to the National History Museum and were disappointed to find that a few rooms were closing to the Public due to a Private event. This had been, apparently, advertised at the entrance but we didn’t see it – so we missed out on a lot of the things we really wanted to see.
Do ask if you have any questions!
Enjoy this wonderful city and book at The LEX for an amazing stay!

title: Für NY-Verhältnisse ein überdurchschnittlich gutes Hotel
text:
Eigentlich würde ich dem Hotel nur 3 Sterne vergeben, aber im Vergleich zu anderen Hotels ins NY ist es nicht nur preislich erschwinglich, sondern hat auch noch einige andere Vorzüge:

- die Lage ist gut, an der Lexington Avenue und man kann zu Fuß zum Empire State Building, Time Square oder Grand Central Station laufen. Zum Central Park sollte man allerdings die Metro nehmen
- es ist ein kleines, gemütliches Boutique Hotel mit sehr nettem und hilfsbereitem Personal
- die Zimmer sind klein, aber für NY-Verhältnisse dann wiederum ok. Man kann jedenfalls 2 Koffer im Zimmer unterbringen und trotzdem noch überall dran
- das Zimmer ist sauber, hat einen kleinen Balkon und es gibt einen Safe. Auf einen Kühlschrank muss mal allerdings verzichten und viel Platz im Bad gibt es auch nicht
- jeden Dienstag gibt es eine Managers Hour, in der Wein und Käse angeboten wird

Auf das Frühstück sollte man verzichten, auch wenn es inklusive ist. Das besteht in der Tat ausschließlich aus Donuts, kleinen Cakes, ein bisschen Obst und einer Kaffee-Maschine. 

Die Lobby ist nicht sehr gemütlich, aber wer braucht das schon.

Ingesamt kann ich das Hotel empfehlen, da es letztendlich alles anbietet, was man braucht.

title: Super hôtel
text: Nous y avons sejourne du 6 au 11 mai, le rapport qualité prix est excellent, les chambres sont propres, le personnel est a l'ecoute, qualifié,  professionnel, souriant et poli, bref des gens super sympas, nous retournons a New York dans deux ans et sans hésitation nous retournerons dans cet hôtel et nous n'hésiterons pas a le recommander chaudement,pour le petit dej,  il est vrai que ce n'est pas ce a quoi on est habitué en France,  mais franchement c'est un detail, apres tout on viens pour arpenter les rues de New York

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Bonsoir
Cet hôtel représente un excellent rapport qualité/prix. Nous y retournerions avec plaisir

Les + : la propreté des chambres, l'aspect neuf des installations, l'accueil, la gentillesse, l'honnêteté  et la réactivité du personnel. L'hôtel est à proximité d'une station de métro ligne 4/5/6, des restaurants et bars et du Flatiron.

Néanmoins notre chambre au 3eme coté rue était très bruyante par rapport à la circulation du matin (à partir de 7h00). Nous avons demandé à changer. Pas de problème. Nous pouvons choisir entre être installés plus haut ou être installés coté cour.  Nous nous sommes donc retrouvés au RDC coté cour. Plus aucune vue (mur), chambre sombre et encore un peu de bruit de climatisation mais nettement moins bruyant que sur la rue. C'est très largement acceptable pour le prix. 

Attention, pour les personnes très exigeantes, vous devez savoir que vous prendrez votre petit déjeuner assis sur des tabourets dans le hall d'entrée de l'Hotel et dans des assiettes et verre en carton.....en ce qui nous concerne, cette simplicité ne nous a posé aucun problème.

title: Estadia Feriado 21/04/2015
text:
Atendimento excelente, embora não tínhamos o conhecimento da língua inglesa o recepcionista nos foi muito prestativo, tentando nos orientar em espanhol.

Ótima localização, local de fácil acesso próximo ao metrô e à Fifth Avenue, a qual encontra-se a um quarteirão de distância.

Acomodações e limpeza impecáveis.

title: Perfect New York Hotel
text:
This was our first time staying in the Lex NYC and it was amazing.  I can't recommend it highly enough.  I've been to NYC many times and stayed in a number of hotels.  Without a doubt, this was the best.  The location is great with plenty of nice coffee shops and restaurants near by (recommend Blue Smoke for great barbecue).  It's close to Union Square and several subway lines but still walking distance of mid town.
The hotel itself is modern and fresh.  

Staff: The staff were all lovely and extremely helpful.  It rained a lot when we were there and it was such a relief that the hotel offered us umbrellas to shield us from the rain.  I would particularly like to thank the members of housekeeping staff who were so friendly and polite, and really great at their job.

Room: Quite large by NYC standards.  Good AC.  Fairly modern and clean decor.  Exactly what you would want in NYC.  The bathroom was very large and felt luxurious.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  If I could find out what brand it was, I would buy one myself, it was better than my own.

Conclusion: Stay here! Excellent hotel.

title: A gem with exceptional staff.
text: A wonderful little hotel with staff that go the extra mile for you.  They were always courteous, assisted with anything required and made your stay very welcoming.  Whilst staying we had our 25th wedding anniversary, went out for the evening and when we came back we found a bottle of wine with 2 glasses in the room and  a note from the staff which was wonderful.  I honestly cannot complement them enough - you would not find better in my opinion in any hotel.  The breakfast was served in reception, consisted of pastries, fruit, coffee, juice etc.  Not my cup of tea to be honest but my wife loved it.  The room, although small, was immaculately clean and maintained and was more than adequate for our stay.  Location wise, the hiotel is the perfect spot for visiting all the attractions.

title: Wonderful New York!!!
text:
So we managed to add 2 days in NYC following our Carbbean Cruise and chose The Lex because it was small and personal. Wellington on reception is a absolute credit to the hotel! So helpful!!  He recommended good places to eat and even helped us check in for our flight online and printed off our boarding passes. Wellington we love you!The room was brand new and immaculate. There was a huge Samsung TV, fantastic air conditioning, alarm/ipod charging dock/phone dock, and nice toiletries in the bathroom.They brought a fridge to the room for us and there was complimentary pastries and coffee in the lobby each morning.
The location is on Lexington Avenue, around 25 minutes walk from the Empire State Building with lots of good restaurants nearby.
This was our first time in this beautiful city and it won't be the last.
We will definitely stay at the Lex again and they also gave us a 20 per cent discount voucher for a return visit.
Thank you to all the staff at The Lex for making our stay in New York so special.
Love Alan and Michelle from Manchester

title: AMAZING!!
text: So impressed with this little boutique hotel in  NYC, the staff were incredible and went above and beyond to help us with any needs. Subway is close which is convinient. Will deffinetly be staying here on my next trip to NYC and will highly reccomend to any family or friends that will be visiting!! Thanks!! :)

title: Well-located and wonderful hotel
text: Just returned from a beautiful May weekend in NYC, made even better by the Lex Boutique. The hotel is well-located-- in walking distance to the subway and all the places I wanted to visit, including Union Square, the NoMad area, and ABC Carpet & Home and within subway distance to Soho and the Upper West Side. It was a more dynamic trip for me this time around because I usually stay "downtown" and don't explore as many of the other neighborhoods. From my favorite South Indian Saravanaas restaurant one block away to the welcoming and helpful staff, the Lex cannot be beat! :) While I missed beautiful bed linens and the lighting in the room was a bit harsh, those are all personal preferences. I will return soon!

title: Perfect location Great Hotel
text: We had a very comfortable stay here. Room was a good size, very clean and well lit. Huge bathroom. Nice size tv. Even had a balcony. Everyone on the staff is very helpful and super friendly. We even lucked out and was able to park in front of the hotel without having to pay a meter or do the overnight pay parking which runs about 27-45 dollars a night. Will absolutely stay here again. A lot of eateries in the area. Close to subway station which makes it easy to just on the subway to ride up to Time-square and Central Park. We tried to walk it the first day, now we now better.

title: Ótimo custo benefício
text: Hotel novo com boas acomodações cama muito confortável, a acústica do quarto tbem é boa o atendimento na recepção é excelente com pessoas sempre prestativas, o café da manhã não tem muitas variedades porém tudo fresco e de boa qualidade ele é servido na recepção do hotel, a localização não é muito boa pois não fica perto de nenhuma estação a mais próxima fica uns 10 min a pé,

title: Very recommended!
text: Our first time in NYC was great also thanks to The Lex Hotel stay. The location was perfect and the staff was very kind and available to help us for anything. I hope to come back soon in NY and in The Lex Hotel of course. Very recommended!

title: Excelente custo benefício próximo quinta avenida, metro, restaurantes, praças, e etc..
text: Ótima recepção, aconchegante, atendentes bi-lingues e atenciosos, chegamos antes do horário e liberaram a suite antecipadamente, café da manhã servido no hall de entrada, com pães, bolos, frutas. Roupas de cama e banheiro trocadas diariamente.

title: Excellent service, impeccably clean room
text:
Every member of the staff--front desk, cleaning service, and all--was exceptionally willing to help make my visit pleasant.  Really one of the best service experiences I have had.  
The room and all facilities were immaculately clean and brand new.  
This is the best hotel stay I have had in years.

title: The Excellent Lex
text:
The Lex is a fab hotel. It's location is ideal for those wanting to avoid the noise and throngs of tourists around Times Square. The lex is close to the subway so you can easily get to all of the major sights - or it's about a 20 minute walk to Grand Central Station and 42nd Street.
The room was comfortable with excellent facilities. Breakfast was a simple complimentary continental, served informally in the lobby area - ideal for those wanting to get on with the sightseeing of the day.
The staff were very helpful, answering all of our tourist-type questions, and only too willing to help with any arrangements.
I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a no frills, excellent value and friendly place to stay.

title: what a find!
text: Fantastic hotel.  Excellent value.  Good weekend parking deal at nearby garage, and Bagel Express around the corner to bring home.  Super clean, New property, good location, friendly and helpful staff.  Loved our stay.

title: Modern Hotel in NYC Midtown (Flatiron District)
text: We stayed at the Lex Hotel for 3 nights during a stay in NYC. The hotel is new and modern and has all the amenities you'd expect from a hotel in a big city. It is clean, with a comfy bed, and compared to other hotels in NYC is quite roomy. The bathroom is bright and modern. The bedroom was sealed well from the noise outside, although there isn't much you can do about the general noise levels in the 'city that never sleeps'.  The Lex, rather cheekily, offers ear plugs to guests who might find the noise in NYC unacceptable. The location is the key aspect of this hotel, you're in Midtown on the Curry Mile, and within walking distance of the flat iron building. There are some good recommendations on food and cafes given by the hotel. Breakfast is light fare, with coffees and pastries, served in a nook by reception. The front office staff are a great help, and provide a wealth of information about the city. Overall good value for money, compared to other hotels in the same bracket. Would definitely stay here again next time I'm in New York.

title: A Gem in NYC
text: We stayed at The Lex for a weekend.  New, clean, very friendly staff, helpful all around.  Everything worked just fine.  A bit dark for reading in bed, but this is a minor concern.  Get to breakfast early if you want a croissant.  Next door is a good deli, and there are, of course, many nice restaurants nearby.  Safe quiet neighborhood.  Short walk to the 23rd St. subway stops (there are separate entrances/stops for the various subway lines:  1, N or R, 6, located a block apart).  This now our first choice for NYC.

title: Hotel novo
text: Hotel novo os quartos são pequenos mas limpos e aconchegantes, a acústica do quarto é muito boa apesar de estar em uma rua movimentada, o atendimento da recepção é excelente com pessoas prestativas,  café da manha é simples tudo de boa qualidade, recomendo !

title: Great hotel, great staff, great location
text:
This hotel is very modern with great decoration - the bathroom was tiled black and white with spotless black marble tiles and wonderful shower. The staff are first rate - ask them where are the best bars/restaurants, how to get anywhere and they will know.
The location is great, midway between Central Park and the Financial District on the number 6 subway which goes directly north/south. Lots of great bars, restaurants, shops and parks within walking. The area is busy yet safe and mid-market.
Room was not huge but easily ok for two; hanging space the only problem with one small wardrobe. Great conntinental breakfast in foyer and free wine/cheese on Tuesdays.

title: Brilliant staff, excellent location!
text:
I stayed at the Lex in December 2014 with my Mum. It was for a Christmas getaway/shopping/eating spree. 

The hotel was easy to find, the staff were very attentive on arrival, there was a minor issue with the card we were paying with not working, but the staff sorted it out promptly. 

The location is great, not too noisy, close to loads of great bars and restaurants. It's well within walking distance to the Empire state, Times Square and other tourist spots, close to shopping too. 

The room itself was small which you expect with most Manhattan hotels, but it had everything that we needed in it. 

I would highly recommend this hotel, the staff are all so lovely. I will certainly be staying here when I am next in town.

title: Great hotel
text: Friendly, efficient staff. Room size was  good and very clean. Convenient location for uptown and down, but room was quiet. Wifi and continental breakfast included. Would stay there again very happily.

title: Goed boutique  hotel
text: Klein hotel. Goed gelegen, vlot bereikbaar. Zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam personeel. Ontbijt is bescheiden maar goed. Bij last van straatlawaai kan je steeds kamer aan achterzijde vragen als deze beschikbaar  zijn. Een aanrader.

title: centraal gelegen, modern hotel, heel vriendelijke en persoonlijke behandeling
text: Heb met mijn kersverse echtgenoot hier 5 nachten geslapen tijdens ons bezoek aan New York en ik kan het alleen maar aanraden. Ligging erg goed. Centraal, vele attracties en eetgelegenheden op wandelafstand, ook metro. Maar toch ook in een rustige buurt waar je een minimum aan nachtlawaai hebt en je een veilig gevoel hebt 's avonds. Heel erg vriendelijke staff, behulpzaam, oprecht. Kamer heel erg proper, niets op aan te merken, ook een goed uitgeruste badkamer. Kamer aan de kleine kant, maar stoort niet in zo'n wereldstad. Hygiëne lijkt me belangrijker en was piccobello. Complimentary ontbijt 's ochtends was een leuke bonus. Basic ontbijt: enkele koffiekoeken, muffins, vers fruit, koffie, thee en water. Maar je kan je dag goed starten. Wi-Fi gratis en goede kwaliteit, viel nooit uit, gratis water op de kamer, zeer goede ervaring, zeker aan te raden hotel.

title: Weekend Trip
text:
Great staff, comfortable bed, room very clean and fresh. Quiet room. Bathroom clean and a good size considering this is a New York Hotel. Yes, the room is small, but we found it adequate.  I think if you bring a lot of luggage you might wonder where to put it.  So don't bring much. Everyone in NYC only wears black !  We had a big Window that looked out onto Lexington Ave.  Coffee and a sweet roll for breakfast, along with fresh fruit ( apples, oranges and banana's) .  
When you arrive tell your taxi driver 25th and Lexington, we made the mistake of saying 67 Lexington ave. and before we knew it we were on our way uptown to 67th St and Lexington! Luckily my husband realized this and quickly pointed it out to our taxi driver! Most taxi rides seemed to be $10, going to a Broadway, up to Central Park, Penn Station...also, taxis take credit cards and you can also tip with your credit card.  The first screen says 20 30 40 percent tip! If you want to tip 15% go to the second screen. 
The Lex is really in a great location. You can walk to some great restaurants, the staff has put together a fantastic list! We found a Catholic Church within walking distance, along with a great bagel breakfast within 1 block!

title: Location good enough, good value for money
text:
Hotel is at the crossing with 26 Street. Good enough to explore NYC. Room was quite small, so I would recommend to take a King room. (We had a Queen.) Nice simple complimentary breakfast from 7-9. Really nice staff. I would recommend it to friends. 

Tips: Next door is a supermarket with really good prices compared to others. There is a really good Japanese restaurant nearby: Mishima. Don't get fooled by the exterior.

title: Weekend in NY
text: Das Lex Hotel liegt sehr zentral. Viele Sehenswürdigkeiten können zu Fuss erreicht werden. Die Standardzimmer sind etwas klein. Man sollte nach einem Zimmer zur Rückseite fragen, da an der Strassenseite viel Verkehr ist. Das Badezimmer ist geräumig und alles Notwendige ist vorhanden. Besonders hervorzuheben ist die Freundlichkeit des Personals. Das ist wirklich super. Auch die Hilfsbereitschaft ist vorbildlich. Das Frühstück wird beim Eingang serviert. Es gibt Kaffee, Croissants und etwas Süssen. Wir vermissten Säfte und etwas Obst. Die Bananen waren ok. Das Preisleistungsverhältnis ist gut! Wir würden wieder kommen.

title: Gute Lage, tolles Personal
text:
Das The Lex Hotel hat eine sehr gute Lage, innert wenigen Minuten  erreicht man zwei U-Bahnstationen, aber auch zu Fuss kommt man relativ schnell und einfach überall hin. 
Wir hatten ein Standard Zimmer dieses ist eher ein bisschen klein geschnitten. Wir würden in Zukunft eher ein Deluxe Zimmer wählen da diese etwas grösser und ruhiger gelegen sind. Ansonsten war das Zimmer gemütlich, hatte einen Fernseher, gratis Wifi und zu meinem Geburtstag gab es sogar eine Flasche Wein. TOP! Das Badezimmer war ausreichend gross und modern eingerichtet. Besonders hervorzuheben war das überaus tolle Personal. Ob am Morgen, Mittag, oder Abend  alle Mitarbeiter war sehr freundlich und extrem hilfsbereit. Das kleine Frühstück (im preis einbegriffen) war immer frisch und wurde bis 9.00 Uhr immer aufgefüllt. Ein Gläschen Saft wäre noch toll gewesen. Aber auch hier gibt es keiner Kritik. Wir würden dieses Hotel jeder Zeit wieder buchen. Danke schön!

title: Lush Lex
text:
My daughter and I had a lovely stay at this boutique hotel. It was in a great location close to some lovely authentic restaurants and bars and equally close to subways. Our room was exceptionally clean and quiet - my only criticism was that there was a lack of a mirror close to a power point for drying hair and makeup. The complimentary breakfast was a lovely bonus as too the wine and cheese on a Tuesday evening. Staff were exceptional - printing out boarding passes and arranging transfers and always gave a welcome on our returns from very busy days out. 
For two ladies travelling alone we felt safe in the area and will definitely be making a return. Highly recommend The Little Red Beet Table restaurant nearby.

title: Great location with staff who go beyond the call of duty!  Highly recommend.
text: The Lex is a small boutique hotel in the lovely Gramercy Park area of Manhattan (almost half way between midtown and lower Manhattan).  The location is great and it's very easy to get around the city.  The hotel itself is modern and spotlessly clean.  The free breakfast is a bonus - lovely fresh pastries and fruit each day available in the lobby.  The staff are very friendly and highly professional - they provide a great level of service.  I have visited Manhattan many times and this hotel was one of the best.   Check out nearby Pete's Tavern for a touch of nostalgia!

title: Perfect Hotel For Exploring New York!!
text:
We were looking for a really nice, smart hotel in a great location for our 4-night stay in New York. 

This is exactly what we got at The Lex - a nearly new boutique hotel in a fantastic central location in Manhattan: Near 2 subway stations on the 6. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Battery Park, Greenwich Village, Wall Street, Empire State, Rockefeller and much more!!

The rooms are compact yet spotlessly clean and all feature a large TV, en-suite bathroom and really comfy beds. Free Wi-Fi and an in-room safe. What more could you ask for - apart from the hours spent sleeping you are unlikely to spend to much time in your room when visiting New York!!

The complimentary continental breakfast is a nice touch.

What really sets The Lex apart are the staff. Andrew and Armando are particularly worthy of high praise. It should be said that every member of staff that we encountered were utterly charming and eager to help in any way.

title: We will return
text: This hotel was as neat as a pin. The staff was very friendly and truly went out of their way to make our 5 day stay as comfortable as possible. The room and bathroom was comfortable. With windows closed, it was early spring, there was very little noise from the street. The hotel is near a subway (5 min walking) and is very well located. We will return to this hotel.

title: Friendly staff
text: The staff were friendly and helpful. Arrived in the city before noon and checked our bags in as our room was not ready. Upon return our bags had already been placed in our room. Quiet room always a pluc in NYC. Couple of blocks to subway. Bagels and Schmearthe was our morning breakfast stop and recommend the veggie cream cheese highly.

title: Boutique perfection
text: New rooms, clean & super friendly staff and priced right equals a great hotel stay. This boutique has it. Great location near 3rd ave is convenient to dozens of great restaurants and Gramercy park. Middle block location Low traffic street at night lead to a quiet now guts sleep.  Give it a try n

title: Скромный Лексингтон
text: Скромный отельчик на Лексингтон авеню. Достаточно уютно, но очень маленькие номера. Хорошие завтраки. Неплохое расположение отеля. Нареканий практически никаких нет. Цена для гостиницы высоковата, но сделаем скидку на Манхеттен. Если попадется этот же отель по приемлемой цене - обязательно остановлюсь снова.

title: Excelente!!
text:
Excelente hotel boutique, uno de los mejores en que he estado. Se destaca por la atención, limpieza, ubicación. Todo!
Se preocupan de todos los detalles, por ejemplo de dejar botellitas de agua mineral. 
Con wifi gratis y desayuno (informal, pero tienen!)
Esta muy bien ubicado, cerca del metro y es seguro para caminar por el sector a toda hora!
100% recomendable.

title: A perfect place to stay!
text:
After returning back from a week's stay at the Lex, I am unable to offer any criticism of this lovely hotel! The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, offering their knowledge of New York at every opportunity and we used their advice to get the most out of our holiday. They even looked after our luggage on the last day and ordered a Taxi to take us to the airport, whilst giving us details of the costs of the journey and how much we should tip the driver.

This boutique hotel is modern and clean throughout. The complimentary continental breakfast is a perfect start to a busy day in New York. It's set within a stone-throw of the major avenues, so it's ideal if you want easy access into the heart of the city. Should you wish to travel further afield, then the staff will advise you how to get there (they even give you a map of the City) and will arrange a taxi if you need one.

The Lex gave us a list of the local restaurants which they recommended. Whenever we asked, they told us of additional places to eat which were tailored to our needs. We found each restaurant to be uniquely perfect and was never dissatisfied with our choices.

Although it's in New York, expect a good nights sleep as the rooms manage to cut out all external noises and the beds are extremely comfortable.

The Lex turns 1 years old at the end of the month. I would highly recommend you stay there as I imagine it's reputation will only improve and it's extremely good value for money.

We had a fantastic time in New York and this was enhanced by everyone at the Lex Boutique Hotel. It's a real gem of a place to stay and we can not thank the staff enough!

title: Favoloso!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con mio marito nell'ottobre 2014, era la nostra luna di miele ed è stato tutto perfetto! L'hotel è pulito, bel organizzato ed il personale è eccellente. Ragazzi sempre sorridenti e disponibili oltre che gentilissimi. Alcune camere potrebbero sembrare un po' piccole ma sono tutte comunque dotate di ogni comfort ( vedi asse e ferro da stiro che, per chi ha capi spiegazzati in valigia, sono una mano santa!). Il wi-fi è gratuito e perfettamente funzionante in tutto l'hotel e, compresa nel prezzo del pernottamento, al mattino vi verrà servita una deliziosa colazione nella hall. Una menzione speciale per i letti comodissimi, da applauso dopo giornate passate a camminare! Ottima anche la posizione a pochi passi dalla metro, dal Flatiron District, da Union Square e dall'immenso Empire State Building! Se vi trovate a New York dovete per forza soggiornare qui!

title: Awesome Hotel!!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here from  3/12/15 through 3/16/2015 while we were in NYC to see one of our favorite bands.  I cannot say enough great things about this hotel.  The staff are amazing, friendly and very helpful.  The rooms are very clean and we're perfect for what we needed as we spend most of our stay out and about in the city.  I highly recommend the Lex.  We will definitely be staying here 9 our next trip.

title: It was more than I expected
text: Everything in stay was great, but the friendliness of the staff, cleaning the room, great breakfast to go, and its awesome location deserve to be highlighted. If you are looking for a excellent service for an affordable price the Lex Hotel can be a good place for you stay there.

title: Great Friendly Staff
text: Stayed here for a weekend.Check in was quick and efficient.Staff very friendly and helpful.Thank you Wellington.Room clean and well laid out.Location handy for subway.Plenty of local bars and restaurants.Good buzz in most of them.Would stay there again.

title: Great location great hotel for the money
text:
I stayed here for five days and it was a perfect spot to explore NYC from. About fifteen minutes from times square. 
The hotel and room were clean and modern and hotel staff were friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable.  Every time we returned a warm smile and welcome from Angelica, (who seems to work 24/7) was always forthcoming. 

Thanks for a great stay

title: Exceptional service
text:
Recently stayed at The Lex for 6 nights and was very impressed by the very dedicated and friendly staff. This is my fourth trip to NYC, and my first time at The Lex.

Hotel: This is a small boutique hotel, so as long as you are not expecting luxurious comfort, you've chosen the right spot. Complimentary breakfast includes some baked goods and coffee and is served in the hotel lobby - stools and bar tables. I loved this casual feel - again, don't expect a sit down with white napkin service. The room was larger than I was expecting - it was clean, well lit and maintained throughout the stay. Complimentary water bottles were a nice touch, as these usually are charged a pretty penny in other hotels. There was even a wine & cheese one night in the lobby.

Staff: I definitely got the impression that the staff would help in any ways possible. I was cold the first few nights due to a strange heater, asked for two blankets, and was good. I never advised the staff of the heater (which was not heating enough and was fairly loud), since it didn't bother me enough after the second night - but I am reticent to have this affect this review, since I feel the staff would have made some kind of accommodation.

Location: On the corner of Kip's Bay and NoMad, the Lex is well situated for those looking to walk NYC. It is not "central" to any major tourist area, but is an easy 20 minute walk to many great neighbourhoods: Times Square and the Theatre District, Chelsea, SoHo, Chinatown, etc. Those who are less inclined to walk NYC (in which case, you are probably visiting the wrong city), can nonetheless take a 5-minute stroll to a fairly central subway line at Union Park.

Summary: If you are alone, or a couple, or with friends, and you are the kind of traveler who likes to experience and walk the places you visit, The Lex is perfect. Again, I would not recommend the hotel if you are the kind of person who relies on luxury - in this case, expect to pay 3-4 times the price.

Would definitely return to The Lex.

title: Clean, Friendly, Affordable & Convenient Hotel in Kipps Bay/Grammercy
text: I had a last minute trip to NY and found this hotel through hotels.com and what a find! I will definitely come back! The hotel is immaculately clean, conveniently near Grammercy and pretty close to Union Sq. The staff are beyond friendly and helpful! The rooms are modest and average size for a New York hotel room, but extremely comfortable and clean. Every amenity you want is available. They also bring you coffee, water, tea, or ice upon request. Very good breakfast is also complimentary.

title: Great Experience
text: My friend and I arrived before noon and there was a room available for check in. Awesome!!! The staff was very friendly and the Libby was small but very chic and clean. Our room was also perfect. Very clean and updated. The bathroom was beautiful and CLEAN. A very modern and efficient hotel. There isn't a ton to do in the neighborhood but you are a short walk or subway ride to anything. Will stay again!!

title: Clean, friendly, boutique with nice touches
text:
It's a challenge selecting a room in NYC on a budget.  Cleanliness ranks high on my list of "must haves."  This sparking clean, spacious room ( by NYC standards) was comfortable for two, including our luggage.  There is a small closet for hanging clothes , but not enough for thick winter down jackets plus lots of regular clothes.  You can hang about eight regular clothing items.  Plenty of room for most visitors.
 
The clean, spacious bathroom included a hair dryer.  The shower had plenty of water pressure and excellent temperature control, accommodating  my need for a hot shower and my hubby's need for a cool one.

Our room was a calm, quiet place with a very comfortable bed and nice little balcony.  Given the frigid temperature, it served as an excellent refrigerator for our complimentary natural spring water.  

I usually hate hotel continental breakfasts as they typically serve poor quality pastries and even worse coffee.  I was genuinely and  happily surprised by the excellent coffee and bakery fresh croissants.
Yum.

The staff is as warm, helpful and friendly as touted by everyone.  We asked for a favorite restaurant suggestion taking advantage of Restaurant Week ( 1200 Miles).  It was perfect before taking in a Broadway play ( It's Just A Play).

My husband's favorite nice touch was the nightlight feature in the bathroom solving the issue of which light to leave on.

We loved our stay and look forward to our returning again.

title: Great service with tiny room
text:
I reserved this hotel based on reviews, the service is good,  free coffee, tea. 
Friendly staff,  they are helpful and professional.
The negative point is the room is too small I paid 180 dollars for a tin with an annoying noisy Ac.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Murray Hill
text: I really enjoyed my two-night stay there in the brutal cold weather in February. Great location and clean room for sure. Super helpful and friendly reception staff that I never expected (Great restaurant recommendation by the way). I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a cozy place to stay while visiting NYC.

title: Couldn't have been better
text:
My fiance and I were in NYC Feb 21-23. We REALLY enjoyed staying at The Lex NYC. Perfect location for walking all over Manhattan, and easy to catch a cab out front if your legs get tired. There are restaurants EVERY where, so research some that look good to you in advance, but there are several backup plans available! We ate everything- from Taiwanese to French to Italian to street meat (hot dogs at Papaya Dogs mmm)! Every few steps there is a new restaurant. The Lex is located on a super safe street with lots of Indian restaurants close by.

Everyone was right about the staff- super friendly and helpful! I felt like a VIP every time I walked past their desk! They always had something nice to say and it was never fake or forced conversation. 

The room was great- smallish as expected but plenty of space to hang our big winter coats, put our backpacks and set out our winter boots to dry. It was spotless and smelled great! We were on the 7th floor with a beautiful view of the 69th Regiment Armory. We requested a higher floor due to another reviewer saying the street noise is loud on the lower floors. NYC is just loud (the city that never sleeps!), so I don't think we escaped much noise. If you are a light sleeper I suggest bringing a noise machine or ear plugs. However, it didn't bother us, and it was fun to hear all the commotion as a reminder of the bustling city outside of our window!

Breakfast was included in our rate- croissants and other pastries, fresh hand fruit, coffee, tea, hot cocoa... not a huge selection but it was a perfect way to start the day. 

My ONLY suggestion was that I wished that they had coffee/hot water available in the lobby all day. I did call down for hot water one night and they brought it up for me immediately (for a little night-time tea), but I felt badly to inconvenience them and potentially have them burn themselves with the hot water coming up the elevator when I would have been happy to get it myself if it were available. 

I would be SO lucky to be able to stay in this hotel next time we visit NYC! Thank you for your fantastic hospitality!

title: What a find this was, ticked every box 100%
text: Great location, spotlessly clean modern rooms, nice complimentary continental breakfast and the nicest, most helpful reception staff we have ever encountered. We stayed here 4 nights and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to visit NYC.

title: tres bon hotel
text:
si vous allez à New York je vous conseil vraiment le Lex  hotel
super acceuil, hotel recent entretenu, belle deco, et chambre bien, salle de bain grande pour NY, literie rien a redire petit dejeuné compris , franchement rapport qualité prix le top. Situé pres de tout. La prochaine fois je reviens dans cette hotel.
Un conseil demandez une chambre qui donne pas sur la rue.

title: Lovely Boutique hotel!
text: Helpful and super friendly staff. As visitors from the Midwest, we needed lots of suggestions and genuine kindness. The room was very clean room and the cozy beds. The Continent breakfast was well stocked and yummy. We would happily stay at this welcoming hotel again!

title: Great hotel just south of midtown
text: Great find. If you want to see New York and not lounge around a hotel this is for you. Modern clean rooms, great staff and a pretty good location. I assume it only has three hotel stars as it has no in house hotel or pool - who uses them anyway in NYC?

title: Perfekter Ausgangspunkt
text:
