There were a few cute little thrift stores a couple of blocks away, and a fab breakfast/brunch place a few blocks up on Lexington.  And, I might add, within walking distance to some great shopping!  

What stood out for me at The Lex was the staff.  Everyone at the hotel was absolutely friendly, and I felt that they went out of their way to be helpful.   I had to scan some documents, and they did that for me at the front desk.  

I highly recommend the hotel.  I enjoyed my stay, and would stay there again.

title: Inmejorable en NYC!!
text:
Estuvimos hospedados en este hotel durante nuestras vacaciones en NYC, y fue un autentico acierto.
Se trata de un hotel pequeño, pero con todos los detalles necesarios para hacer tu estancia perfecta, detalles como que de manera gratuita sirven un desayuno, no es de lo mas variado pero suficiente para empezar el día con energía o WiFi gratuito o plancha y tabla en la habitación (ideal para los que vamos desde bien lejos, para darle un retoque a la ropa) 
Las habitaciones algo pequeñas, pero estamos en NYC, y es lo típico y normal!Eso si,el servicio de habitaciones impecable.
El personal del hotel, excelente!! Super amables y siempre dispuestos ayudarte.
La hubicacion perfecta, tienes el edificio Chrysler a 5 calles, Flatiron a 3 y el empire a 6, así que muy céntrico de lo mas conocido, pero si te cansas y prefieres el trasporte publico la linea 6 esta a dos calles que te lleva a la zona baja y alta de manhatan 
Resumiendo relación calidad-precio lo recomiendo 100%

title: super staff, good location
text: Staff is phenomenal. Very clean rooms. Nice free breakfast. Good location near 3 subway stops. Good restaurants in the area. Rooms a little on the small side but bathrooms are quite large. The desks are small - hard to work in the room. There is a lot of sound transfer between the rooms. Very nice TV with great HD channel selection - unlike so many other hotels.

title: bom custo benefício
text: Hotel novo, tudo muito limpo e organizado. o Wi-fi é gratuito. Tanto o pessoal da recepção quanto o pessoal da limpeza e manutenção são super solícitos e gentis. Apesar de o isolamento acústico ser ruim, ficamos em três quartos por 9 noites e não tivemos problemas com barulhos. A localização é boa para quem pretende andar por NYC, utilizamos o metro para irmos para locais mais distantes. O café da manhã deixa um pouco a desejar pois tem poucas opções. recomendo o hotel pelo seu custo x benefício.

title: Great service and location
text: My boyfriend and I went to NY to see a show and booked the Lex...it was fantastic! We had a little issue with our room and called the front desk, our room was switched right away and we received an upgrade at no charge. Only a couple blocks from the 6 line (subway) which is a pretty major route! We will definitely stay next time we go to the city!

title: Excellent service, great value
text: great affordable hotel if you want Union Square location. Excellent customer service, friendly, helpful, whatever you need. Basic, very clean room, comfortable beds. Overall great stay, would stay there again and highly recommend.

title: Nice, new, great value, and great staff
text: For my first Tim in NYC, I couldn't have stayed at a nicer place.  It was perfectly located, very nice, and I've never experienced a more polite staff from every person working there.  The rooms are small, and virtually no lobby, but that is what to expect from a 'boutique' hotel.  I wouldn't bring my family of 4 here as rooms too small for that. But if I came with my wife or by myself,  this is certainly the place I'd stay.  And the price was great, booked as a package with my flight, it was just $125 - in Manhattan!  Right I the heart of curry hill, there are Indian restaurants everywhere, and it's close to Neue House shared work zone, it's the perfect hotel for that place.

title: A great experience
text: My girlfriend and I spent 5 nights in New York. The Lex Hotel was a excellent chioce. The hotel have a great value for money. I would stay at this hotel again. All the staff are very friendly and helpful.

title: great stay
text:
Very good service , 
the staff was very friendly .they have  free breakfast , free wifi. Room was very clean ,  small but decent room .bathroom was beautiful . I like the floor was very cute. They know what to do . very impressed by the service . 
I had great time staying here.

title: Отличный отель в центре Манхеттена
text:
Отель новый и находится в центре Манхеттена. Персонал на ресепшен отличный и всегда приветлив. Завтраки в отеле не очень разнообразные, но вполне достаточно, чтобы не остаться голодными, фрукты, круасаны, выпечка, сладкое, чай, кофе. Мы брали стандартный номер, нам достался номер необычной формы, но особых неудобств это не вызвало. В номере все есть, сейф, гладильная доска и утюг, большой телевизор (русских каналов нет) фен и т.д. 
Не понравилось то, что при уборке персонал ходит и постоянно стучит дверьми, хоть и делают они это в обеденное время, но все равно, если кто-то хочет отдохнуть после длинного перелета или просто поспать днем, то эти хлопки очень сильно раздражают, можно же просто открыть дверь и не закрывать ее, а не стукать ей каждый раз. Первый день у нас вообще не убирались, на второй день нам пришлось идти на ресепшен и просить чтобы номер привели в порядок и вынесли мусор. Да и если честно, уборка так себе, при заезде были волосы в раковине, а потом у нас забыли в номере какое-то средство.
В целом отель отличный и если будут устранены недочеты с уборкой, то будет идеальным местом в Нью Йорке. Рекомендую этот отель и если будем еще раз в Нью Йорке, обязательно остановимся в этом отеле!

title: Normal, average rooms, excelent service
text:
From the moment we got to the hotel, the staff was always extremly nice, helpfull and always available. 
The room was good, clean, and the bed was comfy enough.
The breakfast could be better but it's enough to get you going: coffee, tea, something to eat. Simple but practical. The area is ok, easy to get around and safe.

title: Great new find!
text: Had to make a last minute trip to NYC and stay near the Armory. The Lex is a relatively new hotel, with a bright, clean interior and great furnishings. The staff were extremely helpful, and really helped with giving me a "boutique" feel. Absolutely going to stay there in the future.

title: Lex Hotel NYC
text: This hotel is new and it shows--in a good way. Everything is clean and modern, the staff is polite, and the location is wonderful. I was worried that the room would be too small, but it was perfectly sized for me (though it might be a little small for more people/a family). Very little issues with noise, though the walls did seem pretty thin Only con is the view (or lack thereof); also, it would have been nice to have a trash can in the bathroom.

title: Lex NYC
text:
Family of 4, two rooms next to each other for 7 nights.  Really liked the hotel.  No frills. Very clean, great staff.  All the good reviews are true!
They upgraded one of our rooms from cozy to balcony as I had requested at no charge.  Very accommodating staff.  Would most definitely recommend it.

title: New Hotel
text:
This hotel is new and the staff are looking to impress. The price and service were a nice surprise, hopefully the staff and management can keep continue to operate with such positive attitudes and service. Kudos to the staff. 

A few notes:
-Parking within a few blocks
- Chrysler building 1mi away
- if you love Indian food, this is a    GREAT location
- free parking Sundays
- head N on Lexington to catch the Metro

title: Top Hotel in NYC
text:
Wir waren fünf Nächte in diesem Hotel. Es hat uns da sehr gut gefallen. Das Hotel bietet gratis Internet (WLAN). In unserem Arangement war das Frühstück in begriffen, jeweils morgens von 07.00 bis 09.00 Uhr gabe es ein kleines Buffet in der Hotel Lobby mit Croissant und Süssgebäck, Kaffee, Tee, Milch etc. klein, aber super. 
Das Hotelpersonal ist sehr Hilfsbereit und gibt gute Tips für Lunch und Dinner oder was man sonst so will.
Der Lärm der Strasse habe ich kaum gehört, wie dies andere Personen beschrieben haben. Wir hatte ein Zimmer im 1. Stock, Richtung Lexington Avenue. Die Wände sind sehr dünn, wir hatten aber trotzdem sehr gut geschlafen!
Die Zimmer sind klein aber top ausgestattet. Das Badezimmer wirkt relativ neu und war sehr sauber. Am Dienstag gibt es in der Hotellobby einen kleinen Apero mit Wein und Snacks.
Alles in allem ein hervorragendes Hotel. Wir werden nächstes mal sicher wieder ins Lex gehen!

title: Great Staff and very accommodating
text: Great Location!!!! I felt like I was in an apartment living in the city. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Area was nice and walking distance to some good restaurants. Rooms with balcony are more spacious than the rooms without but overall very comfortable. Oh!! and the bed was the highlight. Very comfortable!!! slept like a rock

title: Wonderful small hotel!
text: The Lex is a wonderful, boutique hotel near the lower east side. The hotel staff is super friendly and the rooms are extremely clean and quiet!! The location of the hotel is within an easy walk to the subway and many restaurants and shops.

title: Good value hotel, excellent staff
text: My girlfriend and I have just come back from a five-night stay at The Lex NYC Hotel. This is a truly excellent hotel if you're looking for somewhere of great value. It's a five minute walk from the nearest subway station (23rd & Park) so the location is pretty good, and it was an extremely quiet place to stay despite being next to a college building. As a new hotel, it is very clean and the decor is nice and modern. However, the best thing about the hotel is the staff. We had a number of questions that needed answering regarding local travel, places to eat, the Citi Bike's and many others, and no matter who was on the desk, they helped us with an answer. They were truly nice people who genuinely cared about our stay in the city, which was a nice thing. Also served was a small, free, continental breakfast in the lobby, which was a lovely bonus. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and will certainly look to go back if I ever travel to New York again.

title: Una elección más que acertada
text: Estuvimos cinco noches en este hotel, y se nos quedó corto. La elección fue de lo mejor que pudimos hacer. Las inatalaciones inmejorables, limpieza, mantenimiento, etc. todo impecable. Los detalles para hacer más acogedora la estancia, como secador de pelo, adaptador de enchufe y demás, eran un detalle. Respecto al personal, sólo puedo decir que todos fueron encantadores. Se mostraban dispuestos a ayudarte en lo que necesitaras y con amabilidad y una sonrisa. Los dueños también muy agradables y con ellos pudiemos disfrutar de una copa de vino californiano a la que nos invitaron. La situción del hotel es inmejorable. Por decir algo a mejorar: el desayuno, que quizá en España estamos acostumbrados a algo de pan tostado y mejor fruta que no había; y el ruido que entraba con las ventanas cerradas. Pero volveríamos allí sin pensarlo.

title: Ideal
text: My husband and I needed a comfortable, quiet, clean,and hospitable place to stay while visiting a son living four blocks away.  The staff of this boutique hotel was intent on pleasing guests while offering a quiet respite from the city noise.  The hotel was pristine in cleanliness and comfort.  We recommend this establishment without hesitation and plan to return upon on our next visit.

title: perfetto per visitare la grande mela
text:
abbiamo passato tre notti al The Lex NYC ed e' stato tutto positivo. camere non grandi ma molto pulite, nuove e moderne, dotate di ogni comfort.
posizione ottima, molto centrale. colazione inclusa nel prezzo che consiste in ottime brioches e muffin, the / caffe proprio a lato della reception (colazione all italiana per intenderci...caffe a parte ;o )
personale veramente gentilissimo che da un valore aggiunto all hotel!! disponibile per ogni tipo di richiesta o consiglio sulla citta!
consigliato al 100%!

title: Good buy for the money and great service
text: If you have a brief stay in NYC and are looking for a great value in a good location, this property is a good choice.  No frills but a very comfortable bed and surprinsingly quiet.  The continental bfast was a nice touch and the service was exceptional.

title: Fine value hotel
text: Fine value hotel. Excellent staff and service. Rooms very small but they clearly upgraded them with quality systems, didn't just cover them with fancy fabrics or marble. New bathrooms and air systems, electrical connections. Dinky lobby. Continental breakfast is minimal but plenty of places in area with top breakfast. (Sarabeth a block away.) Fantastic Indian restaurants up the street and great location for taxis and walking everywhere.

title: Feel like a new yorker
text: Great place to stay in Manhattan.  Wonderful, helpful staff, very clean accommodations for the traveler who is not looking to visit the hotel but see the city and have a great place to come back to at night.

title: Mostly a hit, but big miss in noisy a/c.
text:
I spent just one night here for work, and the first impressions were great. I asked for a quiet room, and got one away from the elevator in the back of the building. It was on the second floor, with a "terrace" that was basically the bottom of a shaft. Nevertheless, it was quiet. 

The room itself was very, very tight, but I felt that the designers made the best use of the space. Ceiling height was great, which made it much less claustrophobic. I believe I had a standard queen room, and it is really suitable only for 1 person to stay in. I would go insane with another person. Everything was brand new, and I loved the floor to ceiling headboard for the bed. It really classed up the room, even though the rest of it was pretty blah.

The most outstanding feature of my room by far was the bathroom. It was pretty incredible, almost as big as the bedroom itself. The floor was a really nice wood-look tile, and there was plenty of counter space. The black and white tiling looked sexy and chic and classic all at the same time. The tub surround was entirely tiled in black, which I usually would not have liked, but again due to the ceiling height, as well as the fairly wide tub, it wasn't an issue. Shower pressure was fantastic.

Unfortunately, when it came time to sleep, I discovered the shortcomings. The A/C was extremely loud, and the auto setting only allowed it to go off for about 2 minutes for every 10 minutes of on. That it was unable to maintain 70 degrees in a room no larger than 200 square feet was pretty silly. And then on top of that, the bed was just not that comfortable. Perhaps I am too spoilt by pillowtops - although I did not look to confirm, it definitely did not feel like I was sleeping on a pillowtop mattress. 

I skipped breakfast, but did notice that it was a simple spread in the small lobby on my way out. I really wanted to like my stay here, and was hoping that I would discover a new goto boutique hotel, but I did not get a very comfortable night's sleep. Having said that, if the hotel is able to fix or replace the a/c units, I can probably be convinced to try it again.

title: The Lex NYC Could have been for me
text:
This hotel only provides accommodation on check in, so if you are tired from travel and did not have enough hours of sleep then you are not going to find a place to crash until the hotel check in hour.  There is small waiting area and I was shocked to find my mother sitting on the couch sleeping when I return at 4pm after no one called as I was promised to let me know about room availability over an hour before.   It did not look good.

Also, when I called I was told our view will be facing Boruk College building which sounded exciting instead we were facing the walls all around the window.  I cannot travel afar because of my disability and Manhattan has become my vacation destination.  Since we are locals we do not do much sight seeing and spend half of time in the room, enjoying the hotel, the view from the room and hotel's facilities.  In this case this was a complete disaster having to pay for the most expensive room in the hotel that looked like being berried in the whole.

On the other hand the entire stuff was outstanding, friendly, not too much in your way and most of all displayed excellent team work effort.  Being in their company felt like being with friends.  Even tourists were friendly.

The continental breakfast was excellent, not too much choices, but just enough to fuel up for the day ahead or to grab it on the go. Coffee, variety of croissants, fruits, milk. assorted teas.  Most of all, the freshest croissants and muffins we ever ate.  

I and my best friend enjoyed Madison Sq Park - my 2nd favorite after Central Park in NYC and I finally got to eat in the famous Shake shack explaining to my mother that the long line was part of the entertaining attraction :) 

The property lobby is not large, but cozy and very modern.  We loved everything about the room except the view from the room which made the room dark and depressing.

This is very beautiful property and in excellent location.  My advice is if you book the room with two queen size beds speak to the manger not to the stuff member to guarantee you don't get to spend your vacation in New York in the basement that is if you care about seeing the sky from your window.  On the other hand If you plan on using the room only to sleep in then it is ideal choice for it is quit, dark with no outside noise.

title: New hotel!!
text:
Made my reservation on Expedia...I don't know what happened, but is thought I was at the lexington hotel, which I've stayed before..but, what a nice surprise!!!

The Lex was a very nice boutique hotel, wonderful, helpful staff.  Nice continental breakfast & since we were there on Tuesday, had a evening wine & cheese spread.

Hotel is new & very clean & quiet!

title: オススメします
text: 決して広くはありませんが、清潔で快適でした。wifiも問題なく繋がります。グランドセントラル駅からM101,102,103のバスに乗って、バス停の目の前です。NYにしては価格が低めで、費用を抑えるにはピッタリのホテル。期待せずに行きましたが、大満足でした。

title: Great Boutique Hotel! Great Location! Great Staff!
text:
I stayed at the Lex Hotel with my Boyfriend and it was great. I am pretty particular about Hotels.
First off let me say I have travelled to many places including NYC before and I have never come across such great staff members. They were warm, friendly, welcoming and the great part each one was super knowledgeable of their surroundings and was great at helping you plan your days, NYC is Big and so much to see, so they were great at giving some guidance.
The rooms were very clean and Modern and had little extra touches.
Location was excellent and everything was easily accessible to everywhere by walking and or by Train
I highly reccommend this hotel for anyone looking for the above mentioned and on my next trip I will def being returning!

title: Friendly and super clean
text:
An excellent and friendly hotel with super clean rooms and comfortable beds.  

Staff:  everyone acts as if they're part-owner, as if they have a personal stake in making sure things are just right.  Seems it's a happy and well-managed place.

Room was immaculate.  Maybe a second trash can in the bathroom would help (but not a big deal).  Bathroom was so clean.

I had to rush out in the morning, and I was checked out and in a cab (with hotel staff help) before I knew it.

I want to mention that I had emailed with a special request to stay up and away from the street noise, as I had a bit of an issue with street noise in a prior stay.  They put me way upstairs in the back, and it was wonderful.  Plus they wrote a note by hand welcoming me back, which was in the room when I entered -- a simple and friendly gesture.  Super great hotel.

title: Amazing Personal Service
text:
Where else can you stay and be greeted by the GM of a hotel, who takes a genuine interest in your experience at his property? The Lex NYC. My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this delightful small property this past weekend. Upon arrival, we were treated like returning guests. The GM Matt and his well-trained team are there to serve and that they did.

We received an upgrade without asking and our bags were brought up to our room while we were parking our vehicle. The front desk manager, Omar, could not do enough to make our stay a pleasant one. Lots of great surprises including having dessert delivered to our table at the restaurant that Omar had booked at our request. We were stunned and delighted to say the least!

The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well sized for a NYC property. The friendly staff greeted us politely each time we walked by and we felt very much at home.

Matt and his team sent up a special package to our room, which included some lovely truffles. Seriously folks, I've spent a lot more at other NYC properties and have yet to experience this level of service. 

A hotel is nothing more than a bed with rooms. That is unless you stay at The Lex NYC. We will be back for sure!

title: Hidden Gem
text: This is a new hotel, only open for about three months.  The service and staff did an outstanding job and are very accommodating.  The real surprise in this NYC boutique hotel is the size of the bathrooms.  Very large for a boutique... as large or larger than a chain hotel.  As most rooms in NYC they are a bit small but the design takes advantage by the layout.  I was impressed and will stay there again.

title: Superb.
text:
Our 3 night stay at The Lex was excellent. Our standard queen room was very big considering rooms in New York are typically small. The room was well furnished with lovely dark wood furniture, a large flat-screen TV and the bathroom was especially contemporary and clean. The maids service was excellent and they cleaned so thoroughly we felt like we had a brand new room every day. We very much appreciated the soft new towels to come back to. 
The staff were friendly and helpful and one member of staff went out of his way to hail us a cab as we struggled to do so in the street outside. 
The location of the hotel was good - only 2 blocks from a subway station and close to Madison Square park. The hotel is not exactly in the hustle and bustle of Manhattan but it doesn't take long at all to get to the major places of interest. 
We enjoyed breakfast every morning with a selection of pastries, muffins and fruits. I recognise that breakfast is complimentary however I think that a jug of fresh fruit juice such as orange or apple juice would not have gone a miss. For someone that doesn't drink coffee, this would have been appreciated. 
Just a tip for potential future guests - it was actually cheaper to pay for the room directly through the hotel rather than using any online hotel room booking services. 

Thankyou The Lex for a great stay. We will most definitely stay with you again as the value for money tops most other New York hotels. I believe your hotel will soar to one of the very top hotels in New York on Trip advisor in not too long.

title: Bachelorette Sucess!
text: I booked 2 jr. suites for my sisters bachelorette party, and had a great visit! There was plenty of space in each room for people to get ready and hang out before dinner. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Only drawbacks were that they only had one guest fridge (that they thankfully lent us) and the rooms faced a brick wall.

title: Excellent hotel at great rates.
text:
We were amazed by the staff, extremely friendly and helpful.

Rooms were great, just what you need, and affordable. Also everything is new and looks well.

Great location in midtown, close to Madison Square Park.

title: Nos encantó!!
text: Estuvimos durante una semana mi hermana y yo en Nueva York y nos encantó el hotel. El personal muy amable, las instalaciones muy limpias y la habitación y el baño muy amplios. Desayuno correcto aunque poca variedad (fruta/bollería y café/tés). En cuanto a localización, estaba muy cerca del Flatiron.

title: Excellent quality/price
text:
For me this hotel was a real find. Good location - fairly near subway and lots of restaurants and convenience stores nearby. Around 1 mile from Penn Station. Stayed 3 nights. Staff went out of their way to be helpful always. Room smallish but really well appointed boutique-style.
Light breakfast served in lobby. Tuesday evenings free wine get-together.

title: At last a great hotel
text:
Just finished a quick trip to NYC and tried out The Lex.  What a delightful hotel. None of the typical New York attitude where front of door staff feel they should be on the silver screen rather than dealing with you. No attendants who are more bothered about tips than service and no room so small you have to take turns in the bathroom. 
From the moment we arrived we were met with smiles and genuine warmth. Front desk could not have been more pleasant and offered good advice with plenty of local knowledge. They seemed to care about us having a good time. 
Breakfast is good coffee (no "brown drinking fluid" here) and pastries in a self serve set up where staff are happy to help you up to your room should you accidentally overload. 
Some rooms have balconies which is great but don't expect a beautiful vista - you're not in Kansas now Dorothy. More to the point they are big enough that you don't have to move  bags and clothes each time you want to walk around the bed. Genuine space. 
As you may be able to tell. I loved it.

title: Excellent service, clean and comfortable bed
text: I stayed 9 nights in this hotel on a solo vacation. The staff were friendly, very professional and always helpful. Location was great and I was very impressed overall by the level of service and the cleanliness of the room. Travelling solo, it was always comforting to come back to a friendly face at the desk and staff whom after a few days, greeted you by name. Before I went, I read reviews that it could be noisy, and being a light sleeper, I asked for a quiet room. All 9 nights I was there on the highest floor, I was never disturbed be it by hotel guests or traffic outside. During the day, you can hear occupants in the next room on their tele-conferences quite clearly, but at night, it is very quiet. If I could rank the things I found impressive about this place it would be first and foremost the professionalism and warmth of the staff, the cleanliness of the room and the comfort of the bed, and hotel location. One thing which I felt could be improved was the shower - water pressure could have been stronger. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone visiting, and I would myself return to stay at the hotel.

title: Great location, awesome hotel
text: I spotted The Lex on TripAdvisor by accident, and i'm so glad I did. It's in a great location near Madison Sq Park, near the 4/5/6 and N/Q/R trains. Walking distance to everything if you want. Tons of awesome restaurants nearby. The hotel itself if totally great. Rooms are bigger than average and brand new. And the staff is great. Super find. I plan to stay there again.

title: Fantastic
text:
We stayed at the Lex for 3 nights last week, We could not fault anything about the Hotel. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the hotel is spotless and the rooms was big compared to more expensive hotels in NYC
We were given a room on the second floor at the front of the hotel initially, i was slightly worried that we would be kept awake by the road noise as we had spent the previous 3 nights at another hotel in the city and had not got much sleep.
i went down to reception and the lady kindly  moved me to a room at the rear of the hotel without fuss. We slept like babies every night, it was lovely and quiet and the bed was lovely and comfortable.
Thank You the Lex for making our stay so special.

title: Clean, Modern Gem in NYC
text: Imagine an upscale, chic hotel with sizeable rooms and bathrooms and rates under $300 in NYC.  That's the Lex.  Conveniently located on Lexington and 25th, it's walkable to everywhere, save maybe Tribeca and Wall Street.  Impressed with the friendlilness and helpfulness of the staff.  The hotel has only been opened about 3 months, so everything was in excellent condition and very clean. Some rooms have balconies, but the view isn't much. Still it is nice to have a sliding door and window you can open for "fresh" (it's in NYC remember) air. I would return whenever in NYC

title: Fantastic stay at Lex
text: We had a great 5-day stay at The Lex NYC. Our room was small, but it was nice to have a balcony, esp this time of year. The hotel is fresh and new, still in great shape. Washrooms are immaculately clean and comfortable. I like this place because it has the feel of a 4 or 5 star hotel, but not the price tag, and with all the attractions of downtown Manhattan, this place was a comfortable, quiet place to sleep and unwind. The staff are all super friendly and accommodating, too! We would definitely stay there again.

title: The Lex NYC
text:
friendly / helpful staff; clean, well appointed rooms; decent size for Manhattan
close to Lexington line, walking distance to Flatiron + Greenwich Village; Dos Caminos + Penelope good recommendations!

title: A hidden secret
text:
PRO: Everything! Good room size and excellent room condition. Very helpful and very friendly staff. Fully recommendable.

CON: NOTHING at all (maybe the view from the room to the backyard - but it is NYC, so don't worry!!)

title: Excellent Stay & Reasonable Price
text: Great hotel! I will be back to this hotel for sure. I encourage others to attempt and stay at this hotel. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. Wifi is working great in most locations of the hotel including the room.

title: A very pleasant stay!
text: I was only at the Lex for 1 night, but it proved to be quite enjoyable and comfie.  I can't compliment the staff enough... each one I encountered was like a ray of sunshine and they definitely added value to the overall stay and experience.  Can't wait for their terrace to open up!

title: New, Modern, Wonderful Staff
text:
I booked this hotel for my family of 4.  When we arrived we were shown to the room I had booked--a room with 2 queens.  I was disappointed because it was on the ground floor, and the view was of a cinder block wall.  

I went and spoke with the receptionist, and he said that that was the only double room in the hotel.  I went back to my room, and seriously considered finding a new hotel.  Just then the phone rang.  It was the front desk, telling us that they had two single rooms that adjoined, and saying that they would give us the two rooms for the same price as the room we had booked.

We were so happy and surprised that they were able to accommodate us in this way.  It was the perfect set up--kids in one room, parents in the other.  The rooms were modern, with great showers.  The kids really enjoyed the continental breakfast (with huge croissants and muffins each morning), and the staff was excellent.  My son would go down each morning and talk to the hotel concierge about the best things to do and see in the city, and how to get there.

I especially liked the location--walking distance to Madison Square Park, 5th Ave, the Flat Iron building, and several yummy restaurants including Eataly.  We had a great trip, and would definitely stay here again!

title: Bom colchão, mas a acústica não colabora com o sono...
text: O hotel é novo e o quarto que ficamos, apesar de bem pequeno, tinha um ótimo colchão e ótimos travesseiros. Tudo novo e bem higienizado. O guarda roupa é bem pequeno e a acústica bem ruim. Por duas noites tivemos problemas com os vizinhos de quarto pq ouviamos absolutamente tudo o que diziam... As paredes parecem de papel! O café da manhã é muito simples, conta com apenas maças e bananas, croissant doces e salgados, café e chá, fato que nos gerou um problema porque para nós é nossa principal refeição... Não havia pães, sucos ou frios... A localização... Bom, para quem não vai pela primeira vez para NY, até acho que é boa, mas para quem vai pela primeira vez ou gosta mesmo de ficar pela região da 5º Av e Times Square, prepare os pés (ou o bolso, para taxis) porque fica beeeeeem distante. O ponto alto do hotel é a equipe, sem dúvida. Eles são atenciosos, gentis e generosos. Tratam o hóspede com respeito e muita gentileza!!

title: Perfect Location, Wonderful Staff
text:
Totally enjoyed a three day stay. Room was clean and fresh, crisp linens,  comfortable bed and most important- quiet.
Bathroom was much larger than any other hotel I've visited. Simple continental breakfast.
I would highly recommend and plan to stay again.

title: Hotel superestimado.
text:
Ficamos neste hotel por 10 dias.
Bom hotel, novo, muito limpo, boa TV de plasma, wifi sem custos, quartos muito pequenos, com um  minúsculo armário para roupas.
Pessoal de recepção e camareiras são ótimos, muito atenciosos.
Localização: É boa, se vc gosta de caminhar, mas fica longe de tudo... vai acabar gastando mais com táxi.
Café da manhã muito ruim.
O pior do hotel é o isolamento acústico interno, MUITO RUIM, você ouve tudo o que o acontece no quarto ao lado em alto e bom som.

title: Gutes Hotel
text:
Zwei Nächte war ich in diesem Hotel in der Nähe des Madison Square Parks. Die nächste U-Bahnstation ist fünf Minuten zu Fuß entfernt und damit etwas weiter weg, als bei einem Hotel in der Nähe des Times Square. Den Times Square selbst erreicht man zu Fuß allerdings auch in gut 15 Minuten. Das Hotel bietet sich also gut für die Stadterkundung an. Zumal sich Manhattan auch Nachts sehr sicher anfühlt. Die Zimmer sind relativ klein, dafür aber modern und gut ausgestattet (Fön, Kleiderschrank, großer Fernseher usw. vorhanden). Jeden Tag gibt es zudem eine kostenlose Wasserflasche auf das Zimmer.
Das Hotelpersonal ist sehr freundlich. Insgesamt bietet nur das doch sehr magerer Frühstück einen Grund zur Kritik, außer etwas Obst, Croissants, Muffins und Kaffee wird nichts geboten.

title: Perfect place for Manhattan visit
text:
I stayed there for 9 days. Very good location. Perfect and helpfull staff !!! - thanks guys ! 
Clean, safe, friendly place to stay in NY.
Good continental breakfast (coffe, de-cofee, tee, cookies, fruits) 
If I ever would be in NY again for sure I will stay there !

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights while she was apartment hunting.  The room was comfortably clean, the bathroom was a good size, the bed comfortable, the breakfast adequate.  The thing I liked the most however was the staff.  They were friendly and helpful, and greeted me by name each time I entered the building.  Loved the generous supply of wAter bottles too!

title: Accoglienza straordinaria
text:
La permanenza al The Lex NYC è stata un'esperienza sicuramente positiva e da consigliare.
Il personale, davvero di straordinaria disponibilità e cortesia, ci ha messo a disposizione una stanza lontano dal traffico e dai rumori. La stanza era pulita, moderna, con un bel bagno nuovo, accessoriata di tutto il necessario come in un Hotel di categoria superiore, compreso ferro e asse da stiro. Il nostro viaggio si è svolto alla fine di maggio, quindi dopo il freddo e prima del caldo. 
L'unico reale difetto dell'Hotel è l'impianto di climatizzazione in camera, troppo rumoroso e poco regolabile nella potenza del flusso. Se fosse stata estate o inverno sarebbe stato un problema, non solo per il rumore, ma anche per la turbolenza d'aria che si crea nella stanza (molto piccola come la maggior parte delle stanze d'albergo a NY). Nel nostro caso abbiamo potuto tenerlo spento, quindi tutto è andato bene. 
Non c'è una sala colazione, che è servita sul bancone all'ingresso della Hall e bisogna pazientare un po' che si liberi qualche posto, ma considerando che si tratta di un tre stelle e che, contrariamente a quanto di solito succede a NY, offre la colazione, va bene così. Troverete giusto qualche croissant, frutta, latte e caffè. Non aspettatevi un'american breakfast, ma va bene comunque per partire alla scoperta della città. Per il resto l'Hotel è molto pulito, la posizione è buona, vicino alla metro e a molte attrazioni raggiungibili a piedi. Il personale di reception è pronto a dare buoni consigli per qualunque esigenza.
Un'avvertenza per i soggetti sensibili, e non attribuibile in alcun modo all'Hotel: Manhattan è infestata dai ratti che spesso, alla sera, fanno capolino fra i sacchi della spazzatura che vengono lasciati (qui come nella 5th Avenue!) per il ritiro sui marciapiedi vicino all'ingresso!

title: A gem of a place
text:
We really enjoyed our 4-night stay last week here.  

Pros:  
SUPER staff, friendly, helpful, anticipated our every need.
CLEAN.  Bathroom, room, carpets were all very clean.
WATER.  Loved the bottled water that appeared bedside every day.
Wine & cheese on Tuesday night!  Nice spread.
BREAKFAST:  good supply of coffee, fruit & pastries (the pain au chocolat was my fave.)
STREET NOISE was MINIMAL.  I don't know where the other posters live who complained, but NYC is loud.  This place is in a quiet area and across the street from an Armory.  It was very quiet at night & didn't disrupt our sleep AT ALL.  We were on the Lexington side, btw.

CONS
The walls ARE thin.  Thank God our neighbors were fairly quiet.  We could see that this might be an issue.  Ask for a room ending in "01" or "04" --- that way, you'll only have neighbors on one side of you.
ONE CHAIR.  There was only one chair in this tiny room, so one of us had to sit on the bed.  Yes, the rooms are small, but there was so much to love about this place, that we'd stay here again, if the price & timing were right.

All in all, a GREAT find.

title: Absolut empfehlenswert!
text: Bereits bei unserer Ankunft wurden wir sehr zuvorkommend behandelt. Kaum auf dem Zimmer folgte auch schon der Anruf durch die Rezeption, um sich zu erkundigen ob alles okay sei oder noch etwas benötigt werden würde. Der tolle Service zog sich über unseren kompletten Aufenthalt hindurch. Dienstags zwischen 5 und 7 wird zudem noch Wein und Käse in der kleinen Lobby gereicht. Das Frühstück ist zwar überschaubar aber völlig ausreichend. Die Lage ist top, die Zimmer sind schlicht aber fein eingerichtet. Wasserflaschen stehen kostenlos bereit. Das Wlan ist ebenfalls for free. Bis auf die etwas dünnen Wände (die mich jetzt aber nicht vom Schlafen abgehalten haben) ein tiptop Hotel!

title: Best of the boutique hotels in NYC - great location, great staff!
text:
I've stayed in Manhattan many times and this is the best little hotel I've ever stayed in.  The room is small, but plenty big enough for my purposes.  Huge TV (that I never watched; who watches TV on a NYC vacation?).  The bed and pillows were absolute heaven - so clean and super comfy.  Bathroom was sparkling and very pretty with all necessary amenities and great powerful shower.  
The location is ideal, on Lexington between 25th and 26th in a quiet neighborhood and easy walking distance to Times Square, Penn and Grand Stations as well as a couple of lovely parks: Madison Square and Washington Square (both of which always have fun events on weekends). 
The staff are all really friendly and go out of their way to be helpful.

title: Clean, Modern room wth Excellent Service
text:
The Lex hotel has only recently openned and is on Lexington Avenue between 25th and 26th Streets. 

First of all, location -  It is about a mile and a half from Times Square and all of the attractions there, making it a $10-$15 cab ride (including tip) or 45-50 min walk away.  The Lex is also right next to the Number 6 line (lesss than 5 min walk away) which can take you straight to Grand Central Station, downtown to the Brooklyn Bridge or uptown to Central Park and Museum Row.  So while it may seem a little out of the way it really isn't once you learn to get around. Additionally, there are plenty of restaraunts located nearby and if you are a fan of Curry this place is right next to Little India so you can take your pick of about 10-15 different Indian restaraunts.  Finally if you want a good Espresso, Stix Cafe is just up and around the corner on 23rd Street.

Next, the Room - The room is small but that is apparently the way it is in New York City.  Having said that it is modern, clean and well appointed.  The Bed is of a good standard and the 40" Samsung LCD in the room means that staying in, for what ever reason, is pretty comfortable.  The bathroom is also in great condition with a very good shower (with half size tub) and well appointed basin. Here they have also made good use of space so you don't feel like you are shuffling around and making it quite easy to get yourself ready for your time travelling around New York.

Finally, the hotel and staff.  The Hotel itself is fairly basic, there is no hotel restaurant, fitness room or any other type of ammenity.  It has a lobby that is easily accessable from the street, and always manned, and your room - that is it.  But if you just need somewhere to stay in New York that is all you need.  The hotel does do Breakfast in the lobby every morning , where you can get a cup of coffee and a pastry, and also does  welcome drinks on a Tuesday night.. 

This brings me to the best thing about this hotel - the Staff. The staff were attentive, informative, friendly and ever ready to help.  If you need advice on anything New York they are happy to provide;  every time you come back from your travels around the city they are there to welcome you back; and if you need help or anything is lacking in your room, they fix it immediately.  I cannot emphasise enough how good they were.  

Overall this is an Excellent boutique hotel - you get a great room, with great service at a great price.  You need to work a little to get around but once you have it sorted it is easy.  This is not the Ritz, so you don't get a heap of other ammenities, but I found it to be a great place to base myself for a week exploring NYC.

title: Very clean, nicely decorated, reasonably priced.
text: We were very happy with this hotel and will definitely stay here again.  Very pleasant and good size room; nicely decorated; very clean and comfortable; good price; friendly and helpful staff; good area; 20 minute walk from GCT.

title: My birthday celebration at The Lex NYC...
text: I loved the hotel and the decor but what i loved most about it was the staff, especially Nick Fanourgiakis who is the Front Manager.   He made sure my stay was memorable and fun which was exactly the experience i had.  The staff was so welcoming and they all made sure to wish me a happy birthday during my stay.  It made me feel special and not just another customer like the other hotels.  I would highly recommend this hotel during your stay in New York City!

title: Boutique hotel
text:
I stayed at this hotel recently on business travel. The one thing that was consistent is that the guests are HAPPY staying at this hotel. It really made me wish I was traveling for pleasure but what can you do!
The staff to each guest was so accommodating and I just wanted to take a moment to note my experience. Nick  made my stay. Omar made my colleague's stay and I am so thankful. My colleague and I were preparing for a stressful meeting and I arrived much earlier than the team, Nick made sure that I had a place to work and connect online. Our presentations were delivered to the wrong hotel, Omar went to that hotel and picked up our presentations so that we didn't have to worry. 
The hotel sits off the beaten path but still is 1 block from Park Avenue so, if you want the feel of a downtown hotel and still want to be near the park, shops and restaurants, this is a great choice.

title: Clean, Cheap & Lovely Staff
text:
My dad booked this hotel for our five day trip in NYC.
The rooms are basic but perfect for the fact we only spent time in them to sleep, they are modern, clean and comfortable. exactly what you need after a long day of sight seeing in NYC.
My dad had a very small room compared to mine with no bath (just shower) and no wardrobe; also he could hear through to the other rooms. My room on the other hand was great spacious and I heard no noise at all from other rooms.
Breakfast is a pick up and go type of option but it suits the sight seeing type, the staff are extremely accommodating and know the area like the back of their hands, so can help with local attractions.
I would stay at the Lex hotel again and I would recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable, modern and clean place to stay in central Manhattan.

title: Excellent experience...we will go back
text: First of all, the front desk staff was very friendly and attentive. Our room was huge with high ceilings and  plenty of space for 4 people. The beds were comfortable, bathroom was sparkling clean. We had no issue with noise. They served a light continental breakfast in lobby for a "grab and go".  We will definitely stay again next time we are in the city as is suited all of our needs.

title: ALTAMENTE RECOMENDABLE!!!
text: Estuvimos una semana disfrutando de esa hermosa y sorprendente ciudad como lo es New York y nos hospedamos en el Hotel LEX, lo contratamos por una página española (voyageprive) en principio dudamos porque no habían muchos comentarios respecto del mismo, pero como es nuevo, consideramos que sería ese el motivo, no solo es nuevo, sino que es IMPECABLE, su limpieza, el buen personal que tiene, todos nos atendieron con mucha cordialidad, siempre dispuestos ante cualquier solicitud, las habitaciones si bien son medianas, son muy cómodas y todo su mobiliario y equipamiento nuevos! La ubicación nos pareció muy buena, una zona segura, hay lugares cercanos donde comprar alimentos o bebidas, el metro está a unas pocas cuadras y puedes caminar desde el hotel disfrutando de esa sorprendente ciudad! El desayuno y wifi es para destacar ya que la mayoría de los hoteles no los incluyen en sus tarifas. Seguramente volveremos!!!!

title: Flatters to Deceive
text:
Stayed at this hotel very recently. The room was adequate but had no drawers for clothes, had paper thin walls and no double glazing, hence very noisy. Bathroom was adequate. Breakfast consisted of croissant and muffins plus coffee or tea, served in paper cups, paper plates and plastic utensils. All this is located in Hotel lobby, seating is on high chairs, some of which are  real health risk.
The staff are marvellous, very helpful and friendly.
The location is good but not great.
Trip Advisor has this Hotel vastly overated.

title: 5 star stay on a budget
text: Quiet, good size room (for NYC!).  Comfortable bed and excellent bathroom (with bathtub).  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Good mid-town location, walking distance to both lower villages and times square.  For the low-end price, this hotel is outstanding value and would recommend highly to anyone.  We were lucky to stay on the top floor room 705 which has a small balcony and great city views.

title: Gran elección!
text:
Me decidí por este hotel del que no había muchas referencias porque es nuevo y a mi llegada tenía algunas dudas. Pero me gustó mucho y estoy satisfecho por haberlo elegido. Es un hotel sobrio, nuevo, la habitación no era pequeña (en NY son muy pequeñas), tranquilo, muy limpio y el personal encantador. Desde el primer momento me trataron muy bien.
La ubicación está bien. Muy cerca de dos paradas de metro y al lado del Flatiron. Rodeado de restaurantes y es una zona tranquila.
En mi próxima visita no descarto volver a este hotel ya que me encantó y lo recomiendo.

title: Very good!
text:
Abbiamo passato una decina di giorni al Lex Hotel e ci siamo trovati benissimo: posizione ideale per gli spostamenti, stanze accoglienti e sempre pulite, personale giovane e gentilissimo.
Colazione libera con ottimi muffin e vista sulla Lexington Av. Consigliatissimo!

title: Boutique price, budget experience. High tripadvisor ranking misleading!
text:
Trip advisor always served us well in the past. But I am very disappointed this time.
The biggest problem is the noise. 
The wall is paper thin, but it is bearable as the other guests will not be chatting all the time. 
The TRAFFIC NOISE outside however is horrendous, non-stop. 
Room is TINY.  Okay for single occupancy. For couples like us, we could not unpack properly as the the storage is limited - wardrobe is small, the hanging rail is shorter than the depth of the wardrobe (not deep by any means), there were no drawers for underwear ....
There is no kettle, no microwave, not even a drinking glass in the room. If you want a hot drink, you have to to go out.
Location is not that great, being on the 24th east street. 
The positives: The staff are polite, the room is clean.
Ps, I did ask for a quiet room, but it was not available unless I was prepared to sleep underground.  I was given a room close to the elevator. 
Overall the hotel fell short on sleep quality, in-room facility by a long chalk, especially with a price tag of over $350 a night.

title: Fantastic boutique hotel in NOMAD!
text:
We stayed over Easter weekend and really enjoyed our time here.
We got in early and check in was a breeze.
The hotel staff are so nice and helpful, it really makes all the difference in the level of service! They really went out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed our time there.
We stayed in a Queen room with a comfortable bed, decent sized room with a large bathroom (bonus hair dryer!), and good sized closet.
They also offer a complimentary continental breakfast with fresh pastries + coffee which was lovely! 
Great location, near Madison Square park (Shakeshack!) and Eataly and Flatiron are a few blocks away!  
Convenient location and close to the subway.  Honestly,  I would stay here again, it was quiet at night and that's important in a city that never sleeps!  We walked to 34th and beyond *shopaholics* and found it really reasonable to walk/cab it to and from the hotel, quite convenient! 
Close to Park Ave and some great coffee spots (Fika) etc. 

Can't go wrong with this hotel, I'd highly recommend it! :)

title: Amazing Hotel in a fantastic location
text:
Just returned from a week's stay at the Lex NYC, and it was a fantastic experience all round. The room was of a decent size, and spotlessly clean. 

The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome, offering advice on airport transports, places to eat and drink and the like.

Location wise it is exactly what we wanted, mid-town Manhattan meaning you are very well connected and a short ride away from most attractions, and it is a fairly cheap and straightforward journey using public transport to JFK.

Would definitely return.

title: Incredible Find
text: I go to New York a few times a year for business.  When attempting to book a hotel for a recent trip everything was priced out of sight.  I found The Lex online and after reading other reviews for the hotel decided to give it a try.  I was not disappointed.  I felt welcomed from the moment I stepped into the hotel.  The staff are very friendly and competent.  The room was very nicely appointed and comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great, new hotel in fabulous location!
text: I visit New York about 6 to 8 times for year for both business and pleasure. This hotel was shiny and new with very comfortable beds and fabulously friendly staff. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to my friends and colleagues.

title: Excellent hotel with a personal touch
text: Lovely boutique hotel where u were not just a room number. Staff very friendly and complimentary breakfast a nice touch. We had a Superior Queen Room which gave us plenty of room. Location great less than 10 mins walk to subway line 6 for uptown to grand Central Station Rockerfeller Central Park etc and downtown to Brooklyn Bridge Wall Street Staten Island Ferry etc.Would highly recommend this hotel if u don't want to stay in an impersonal skyscraper. Mr. Mrs Pass

title: Ein tolles Stadthotel in NYC
text:
Wir waren zum zweiten Mal in NYC. Dieses Hotel ist echt klasse. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Hotel allgemein und die Zimmer sind sehr neuwertig und modern eingerichtet. Unser Bad war echt spitze. Der Service war einem fünf Sterne Hotel gleich.
Es gab jeden Morgen ein kleines aber sehr gutes Frühstück in der Lobby.
Als kleinen Minuspunkt kann ich nur die dünnen Wände und die lauten Zimmertüren erwähnen.
Insgesamt kann man sagen, dass dieses Hotel echt spitze ist. Mehr Hotel braucht man nicht.

title: enjoy!!
text: The extreme kindness,friendliness and availability of all the staff, the great location, the clean and confortable rooms, the nice and modern design of the hotel and of the furnishing, the lovely way to do breakfast in the hall watching out the life of NY, so it feels like home!

title: basic, lacks many services, but shining new. and it shows!
text: The Lex Nyc is located on the way to south Manhatten, between 25th & 26th streets. to get to Times Squere, you must walk 20 blocks, or take the sub, and so are other main attractions. around the hotel are an army building and Baruch College, Union Squere is not far, and so is Madison Squere Garden. All in all - location is good. The hotel is small, services are basic. Rooms are small but not dense. NF&B, but, unlike most hotels in NY (and other big cities in the USA), it serves a complimentary continental breakfast of pastry, hot beverages and fruits. A nice way to start the day. The highlight of the hotel is that it is brand new. And it shows: everything is shining new, staff is very friendly and willing to assist in everything. Accomodation rates  in Manhattan are high. Very high. The Lex NYC offers a shiningly new boutique hotel in a nice location - at a reasonable price. Therefore, despite some understandable shortcommings - I'd reccomend.

title: A Tina Turner Hotel
text: Simply the Best. If you want to be lower mid mid town 23rd - 24th just south east of grand central this property has to be at the top of your list. Staff are most helpful with many suggestions to fit your interests. Simply the Best.

title: Compact, convenient, clean and comfortable
text: My husband and I recently spent 4 delightful nights at the Lex, while enjoying a vacation in NYC. Our experience was quite positive- the staff could not have been more helpful, the hotel was conveniently located and our room was sparkling clean. Although compact, the room was set efficiently, with built in furniture and wardrobe. The bed was quite comfortable and the linens were crisp and clean. My only concern was the way sound carried between the bathrooms (conversations could be heard quite clearly) and occasionally between the rooms themselves. This was not enough to mar a very positive experience. We would absolutely stay at the Lex again, and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable hotel that is clean, comfortable and well staffed.

title: Very satisfied
text:
I had a great experience at this hotel, the staff was warm and friendly at hello, willing to help with every single question. As soon as we got in the room they called us from the reception to make sure all was well with the room.

Location is KEY without exaggerating. Just a stone's throw from Madison Park, Empire State building, Gramercy Park and a ton of good restaurants.
There are a number of parking garages close by too where you can leave your car overnight at a fair price ($25-30)

The rooms are very clean-this building is actually brand new- and the overall feeling is that of a modern progressively decorated hotel.

I can definitely see myself going back there...

title: perfetto.....
text: logisticamente perfetto, nelle vicinanze c'è tutto il necessario per passare una vacanza in un quartiere tranquillo ma centrale della grande mela. Le maggiori attrazioni sono raggiungibili a piedi e la metro e vicinissima. Stanze nuovissime, ben arredate, bagno vivibile, forse un pò piccole ma nello standard di nyc. Punto di forza il personale che ti aiuta in ogni tua piccola esigenza....spostamenti, prenotazioni, consigli, davvero un valore aggiunto notevole.....special tanks at director Nik, thanks for all, for this and i hope for the further.....saluti

title: a little treasure in a big city
text: this boutique hotel should train the five star hotels in nyc how to treat and take care of there guests ... the rooms where spotless ... the check inn was perfect and easy ... i requested a early check inn and a room away from the elevator ... they did both ... the bathroom was clean and roomy ... the internet and tv where terrific .... and the bed is on the back of my suv it was so comfortable .... i am so glad i chose this hotel for a two stay ... i will be back and i hope they do well at the lex nyc ...

title: Great little secret in NYC
text:
Great little boutique hotel that's nicely located for all sorts of things. Madison Square Park and the Flatiron building are a couple of blocks away, etc, etc.  Great service, nice rooms - compact, so beware if you're expecting a grand suite!

No in-house catering apart from a little breakfast in the morning, but plenty of restaurants around and when you check in you'll get a list of recommended ones.

Fantastic staff, clean and great value.

title: Friendly staff
text:
Just returned today from a 5 night stay at the Lex our first trip to NYC. Great hotel good location. 
Very friendly staff all very helpful. A big thank you to Armando for his help with directions and must-dos. Each morning we had a question for him he gave us good advise. 
Our room was great cleaned everyday also clean towels everyday. We would recommend this hotel to any of our friends looking to visit NYC.

title: 5 Stars for Value and Nice Staff
text:
Here's the skinny on this hotel:

Value = 5 stars great price for it's quality and location in NYC. This hotel was $350 when the W down the block during the same times was $700 per night

Staff = 5 stars. It's a new hotel, had been open a month when I stayed. The staff was great, did everything you needed and proactively checked in. Great stuff, they care

Location = easy. Midtown, walkable to lots of things and subway.

Rooms = 4 stars. Nice rooms. My only issue was that I was there when it was still cold (snowing in mid April). The heater is a wall unit, and while it worked just fine, the fan on the heater was really loud. I had noise canceling headsets that I could sleep with so it didn't really bother me that much, but if I didn't have those I could see that being a problem. I did tell the front desk on my departure and they said they would check the fan level.

title: Awesome Staff - Nice Hotel
text: Recently stayed at the Lex for a few nights during my first trip to NYC -- the hotel was nice but the staff was AMAZING! They were extremely helpful with directions and local must-dos while I was in the city -- also just fun people to be around which made a huge difference. Thanks guys!

title: Great Well Located Boutique Hotel
text:
The Lex is a new property, so right off the bat you are getting clean fresh rooms and hallways - always a plus in NYC. And while the rooms are not at all large (it is NYC after all) they are well designed and very functional with a modern hip decor. 

The location in NoMad turned out to be fantastic. Lots of great dining choices were nearby along with shopping and hip culture. We easily walked to Flatiron, Chelsea, SoHo, East Village and more. The subway was just a few blocks away, and the 6 line was a great route up and down the East side of town. We rarely needed to transfer.

Most of all, the staff were extremely friendly and knowledgable. It's nice being greeted by name and sincerely being asked how everything is going. They knew the area well and made some nice recommendations. It's the kind of service you simply won't get at The Marriott Marquis!

Two mild negatives - the climate system was a little loud and tended to vary in noise level even with the fan in the "on" position. Also - the shampoo was awful; it reminded me of gefilte fish jelly. However, those are minor distractions. I would easily stay at The Lex again!

title: Great Personalized Hotel
text: I recently stayed at the Lex and greatly enjoyed it. The staff was incredibly attentive from check-in to checkout. There was even a handwritten note on the desk, along with a gift bag of delicious chocolates. My room was a great size for a single traveler and had all the amenities that I was looking for, namely free and fast wifi. I'd recommend the Lex to anyone who is looking for a great location, price, and a more personal hotel experience.

title: Recent Business Trip
text: I stayed for 2 nights in April 2014. The staff was very courteous and offered excellent restaurant options in the area. Fortunately, the area has several great restaurants, all within walking distance. The neighborhood was great as well. Close to convenient stores, food, and the subway. The room was very clean and had everything I needed. It was quiet and blocked out the lights as well. I'd recommend it for anyone looking for a business or personal trip to NYC. Great location too. Close to uptown, midtown, downtown.

title: New hotel, great service
text:
My wife and I stayed here for two nights. We booked at a very good rate, at a time when there were no reviews yet because the hotel was so new. When we checked in the hotel had been open for only four weeks.

Physically, the newness shows. Fixtures are all sparkling and the modern rooms are all fresh and well kept. For NYC, the rooms was fairly spacious and the bathroom was downright palatial. Decoration wise the rooms are a bit spartan but that's a style choice that fits with the modern decor. There weren't a lot of frills but what the hotel does, it does very well. Bed was comfortable and the neighborhood was quiet at night. 

Surprisingly, given how new the hotel is, the staff was tops. They were all very cheerful and helpful, quick with a greeting and ready to help.

I would stay here again.

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per 6 notti tra la fine di Marzo ed inzio Aprile.
La posizione è perfetta per visitare la città: l'hotel infatti è a 5 minuti a piedi dalla metro e volendo muoversi a piedi è bene o male equidistante dai principali punti di interesse.
Il personale è molto disponibile e di grande supporto nell'organizzazione di spostamenti e visite. 
Le stanze sono piccole (ma come nella maggior parte degli hotel a New York), ma pulitissime e arredate con gusto moderno e sobrio. Non è presente il frigo bar (solo su esplicita richiesta e con costo aggiuntivo) e la finestra non ha doppi vetri quindi si può rischiare di non essere nel totale silenzio. Noi eravamo al settimo piano quindi non siamo stati disturbati da rumori provenienti dalla strada, ma consiglio di richiedere esplicitamente stanza su piani alti per avere la garanzia di non essere disturbati.
La colazione è di qualità ma un po' povera nella scelta (solo frutta, muffin e cornetti, caffè e tè). Non esiste una sala colazione, ma il tutto avviene nella hall, con possibilità di appoggiarsi ad un bancone, seduti su sgabello, con vista strada, in pieno stile delle caffetterie americane.

title: John O Brien
text: We stayed for seven nights in the Lex Boutique Hotel recently, on a trip from Ireland, and had a great experience. The staff were open, friendly and helpful. We had a great room, spacious, big bed, bathroom, TV, WiFi. The breakfast was casual, but very good, we skipped most mornings as we went out and had it in one of the many great places for breakfast close buy. It is a great location, whether one wants to go "up" or "down" town, loads of great places to eat just by the hotel. The manager Mathew was always there in the morning, and willing to help with anything, as were who whoever was on duty. I would solidly recommend it.

title: Fantástico hotel y mejor personal
text: Hemos pasado 5 noches en el hotel Lex y ha sido genial. Está recién inaugurado, todo nuevo y limpio. El personal es encantador, sobre todo Armando que nos ayudó con todo a la llegada al hotel. La ubicación es perfecta, muy cerca del edificio Flatiron. Repetiremos seguro. Totalmente recomendable.

title: lovely staff
text: It was a great night staff, like most NYC hotels this was small but very modern, clean and an amazing staff who were great from the time I checked in till the time I left. It was truly  wonderful stay and I will honestly go back

title: Excellent staff, good location, great price!
text:
I stayed at this Hotel during what turned out to be their first week of operation while on business in the Flatiron area of NYC. The Hotel offered much more than I expected for the price range- brand new large Samsung flat TV with great HD service, really great WiFi for free, and coffee and pastries in the morning, also for no charge. Bathroom was clean and new and hot water was plentiful.

The best part of the stay, however, was after I had to stay elsewhere on Thursday night for a meeting outside the City but checked in again on Friday night before my Saturday flight. It turns out that I had left a favorite shirt behind and had no idea that I did so. The general manager of the Hotel, Matt, not only made sure that my shirt was kept aside for my return, but even greeted me at the desk when I checked in again to return the shirt to me in person. After a few minutes chatting with Matt, I felt as if I had been staying at the Hotel for years despite it being less than a week old (and my second stay). 

The entire staff was also very friendly and helpful, and seemed to remember my name every time I walked through lobby. I've been to a few new hotels over the years that were still pretty rough in their first month open, but this location seemed to be completely organized and running on all cylinders.

I will definitely be staying at this Hotel again whenever I return to this area for business or personal reasons- the Hotel itself is great and personal service of the staff will ensure that I remember this Hotel for my next visit to NYC.
